summary: Listen to songs, play podcasts, create playlists and discover music you'll love

scraped_reviews.content: Great streaming app. 2 things I wish they would add, one, a "dislike" button to compliment the heart. Hiding songs isn't the same. Makes playlists shorter by just not playing a song, and doesn't solve the problem of a not liked song showing up on playlists. It just gets grayed out and skipped. Let me dislike the song and just don't waste a spot on my Playlist with it. Secondly, the my DJ thing would be so much better if it didn't consistently cut off 30 seconds to a minute of most songs
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi! Thank you for sharing your thoughts with us. We will ensure that your feedback reaches the appropriate team. We also suggest that you contribute your ideas to our 'Ideas Board' at community.spotify.com. Simply navigate to the Menu > Ideas. This way, others can vote or join the discussion to express their support.

scraped_reviews.content: At this point, just make Spotify a paid app cause instead of two ads, it's three, sometimes even FOUR. says 30 mins without ads, but it's like 5 mins, adds random songs in my Playlist, can only skip 6 songs each hour, and can't see what song is up next. a little update!! I love listening to music!! but I got 5 ads in a row. And I am not paying for Spotify premium.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Thanks for the feedback ‚Äì we appreciate it! We always aim to improve, so we‚Äôll get this passed on to the right team. You can also let us know what you think over at our Community: https://community.spotify.com/

scraped_reviews.content: Edit: Back then the app let you have full range to what you listen to without shuffle, it was amazing and I'd always listen to music on this app almost all the time. They let us play a few playlists without shuffle, now we can't. I wouldn't mind if they made us watch a bit more ads, I'd just like that free range of control I had back then. It WAS an amazing app to back then. I'm just upset with how it changed. I think I'll just stick with Pandora from now on, they never treated me like this.üòî

I've been using this app to listen to music for a few years now it's a great app, but there are a couple of problems that come with it. 1. I want to click on a song so I can listen to it after the ads, but then it tells me to get premium. It is also the same thing for when I want to unshuffle playlist. I make a playlist in the order I want and Spotify comes and ruins it. 2. They "claim" to give you 30 minutes of "uninterrupted listening", however they give me an ad after a couple of songs.

Disappointing. I was enjoying the app for a while, and then I got kept getting messages saying, "Your premium preview is almost over" or something similar, even though I had never asked for a free trial; now that it's over, I can't even loop songs and there's an unskippable ad after almost every song followed by another sort of ad that lies to you, saying, "Enjoy your next 30 mins of ad free listening" that you can't skip either. Sadly, this is typical and I am not surprised, hence the 3 stars.

Daniel EksüëéAfter many years of waiting, Spotify still doesn't have usable landscape orientation support. Also, it's getting buggier by the day. When I tap to play a track, it plays an entirely different song. Sometimes the app displays different song information than what is playing. Overall, the design seems to have forgotten core music playback and playlist organization features entirely. There are lots of other random features I don't use instead of really well polished music player basics.

I love Spotify, been using it for years but these recent changes have been extremely annoying. If I'm already a premium user why do I have to pay extra for audio books? Especially with how expensive things have gotten. Also the app crashes way too much,and I have to wait for my already downloaded songs to load. Spotify is focused on the wrong things which seems like a lot of the time. They're definitely trying to have their cake and eat it too.

I am so tired of this app. It gets more and more expensive. I had premium and it advertises audiobooks with your subscription, but only allows so many hours before it wants more money. cancelled premium bc I only listen to podcasts that have ads built in, forgot my alarm was set to my spotify Playlist. instead of a song, I woke up to 6 consecutive ads I had to listen to to get back to my podcast, to listen to more ads. Total garbage.

Love the app! Good music variety. Lyrics are pretty in sync with every song. This also has a wide variety of podcasts. Edited: This kinda sucks. I was using it for a month, and I was able to skip any song, pick what song I wanted to listen to, and listen offline. I wasn't even paying for premium. Now I wake up, and it all changes. I can't skip as much as I could, and I can't pick out a specific song. AND THERE ARE SO MANY ADDS. GOOD GOD. The fact that I can't skip as much is ridiculous.üëé

At $12/month this app shouldn't have the issues it has. It crashes, replays a handful of songs back to back even though I have hours of listening time, sometimes doesn't have the lyrics, and doesn't play/cont. whatever Playlist I was listening to. Sometimes when I want to use classic shuffle it'll insert songs as if I'm using smart shuffle. At this point, either I go back to Pandora or I use Spotify's free option (if it still exists). I hate it when apps work worse once I start paying for them.

Unreliable app. I have my music downloaded so I can use when there is no service, but Spotify app freezes SO often. This is a recent issue, so hopefully I can get that fixed. There's also poor syncing across devices, making me have to delete EVERYTHING and redownload to see all of my liked songs again. pst, why is there a single button at the top of the library that can instantly delete all downloaded songs with no window asking if I meant to hit it?üôÉ
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi. Thanks for letting us know. Can you try clearing the data, uninstall again your current app and redownload directly from the Google Play Store to refresh things? If that doesn't help, you can get in touch with our Customer Service by heading to support.spotify.com and searching "Contact us".

scraped_reviews.content: I can't stand this damn app. Without premium it's so annoying, there are ads after like every three songs, only recently did free users get the option to actually pick songs they want to listen to but it still forces you to use shuffle unless you pay. I remember when they made it so you have limited time to look at lyrics which I don't know if it still has that because I stopped looking at the lyrics because of that. There's no way you need to do that so ppl get premium and also have 1000 ads

Free version is almost unusable. Good grief! 4 ads in a row then it tells me I can enjoy 30 minutes ad free. 2 songs later here are 4 more ads. At first I figured maybe a weird glitch. Nope. It's happens several times over the last few days. And on top of the that the ads are horrible. They're louder than your music so it's very jarring especially if you're listening to something chill, and they're repetitive. I can't listen to specific songs, everything is behind a pay wall now.

Changing my rating to a 3 star. Too many ads now, tells you here's a ¬Ω hour of ad free play and plays an ad after the 1st or 2nd song. 80% of the time, when I skip a track, an ad comes on. Starting to be like all the other apps. Still not fixed as of 6/24/2025 & now we are forced to warch ads. can't search or anything. pauses as soon as you back out to search. Come on guys! This is getting more & more ridiculous!
scraped_reviews.replyContent: We're sorry to hear this, and we'll pass your feedback along to the Ads team. For an ad-free experience, we'd recommend checking out our Premium plans. If you've never had Premium before, you should be eligible for our trial. You can also check out other deals by heading over to spotify.com/premium.

scraped_reviews.content: there are multiple things wrong with it, though it does have a lot of music it's hard to get to that music you want because of how it's set up. When I try to get a song it plays a different song from "things we added" which is really just a way to get money so you get so annoyed that you pay for premium. It plays other songs before it plays your song and it only lets you skip five times, it also adds things to your own playlist when you try to create one. I won't be using this app anymore.

mediocre for listening for long durations. if you have shuffle on, it will continue to feed you the same songs every 6 songs or so. If I've heard the song in the last two hours, don't play it. UI is okay, although the "dj" feature is a joke.. podcasts never play the video after you've downloaded it. however, if you're listening in short spurts and not trying to watch podcasts, it does the job.

This company has just the worst software. It is slow to load and not very responsive. I click to play a different song and it takes 5 seconds to switch songs, if it does it at all. Constantly disconnects from connected devices. I move a song in the playlist and it bounces around, sometimes returning back to original position. The AI DJ just plays the same songs over and over and the voice is obnoxious. Some of these bugs have been in the software for nearly 10 years and still not fixed.

"30mins of free listening after this ad" Four minutes later, I get even more ads. Don't lie to me. It has potential but you need premium to get decent features. Even with premium, I'm still having trouble with the app. I used offline mode while I travel for work and half the time my playlists won't play. I tried listening to a podcast and I get "playback failed" even though the episode is downloaded to my phone.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi. We appreciate your feedback, and we'll pass it along to the Ads team. We'd like to investigate this further. If you have the time, feel free to reach out to our Customer Service at support.spotify.com. Just search ‚ÄúContact Us‚Äù, and they'll be happy to help.

scraped_reviews.content: Spotify has become top tier grabage these days. Phone and desktop doesn't sync reliably, can't remember what device it was just streaming to a second ago, doesn't play songs when they're clicked on, plays song when you don't click them but scroll past, their "help" is just full of regurgitated nonsense and they put zero effort into improvement. They corned the market and then went cut corners to make more money. what a surprise.

I LOVE Spotify, and as a user since circa 2013, I like to think I'm think I'm an early adopter and have a lot of experience with the app. That said, the last 6 months it's gone drastically downhill. The app constantly closes with no crash report, it just stops playing and it closes. Sometimes it's playing and the app is not even showing as open, which is fun. Sometimes, it's choppy and that may be a service issue but it's only been happening the last few months. Not sure what's going on!

I only used Spotify to listen to the podcast version of an actual radio show, The Woody Show. Like all shows on the radio, they play snippets of music coming in and out of break. For this ridiculous reason, Spotify has removed them for an extended period of time. Fortunately, there are many other apps out there that work properly, such as the iheart radio app.

The app is absolute garbage, and the fact that they'll want you to verify your age with your ID soon is insane. Practically everything good is blocked by their subscription, and it seems like getting the subscription doesn't help either because it still "smart shuffles" and wont let me pick a different song to hear!! I've been using Spotify for years and with how money hungry they are you'd think the app would be better, but they never improve themselves‚Äîit just gets worse.

If they could stop changing the interface around so much, that'd be cool. The library has always been at the bottom right, and now some "create" button has taken it's place. like why not leave it and put the crate button to the left? I don't want to create, I want my music. Shuffle barely works right anymore. If I switch devices, it starts playing the exact same songs in the exact same order the first time I hit play. It won't let you just reshuffle unless you physically go in and hit a song.

Great for making playlist, variety of podcasts and limitless on stories and news cast. I honestly have had Spotify for 6 years now and have enjoyed everything about it. Update: Unsure what has changed at least this year (2025) but the algorithm is use to do would recommend different songs but now it feels like it replays ones I listen to often. Also you only have 15 hours for audiobooks per month. I did not realize that until I hit the limit. That's a bummer since most books are longer.

I've been using this for close to 10 years. I've had to edit my review unfortunately. I like listening to podcasts when music just isn't cutting it, but I have to stop now. While I do understand the purpose for ads, but 40 to 50 of them during an episode is ridiculous. I stopped listening to certain podcasts a while back since when I first started listening to them, there were zero ads, and then all of a sudden I'm bombarded with them every 5 min. There's more to say, but I'm very limited.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi! We'll pass this on to our Ads team. Have you tried a quick reinstall? If that doesn't help, you should give our Customer Service a shout. You can find them by heading to support.spotify.com and searching "Contact us". They'll help you report this.

scraped_reviews.content: The app has become bloated. Everything seems to take forever now. Sometimes when trying to play certain songs, it buffers endlessly. When trying to view a large playlist, artists starting after the letter A are not displayed. Using the search function does not help this, as sometimes it simply doesn't work. Queuing is inconsistent, as sometimes I will have songs queued up, and the app will ignore them and shuffle instead when I start playing on a Bluetooth device.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi. Have you tried a quick reinstall? If that doesn't help, we'd recommend reaching out to our Customer Service at support.spotify.com. Just search ‚ÄúContact Us‚Äù, and they'll be happy to help.

scraped_reviews.content: Generally I love Spotify over most other streaming apps. I just started using it for audio books as well since some are included with premium. It's absolutely wild that you "run out of hours" to listen to a book, especially when those limited hours are less than it takes to get through a book. Why offer audiobooks with premium at all if you're going to charge more to keep listening to a book that's "included" with premium?

I've used this platform since 2011, and it seems to get worse every year. I open another app(non-media related) and my queue disappears and stops playing the current song. It's as if Iuninstalled the app and reinstall it every time that happens. But if I close the app and reopen it, the music resumes. And when I open the app after a while, it lags. The team that works on this app need to do better. I'm really close to canceling premium and switching to an app that actually works properly.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi. We'd recommend restarting your device to see if that makes any difference. If that doesn't help, you can get in touch with our Customer Service by heading to support.spotify.com and searching "Contact us".

scraped_reviews.content: The app is driving me crazy. For one, there's an oversaturation of ads -- roughly 2-3 minutes of ads per 3-5 minutes of music. And the ads where it's like "Watch this ad to get 30 minutes of ad-free listening" don't work at all; I just get more normal ads within 5-10 minutes. I'm not buying a membership, Spotify, and your bugs, intentional or not, aren't gonna force me to. Edit: Looked at community page. Solution was to keep the app in focus while the video plays. Problem: I ALREADY HAVE BEEN!
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hey! We hear you, and we'll pass your feedback along to the Ads team. Also, you might be able to find some steps to help with this on our Community. Just head to community.spotify.com and search for "30 mins of uninterrupted listening".

scraped_reviews.content: Genuinely do not understand why there are ads between three songs. The genuine amount of times I've been hit with an advertisement that tells me I'll have 30 free minutes of uninterrupted listening only for an ad to play after two or three songs is ridiculous. Not to mention you cannot do anything without Premium, but it is Expsensive and even if you do buy it and end up needing to cancel it good luck finding out how to do that. They make it near impossible for anyone to cancel a subscription.

This app is good for listening to music. My main gripes are (1) I wish Spotify Premium was cheaper, (2) I don't like that if you go free, you can't listen to audiobooks (even if you do listen to them via Premium, you can only listen for a limited amount of hours), and (3) lately, when I get an ad that says I'll be listening to music for the next 30 min w/o ads, it doesn't keep it's promise and plays more ads in less 5 minutes. Please fix that final bug.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hey there! You can get 30 minutes of ad-free listening by watching a video ad. You just need to keep the video ad in focus, not navigate to another app, browser, etc. Also, make sure that you're not accidentally clicking the "No, thanks" button when prompted to watch the ad. For an ad-free experience, we'd recommend checking out our Premium plans.

scraped_reviews.content: There are so many good things about Spotify, but the performance of this app is not one of them. Many songs simply stop playing, forcing me to dig out my phone, open the app, and start it over. It's like it just forgets what it was doing. If it happens during the "enjoy 30 min of uninterrupted music" after watching an ad, it forgets and the very next thing after the song that gets restarted is an add. Extremely frustrating.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi Matthew! We're sorry to hear you're having trouble. We'd suggest reaching out to our Customer Service team to get help on this. Just search "Contact Us" at https://support.spotify.com/ and they'll be happy to lend you a hand.

scraped_reviews.content: This app is grate and vary easy to navigate. What I do not like about it is the ad's; there are far to many and I can barely go 10 minutes with out an ad. Spotify premium is also over priced, it should not cost 11.99 to listen to ad free music. I also do not like that fact that it says I will have 30 minutes of ad free music after the ad, and then I will have an ad right after. Please fix these issues.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hey! We're sorry to hear this, and we'll pass your feedback along to the Ads team. For an ad-free experience, we'd recommend checking out our Premium plans. If you've never had Premium before, you should be eligible for our trial. You can also check out other deals by heading over to spotify.com/premium.

scraped_reviews.content: Spotify is practically unusable free unless you're on PC. That's the only reason I give an extra star rather than just one. Even when you're on PC, you're getting around 2-4 30-second long ads every few songs even after "30 minutes of ad-free listening". On mobile, you can't turn shuffle off. Every time you go to play a song, it plays just the right amount of songs that AREN'T the song you clicked play for so that you use up all of your 6 free skips for the hour on the songs you had to go past.

Spotify used to be incredible! Now, it's total trash! The connectivity is asteonomcally garbage - I could have 5G UC service, be playing downloaded songs, but Spotify will be constantly interrupted. I'm currently experiencing a complete blackout. I loved the way the queue was set-up, where you could see what was in the queue, & what was playing from the list - it was a large, legible set of tracks; now, it's a "user-friendly" mess, where it's impossible to see the queue, versus the list.

Spotify is a pretty decent music app. It more likely than not has any song you search for, and the design is simple and easy to work with. However, it does have some faults: the ads, and premium. I will get an ad that tells me that the next 30 minutes of listening will be ad free, then two songs later and I get four ads. It's impractical and misleading. There are some perks with Premium, but I should not have to pay to be able to skip songs freely. That's just kinda bogus.

Honestly, just use any other app that provides music streaming. Loading up Spotify to see that my playlist of two thousand or more songs doesn't display properly and can't be edited is beyond frustrating. I spent years building a profile of music that I enjoy, just for the platform I made it on to completely nullify all my progress. Playlists change as the person who created them does; so, being able to edit them, let alone see the tracks in them, is pretty important.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi. We're open to feedback, and we'd love to get some more info about this. If you have the time, give our Customer Service a shout. You can find them by heading to http://support.spotify.com and searching "Contact us".

scraped_reviews.content: I have the free version right now because I can not afford premium. I will get the ad saying "listen for 30 minutes of ad free music" then it literally plays 1 3-4 minute song before I get another 2 minute set of ads. I habe time stamped screen shots to prove this. At this point, I feel as though im listening to more ads than I am music and highly considering switching streaming services. We're getting to a point where I almost can't listen to music unless I pay. Fix it!
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi there, thanks for your feedback. No worries, we'll pass this along to the Ads team. To get the 30-minute ad-free music, be sure to keep the video ad in focus. Don't navigate to another app, browser, etc. Make sure that you're not accidentally clicking the "No, thanks" button as well, when prompted to watch the ad. Hope this helps.

scraped_reviews.content: Just keeps getting WORSE while charging us MORE! Premium service sucks now. You can't add/delete/rearrange songs to the queue anymore. Takes an absolutely insane amount of time for playlists to load now. And it's constantly adding the same songs to the queue... And now there's no way to remove them. Bring back all the premium features and stop taking them away! And the free version is a joke, you use to get 3-4 songs after less than a min of ads, now it's 3-4 min of ads for a song... RIDICULOUS!

I've been using Spotify for almost 10 years. I've noticed that the app no longer shuffles my playlits, so the same songs keep playing over and over again. I'm on the premium plan, yet I'm still getting ads on podcasts and I don't have access to audio books. There are some podcasts that I used to listen to almost daily that have now become locked. What's the point of paying for a premium subscription if I don't gain access to everything the app offers?
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi. We're open to feedback, and we'd love to get some more info about this. If you have the time, give our Customer Service a shout. You can find them by heading to http://support.spotify.com and searching "Contact us".

scraped_reviews.content: I had to edit my review, it used to be 5 stars but I'm lowering it because all of the sudden, every now and then, it'll switch what Im listening to. I've been listening to a podcast's library and it switched me to a curated list. If you want to make me a recommended list, fine but I don't HAVE to listen to that other stuff and this app is making it so I have to. Super inconvenient, especially while driving. I've used this app for years and never had any issues until recently.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi. We're open to feedback, and we'd love to get some more info about this. If you have the time, give our Customer Service a shout. You can find them by heading to http://support.spotify.com and searching "Contact us".

scraped_reviews.content: App has become horribly unstable. The app crashes on me every other song, sometimes I get two songs in-between. I have reinstalled the app, cleared the cache, undownloaded and redownloaded all saved playlist. But the app still crashes constantly. Not worth the membership cost anymore, given that I can't enjoy my music. I hope it gets fixed with the next update, but considering the issue wasn't fixed after the last time I brought this issue up, I'm not hopeful.

I had given this app 5 stars at one point because of the huge concern variety of music, podcasts and other material available and ease of navigation. Then I dropped it to 3 because I was having sign in issues, but still liked the app. Now the app doesn't even load pages, so can't play music. Don't know if it's issue stemming from my phone or the app itself being stupid. Either way, uninstalled and unsubscribed. Can't use, so why keep it? Moving on to other apps.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hey there! Everything‚Äôs looking good on our end now. Also, check out the steps under ‚ÄúSpotify not playing‚Äù at support.spotify.com. If you're still having issues, we'd recommend getting in touch with our Customer Service. Just search for ‚ÄúContact Us‚Äù.

scraped_reviews.content: decent selection of music, but the app lies. it constantly promises to give 30 minutes of ad-free listening and then doesn't deliver. many times, I let an ad play in order to get 30 minutes free, but then the app plays two songs and hits me with an ad. this is either a stupid glitch or a cynically deceptive practice. I'm looking elsewhere to get mobile music.

I usually love Spotify, I even have premium, but recently it has been SO testy when I try to open it. Sometimes it will work fine, but most of the time it just opens to a black screen and no matter if I reset the app, or even my phone, nothing really helps it. When it does this, if it eventually opens, everything is incredibly slow to load. I'm very disappointed.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi. Have you tried a quick reinstall? If that doesn't help, we'd recommend reaching out to our Customer Service at support.spotify.com. Just search ‚ÄúContact Us‚Äù, and they'll be happy to help.

scraped_reviews.content: I hate to say this, but Spotify is honestly a really bad music app. Ive been using it for years, and Ive loved it throughout, but these updates just keep getting worse and worse. To enjoy your experience, you more or less have to pay for Premium. They've gotten extremely money-hungry, not to mention the app doesn't even work half the time. My music often randomly stops playing for no reason. Also, not being able to see lyrics without Premium really bothers me. Dont recommend.

The app is starting to go downhill ever since the ceo fired 15% of the staff. Loading offline music takes way too long even though the songs are downloaded to my device. What's the point of downloading them if they won't load instantly? Subscription prices keep going up but we still don't have lossless audio. Going from offline music to online music takes so long I have to close the app and reopen it.

Unless you're going to pay for premium, don't bother. You used to get 30 minutes add free, but no longer. Oh, they still say to enjoy the next 30 minutes add free. After ONE song, you're stuck listening to several ads that run longer than the song you just heard. I thought it might be a bug, but it happens consistently now.

I love spotify! It's super easy. I will say that it's not good unless you have premium though. My my first request is that a long time ago on desktop you could see when the song was added on collaborative playlists, and that has been removed, could you add that back? The next request is that on collaborative playlists, the collaborators should be able to edit the playlist cover and order of the songs. That's is, great app!

Downloaded songs and shuffle ruin the app. I use the app a lot out of service area so I download plenty of music to listen to. When I try to listen to the downloaded music the app only plays rap and hip hop, plays the same 10 songs over and over again out of 2500 plus downloaded songs. It sometimes won't even play other songs I try to select outside the apps chosen favorites, I click on it and it does nothing. It ruins the whole experience of using the app.

title: Spotify for Creators
description: The official app from Spotify that helps creators grow, monetize, and manage their podcast or video show. The Spotify for Creators app (formerly known as Spotify for Podcasters) allows you to host and distribute your podcast for free, use powerful tools to reach and engage new audiences, get paid for your content, and stand out to over 600 million Spotify users. Spotify for Creators is where podcasters and video creators can make meaningful connections with fans and monetize their content. Hosted somewhere else? You can still use our mobile app to manage your show on the go. Fans come to Spotify to discover new podcasts. Tap into this audience by using Spotify for Creators to upload your episodes, connect with your fans, and check out your Spotify podcast analytics. With Spotify for Creators, podcast and video creators can: Grow your community and connect with loyal fans ‚Ä¢ Like and reply to your favorite fan comments ‚Ä¢ Get real-time feedback by creating polls on your episodes, and more ‚Ä¢ Grow your podcast with detailed insights about your show and your audience, and understand where they discover your show through impression analytics Track and manage your show ‚Ä¢ Get notifications to keep up with your show's activity, including fan interactions, trending episodes, when you hit the charts and other key milestones ‚Ä¢ Track the performance of your latest episode and get detailed audience insights ‚Ä¢ Manage multiple shows in one place, and easily switch between all of your shows from one account Customize your show on Spotify ‚Ä¢ No matter what kind of podcast or video content you‚Äôre creating, you‚Äôll get powerful tools to help your show stand out on Spotify and beyond ‚Ä¢ Draft, manage, and publish content seamlessly, regardless of where you are hosted ‚Ä¢ Customize how your show and episodes appear on Spotify Get free hosting and RSS distribution ‚Ä¢ Host your podcast with Spotify for free ‚Ä¢ Manage your podcast RSS feed and ensure your podcast audio content is distributed to all major listening platforms Monetize your content (available for creators hosting their content on ‚Ä¢ Spotify for Creators in select markets) For people wondering ‚Äúhow do you monetize a podcast?‚Äù, Spotify for Creators has flexible monetization options for audio and video creators, with subscriptions and the Spotify Partner Program (ads and premium video revenue) Need help? We're here for you at https://support.spotify.com/us/creators/ You can also find us on‚Ä¶ Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/spotifyforcreators/ Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/spotifyforcreators X: https://x.com/spotifycreator
descriptionHTML:
The official app from Spotify that helps creators grow, monetize, and manage their podcast or video show. The Spotify for Creators app (formerly known as Spotify for Podcasters) allows you to host and distribute your podcast for free, use powerful tools to reach and engage new audiences, get paid for your content, and stand out to over 600 million Spotify users. Spotify for Creators is where podcasters and video creators can make meaningful connections with fans and monetize their content. Hosted somewhere else? You can still use our mobile app to manage your show on the go.

Fans come to Spotify to discover new podcasts. Tap into this audience by using Spotify for Creators to upload your episodes, connect with your fans, and check out your Spotify podcast analytics. With Spotify for Creators, podcast and video creators can:

Grow your community and connect with loyal fans
‚Ä¢ Like and reply to your favorite fan comments
‚Ä¢ Get real-time feedback by creating polls on your episodes, and more
‚Ä¢ Grow your podcast with detailed insights about your show and your audience, and understand where they discover your show through impression analytics

Track and manage your show
‚Ä¢ Get notifications to keep up with your show's activity, including fan interactions, trending episodes, when you hit the charts and other key milestones
‚Ä¢ Track the performance of your latest episode and get detailed audience insights
‚Ä¢ Manage multiple shows in one place, and easily switch between all of your shows from one account

Customize your show on Spotify
‚Ä¢ No matter what kind of podcast or video content you‚Äôre creating, you‚Äôll get powerful tools to help your show stand out on Spotify and beyond
‚Ä¢ Draft, manage, and publish content seamlessly, regardless of where you are hosted
‚Ä¢ Customize how your show and episodes appear on Spotify

Get free hosting and RSS distribution
‚Ä¢ Host your podcast with Spotify for free
‚Ä¢ Manage your podcast RSS feed and ensure your podcast audio content is distributed to all major listening platforms

Monetize your content (available for creators hosting their content on ‚Ä¢ Spotify for Creators in select markets)
For people wondering ‚Äúhow do you monetize a podcast?‚Äù, Spotify for Creators has flexible monetization options for audio and video creators, with subscriptions and the Spotify Partner Program (ads and premium video revenue)

Need help? We're here for you at https://support.spotify.com/us/creators/
You can also find us on‚Ä¶
Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/spotifyforcreators/
Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/spotifyforcreators
X: https://x.com/spotifycreator
summary: Manage and grow your podcast

scraped_reviews.content: I uninstalled this app because I lost all of my sound effects, all of my recordings, everything. my podcasts are still up but it's a pain in the behind to upload audio from other apps when I very literally found a better alternative. put it back to how it used to be, with sound effects and in-app editing and in-app recording! ever since they tried to do that partnership with whatever that recording app was, everything got screwed up. I wish we were back to Anchor. that was my favorite version.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hello! We appreciate the feedback. Rest assured, your recordings are still available on our web app. You can access and download them by following the instructions on spoti.fi/exportshowfiles. For anything else, reach out to us at https://spoti.fi/podhelp and we'll be happy to help.

scraped_reviews.content: So disappointed! Loved Anchor and have had a podcast on here for almost 4 years. Ever since Spotify took over, the changes have been awful. Now, my episodes won't even upload right. Contacted support, who were very nice, but wanted me to upload my episodes from my computer for troubleshooting - which kind of defeats the purpose of an app? They said that they are working on it but don't know a time frame of when it will be fixed. If not fixed soon, will switch to a new platform. Ugh! Hate this.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi Becca. We‚Äôre really sorry to hear you're having difficulty with the app - that's not the experience we want you to have. We've now released an update that should fix this issue. Please ensure you‚Äôve downloaded the latest version of the app. If you have any further trouble, reach out to us at https://spoti.fi/podhelp and we'll be happy to help!

scraped_reviews.content: Used to love it, and now they've taken away the ability to record & edit on the app. It was so much easier for me to do that, & I used sounds from their library to go into my podcast episodes. I can no longer do that with such an awful update. I have to do all the recording & editing with other apps, then upload that file. So much additional, unnecessary effort & storage space for more apps to accomplish the goal. How terribly sad. I may have to quit podcasting now. No time for the extra steps

Can't record in the app anymore. In the old version I could record, compile, and publish our podcast from the app. But noooooooo. Not any more. Now it's only a publishing and audience tracking app. Now I have to go to a 3rd party to record and my partner is not even on site. It was easy when we started with Anchor but now it's a mess. Thanks for nothing, Spotify.

This app use to be stress free fun for our podcast, but no more. Our pre-recorded content, the library, the music (no music on Spotify?), and the ease of doing it all mobile is GONE! Now we have to go to Riverside and pay a lot of money to do what was fun and free and easy. My husband and I loved doing Organic Honey Podcast because it was fun and stress free. Now it going to cost us precious time, money, and added stress...not good at all!
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi MT. Rest assured your library is still available on our web app and you can access it by following the steps on spoti.fi/exportshowfiles. We understand the effort that goes into creating your podcast, so here are some creation tool suggestions for you: https://spoti.fi/podcreation. We hope this helps! For anything else, contact our support team.

scraped_reviews.content: Used to love this app. It was the reason I started podcasting. It was easy and monetization was super easy as Anchor. Then Spotify bought it. No more monetization for me. But still, recording and editing was easy. Now they even took that away. Now I need to learn audio editing to record another episode. Anchor was great. Spotify for Podcasters sucks. Would love another app like Anchor but I don't know of one.

I have been operating, recording, editing and publishing a podcast for over a year on this app and the latest iteration you can't record, invite guests, and edit from the app any more. Spotify you NEED TO FIX IT!!!!!!!!!!!! UPDATE It has been quite a bit better then it was and I haven't had problems for a while except for login and loading content. the last little bit
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hey! We're sorry to hear about this. Let's get in touch so we can take a closer look. If you could reach out to our team at https://spoti.fi/podhelp, we'll be there to help. In the meantime, please ensure you have downloaded the latest version of the app.

scraped_reviews.content: I love the idea of making podcasts with only an app, and Anchor ALMOST as all the features you could possibly want. My only issue is that while you can upload your own music, you can't overlay it while you're recording -- they have music and transitions for that, but you can't upload your own...anything you upload can only be played in between your recorded segments. Other than that, this app is perfect. Edit: Shortly after leaving this review, not only did I get a response, but background music and sound effect uploading was added. This app is all-in-one and everything you could ask for! 5 out of 5
scraped_reviews.replyContent: We're glad we could add in those new features for you Jesse! Always looking to add more and more updates like this and glad we could help :)

scraped_reviews.content: This could easily change to 5 stars, but since the update you can't invite friends to record, if you have an android (I do) it kicks you out of the app. If you have an apple, it freezes and says "unable to connect." Me and my friends were just getting ready to start airing our podcast but now we're stuck because the app is going through some sort of glitch. Please fix ASAP

If you're just starting on a podcast and want to have a bunch of free features, this def could be a starting point. Most of the navigation is pretty easy and the quality is decent. Now, to the things I don't like. One, that I can't have video with my show. If I have the means that should be an option. Also, while there are sounds available, a lot of them sound somehow generic and cheesy, especially the "hip-hop" ones. They are free but, still. Lastly, the editor could really use some work.

Quick, easy, simple and overall great app. The sound quality is also good. Make sure to record in a place that has no loud noise. So far, no issue with the app. Sponsorship is also quick and easy to understand. You will get a script and bold statement will need to be said in recording. I forgot to mention that this is your one stop place for all your podcasts as they get upload it in all platform.

Horrible. I can't record, I can't do anything in it but listen now. This really sucks since the really bad update they did. Horrible Horrible. I know of the update, and it wasn't a smart one. I'm now using a different app for recording my podcasts. I did love your app, but it was made harder. Someone wasn't thinking about the change in the long run. The recording part could have been left in. Whoever developed this change is really bad. Have them change it back or fire them.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi M D. We're sorry to hear of the problems you're having with the app. We've made some recording and editing suggestions to help with podcast creation on your mobile device: https://spoti.fi/podcreation. Let's get in touch about your issue logging in. If you could reach out our team on https://spoti.fi/podhelp, we'll be happy to help.

scraped_reviews.content: I love that I can do everything from my phone. However, the recording with friends goes pear- shaped after a few moments. The voice tracks bleed into each other. Anchor only gives you one voice/audio track to edit from with the two voice tracks ALREADY mixed. So there has been a lot of unusable audio content sadly. One way I've been able to troubleshoot is by keeping the recordings short and just having multiple, short recordings. Even then, it's still not 100% effective. Otherwise it is great.

So disappointed in this app. There's always some kind of a problem. It's difficult to change your podcasts link. No matter what you type in, it'll tell you it's already taken. You can't move episodes to a different part of your podcast, if you accidentally recorded and published it under a different episode file. The music feature is a little glitchy as well. Then good luck finding customer service. Great concept, that needs a lot of help.

I had never recorded a podcast before, and I'm only semi-tech literate. I intentionally wanted to go totally low fi on my podcast, using only the voice recorder on my Samsung Galaxy S9+ as my mic - just because I'm lazy and I want instant gratification. So I did some research, and Anchor sounded like a good match for me. It's incredibly user-friendly & simple to use. It makes the sound quality of my pod nearly equal to some of those highly polished and produced podcasts out there. I'm hooked.

Anchor made podcasting easy. Record and edit right in the app, and then post it in multiple places. Spotify for Podcasters took that great idea, and completely destroyed it by eliminating all the ease and perks of use. Now you can no longer record in app. You can no longer edit in app. You can no longer add multiple pre-recorded parts together in app. This app now does NOTHING. I hope they'll realize their foolishness and undo this failure. They suggest using Riverside to record - also useless.

The app is super basic, which makes it easy. Maybe a little too basic for my taste. I was very disappointed to learn that my bluetooth earpiece was not a device I could record from as it is a very high quality piece of kit that has excellent noise cancellation and HD voice capabilities. Who wants to hold their handset to their head (a la talking on the phone) to make their podcast episodes? I know you can use other devices to make your episodes, but I don't have other devices yet :(
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi Ryan, thank you for reaching out to us. We're sorry to hear that you are experiencing troubles while signing up. We'd like to help you with this. As we don't have your email address, could you please write to us at https://help.anchor.fm/hc/en-us/requests/new. We look forward to hearing from you!

scraped_reviews.content: New! Dumbed down for your frustration! So annoying to lose the library and the ability to add an intro and outro for my podcast. Publish from a single file is nice... If that's how you want to do it, but this change breaks my process and makes everything harder. And where the heck did my library items go? Did you delete my content? Ugh.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi Eric. Rest assured your library is still available on our web app. Check out spoti.fi/exportshowfiles for steps on how to access it. We understand the effort that goes into creating your podcast, so here are some creation tool suggestions for you: https://spoti.fi/podcreation. We hope this helps! For anything else, contact our support team.

scraped_reviews.content: It's a free ap so I hate to complain, but it's like youtube now where if you turn off your screen, the podcast stops too. This is highly inconvenient if you use your phone for podcasts and it's in your pocket. Also, you can't copy and paste for the episode description, and I swear my numbers fluctuate up AND down every time I log in... how can you lose a download? Anyway, it's not terrible, but has gotten a lot worse since the name and ap were updated a few months ago.

Anchor was great until Spotify trashed it. Imagine, the primary features that bring people to an app/service, all ripped away. No intros, outros, sound free or even editing within the app anymore. You go to Spotify for creators and they push you to another service to record. No editing, no frills, just record. I began here to bypass some extra steps. No reason the be here any longer and I encourage others to evaporate as well. They need to understand how stupid a move that was.

I love the fact that I can easily make a podcast andI can use the discovery feature to find other anchor podcasts, but I really hope wherever is put into that feature.unless I know the name of the podcast or the creator, they're incredibly hard to find. also, on Android the only way to successfully send a message is to do so from inside of an episode, if someone sends me a message and I try to reply that only goes through about 25% of the time. All of that said, it's still a wonderful app!

I give it two stars for the appealing layout, however, it loses three other three stars for two of us attempting over ten times trying to do a two person podcast. It connected both of us once, but i couldn't be heard, even though i recorded myself in my own podcast just to check to see if my audio was accepted and operational. Nope. It would ask to join, we'd select the button and the wait music would continue endlessly for both of us over and over again (sigh).

Recording works pretty well as long as you are all using the same platform. All on the app? Great, you can have group conversations and record. Want to use a computer and your better recording equipment? Well unless you are recording alone you are out of luck as there's no way for someone using the website to have a group chat or join an existing group chat. The distribution to other sites simplifies the process and you don't have to worry about it. However if you want to access the analytics for those other sites, you can't. If you want to even access the account on the other sites, you can't. We have issues where we aren't turning up on Spotify searches that we should even though by what we have set-up on Anchor settings we should show up. For whatever reason the analytics available on the website are completely different to the ones available on the app. Not sure why they wouldn't both let you access the same information. Overall it's a good app if you just want to keep things simple and don't want to handle the hassle but it could do with adding/expanding on some existing features. It feels like the website and app are designed completely separate from each other and not intended to work hand in hand

This app 2 years ago, it was working perfectly, and I could record many small intros with zero issues. Now I have to resort to other apps to record and then send it to my podcast, when before I got into this app record and done. I loved that I could use all the small music intros that were in the app. It was really cool. Please üôè bring it back like it was 2 years ago.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: We appreciate you taking the time to share your concern with us. We assure you that your issue will be handled with the utmost care and attention. Our team is always striving to improve, and we will make sure that your feedback is passed on to the relevant team.

scraped_reviews.content: They took a lot away from this app. When I recently did the update. I wasn't able to record or publish my podcast. It was as easy as pushing the plus button and straight to recording. Anchor was a very simple and easy app to use. But when they changed it to Spotify for Podcasters. They ruined a perfectly good thing. I'm being really generous giving this app 1 star.

Used to love this app and platform for podcast. It was very very simple to use, navigate, login, and even edit your podcast. Now I can't even login. I try to login but then get asked to sign up, even though I clicked login and tried to do it multiple ways. Also it on very very difficult to edit your podcast. I guess the folks over and Anchor said they were tired of caring for this free app and if you want a podcast go get a real service and editor.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: We're sorry to hear this, Roddy! If you need any assistance, you can reach us at anch.co/support!

scraped_reviews.content: You can upload your own audio and they will automatically post your cast to any of the major casting sites. However, the editing software within the app is not comprehensive nor at all like editing in audition or audacity. If you want to mix offline you can download your cast from the app. I wish I could MIX the volume of the audio, edit out noise, etc. It would be nice, but such is life. Good, nice accolades, can earn money, but not the best, and not the worst.

None of my podcasts even upload to spotify, I'd give it a 0 star if possible. The links don't work, it does not accept mp4 files which is fine because files can be converted but overall the app is just difficult to navigate and does not work in the slightest bit, it'll tell you your podcast was uploaded and then you click on the link or look it up and it doesn't even work I'm truely not sure what the issue is, maybe it's some sort of glitch? Who knows, the app does not work so don't waste time!!

*edit* I fixed my "won't record" issue by uninstalling and reinstalling the app. Now it just freezes while uploading and is asking for permission when I try to download the audio. My phone doesn't have a "use storage" in the possible permissions for this app. Otherwise, I really like this platform for podcasting, it's generally been accessible and does half the work for me. And editing would be easy, if I used it.

I have been trying to record, and it will record what I am saying for about a minute or two, but then it cuts out and only has silence for basically the rest of what I had recorded. The sound quality is great, from what I was able to record of myself, but I am bummed that my whole segment won't work right. I have a Note 9. I have tried swapping headphones three times, and it has happened every time.

I'm surprised at some of the negative reviews. If you want to use Anchor as you primary podcasting app for LISTENING, ok, there are definitely better options. But in terms of publishing your OWN podcast, this app is amazing. You can so easily create your podcast header information, host your content for FREE, and publish to all of the major podcasting sources...what more could you want? Within an hour, your podcast is available on iTunes, Google Podcasts, even Spotify.

I had trouble finishing the set up and the error message wasn't helpful, it didn't tell me what I was doing wrong. It appears I was trying to upload and unsupported file type or something with my art but I changed that and now I am good to go. I find the recording super easy and have enjoyed putting this podcast together. The app makes it quite simple to do.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi Suzy, thanks for letting us know about this. Our support team would be happy to assist you with this. Kindly file a ticket at anch.co/support.

scraped_reviews.content: Great app if you want to upload your own podcast, i am finding it very useful to archive large audio files such as recordings that I will later publish as podcast episodes. However, it does not seem to have the capability to allow you to have MULTIPLE different podcasts, just only one. Which I find to be a huge shame, since I have many different podcast ideas i would love to be able to publish eventually. Please make it so that you can upload and manage more than one podcast and it'd be perfect!

This app is awesome. I have always dreamt of having my own radio show or podcast. Thanks to anchor that dream came true. Anchor even gave me the chance to make money which is just an added bonus. With the I should "I Should Start A Podcast" episodes available for free they gave me ideas and tips for my podcast that I wouldn't have thought of. They spread the word and put it on every podcast app you can think of for you. If you want a podcast all I can say is, "Anchors away!"

Easy To Use And Free! I love how this app doesn't charge you! All the other podcasting sites will charge for unlimited uploads and other features. It's also easy to navigate. The ONLY things I would say is missing is it would be nice to be able to add more than 5 tags for each episode and it would be nice to be able to easily transfer the podcast episodes to YouTube. I will be using Anchor's group podcast feature tonight!

I have been using anchor for a week now and it really makes the process of recording a podcast easy. Their selection of background music is nice and varied to fit the tone. I withheld one star though because I think the editing of the recording could be better. I wish I could delete a section and record over it to fix it. But other than this, it works great from my phone.

Easiest app to begin, in my limited experience. My podcast, "Off The Dope and Out The Crazy House", appreciates this platform. Without it, I'm not sure how quickly I would have jumped off the porch and into the podcasting streets. That said, an idea for the better would include greater access to information and stat sharing between this platform and the many platforms they allow you to connect with through the app. Another would be a higher, more competitive, payout/structure for ad revenue.

I just started my podcast, a few weeks ago. The app is easy to use for someone new to podcasting. The customer service replies in a timely manner. You get what you paid for, remember this. CONS: your edits dont always save (after restarting your phone, update the app, uninstall & reinstall the app) Check to make sure your podcast is the platforms they say. I got email stating I was on there, I went to check it. My podcast wasnt there.

I like this apps concept. Record a podcast and it does the work for you. The execution, is abysmal. Confusing to navigate ( I have a friend on here and can't find him to add even though I specifically search his name.), clunky, and flat out broken. The record with friends option doesn't work. And it is NOT our internet connection. The link sent doesn't send the other person into the recording. I guess I'll have to find another way to upload.

My friends and I started a podcast a few weeks ago and now we have episodes online and have been distributed to platforms like Spotify and Google Podcasts. This app is great for creating a podcast with very little effort. We dont use the app to record, so I cant speak on behalf of Anchor's creation tools, but the distribution process is great and makes uploading and sharing episodes extremely easy.

What happened? I update, I get logged out, and my log info doesn't work. How is it that I've been logged in for so long and never had any issues until now? Why is the app telling me my log in info is incorrect when it is in fact, 100% correct? I normally don't like to leave bad reviews, but this is pretty ridiculous... revert the app back to what it was prior to this app breaking update until you work out the bugs.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi thelost prophet. We‚Äôre sorry that you‚Äôre having trouble‚Äìthat‚Äôs definitely not the experience we want you to have with the app. Let‚Äôs get in touch to see if we can help solve your problem. If you could reach out to our team at https://spoti.fi/podhelp with more information, we'd be happy to assist you further.

scraped_reviews.content: What do you expect when you download and use a service for free? It's not perfect. I've had recordings randomly chop themselves up and reinsert audio out of order, out of context, and it's been rough to edit it back into the cohesive order. But Anchor publishes your podcasts for free on multiple platforms- a service many websites and agencies usually charge to do for you, Anchor does it automatically for free. And it's very hard to beat that, as you'd otherwise have to do it yourself!

It work pretty well, picks up audio well, but what sucks is you can't lock your phone and blackout the screen, otherwise the podcast recording will end after about 20/30 seconds of that... it makes it difficult to record a podcast while having a busy day moving around where you can't leave your phone screen unlocked in your pocket. Please work on this! Other than that, pretty great free app to start your podcasts on!! üòäü§óüëç

I am an Anchor Podcaster previously. It was so much easier. I'm sorry but, their application and protocols were on point. Especially, when you finished not just published! At the end fireworks would visually blast off and you would be congratulated. Now, publishing is a "wish and a prayer üôè." You hope it's gonna take and not cut to, "the library." I have done 98% of usage last year with them and it was mistake free! You guys need to pay attention to past Anchor podcasters.

Early User, opinion may change as I know more. As of now, I can only hear the audio from a podcast. I may be missing something but it's not very informative. In most areas however, Spotify is no doubt THE KING of podcasting.... Especially after buying Anchor. Now you need only to upload your episodes to "Spotify for Podcasters" and they will store, distribute, and monetize your BRAND. I will have updates as I go, I'm certainly a novice at the whole world of podcasting, and social media.

I am in my early 40's looking to launch my own podcast. I am not tech savvy therefore my innate fear of podcasting felt like a dream destined for doom. I used a few different apps but none seemed to lessen my fears. Until, my friend who has a podcast was singing the praises of a new app, he discovered which was specifically geared for podcast creation. The app was Anchor. Anchor not only took my fears away but it also taught me how podcasting works. I ‚ô•Ô∏èAnchor Gabba

A super user friendly app to record, edit, and publish a professional podcast! I've had my Podcast, Sunshine SOUL for over 2 years now... And I don't intend on buying any fancy equipment. I'm a teacher who decided to retire early, therefore I'm on a budget. The Anchor App has been very easy to utilize and I love how they give you the option to add background music. ‚ò∫Ô∏è 5 Stars Definitely!!!

Why are you hiding URL's? I am trying to name my podcast only to get the error message custom URL is taken. How can it be taken when I've searched it on the internet and I get a 404 error page? It seems that these custom URLs are reserved for someone or something so how do we get them? I tried making my podcast with a name and random string of numbers and it still says TAKEN? How can this be? Can't even make up some useless name. So what's the deal?
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hey Dave, thanks so much for reaching out! Once you publish your first episode, you should be able to change your podcast URL. If you still can't then, please let us know at anch.co/support and our Support Team can help you get the URL you want :)

scraped_reviews.content: I keep waiting for the catch.........and there isn't one. This is single-handedly the best podcast app out there, far and above better than any other I've tried. Zero sneaky charges, a podcast series that helps you get started, and loads of tools available, I really don't even think I'd have started a podcast if I had never found anchor.

I can no longer upload episodes using the app for some reason üò≠. I just click on the upload button, which brings me to my files. But when I select a file nothing happens. I suppose I can't use it anymore. It's really too bad. The website still works though. But it's a little inconvenient now that the recording feature is gone.

title: Learn English, Spanish: Learna
description: Welcome to Learna ‚Äì the AI-Powered Language Learning App to Learn English or Spanish! Looking to learn English or learn Spanish fast and effectively? Learna is your all-in-one AI language tutor app, designed to help you speak confidently from day one. Practice English or Spanish with interactive grammar lessons, real conversation practice, vocabulary builders, pronunciation tools, and fun reading exercises. Whether you're a beginner or brushing up your skills, Learna helps you master every aspect of the language‚Äîat your own pace. With Learna AI, you can speak English & Spanish confidently and effectively through interactive conversations. Our app takes your language learning journey beyond traditional methods. Whether you're a beginner or an advanced learner, Learna AI is here to help you learn, speak English and Spanish in a fun, engaging, and personalized way. Language practices and pronunciation lessons are guided by our Learna AI Virtual Chat Character, offering tailored support as you learn more about speaking, pronunciation and accent training. You can speak with AI to improve both your speaking, pronunciation and listening skills. The app provides real-time feedback, helping you speak correctly and refine your vocabulary as you go. This makes learning English & Spanish more dynamic, interactive, and efficient, as you can practice speaking at your own pace. Learna AI also focuses on improving your grammar skills . You‚Äôll learn essential grammar rules and practice them through a variety of exercises that help reinforce your understanding. The grammar practices are designed to gradually improve your proficiency, allowing you to speak with accuracy and clarity. As you learn grammar, you will build a stronger foundation for your speaking and writing skills. Vocabulary plays a critical role in learning and speaking languages fluently. With Learna AI, you can improve your vocabulary by learning new words and phrases that are practical and useful in daily conversations. Each lesson focuses on building your vocabulary, ensuring you have a broad range of words at your disposal. The app features vocabulary practice that adapts to your level, helping you speak more naturally and confidently. Your pronunciation also gets a boost with Learna AI. As you speak, you‚Äôll receive valuable feedback to improve your pronunciation. The app includes pronunciation exercises specifically designed to help you master English and Spanish pronunciation, and therefore speak clearly. Pronunciation practices allow you to correct mistakes and sound more authentic and fluent when speaking languages like English and Spanish. Track your progress with detailed performance metrics and milestones. Set learning goals to monitor your achievements and celebrate your successes. With continuous practice, you‚Äôll see your speaking skills improve, and your vocabulary will expand. By setting specific goals, you ensure that each practice session is focused and effective. Learna AI Language Tutor Features - Language Conversation Practice with Learna AI - Get feedback from Learna AI for your mistakes - Learn English or Spanish Grammar with tailored lessons - Improve your English & Spanish Reading Skills - Enrich your Vocabulary with daily vocabulary practices & Learn new words - Spelling Check and vocabulary reinforcement - Perfect your Pronunciation through interactive pronunciation exercises - Enhance your Speaking Skills through practical speaking practice - Track your progress and set goals to continually improve Speak, practice, and learn languages today with Learna AI, your partner in mastering the English language, and Spanish language! Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/learna.ai/
