scraped_reviews.content: For multiple articles, an ad that's more than halfway down the page blocks the text and gets stuck there, and there's no way around it. NPR also started linking out articles to some of their subsidiaries, and clicking on an article and having it open in a web browser (without warning) is just poor UX ‚Äî and defeats the point of an app. The search function barely works, even if you use quotation marks around the phrase. The app worked well enough before, but I'm getting ready to delete it.

This app seems to provide the bare minimum that is needed, which is both a pro and a con. Pro because the app is light-weight and takes up very little room on my Samsung. And a con because there are a few key functions that are missing. For example, there is no way to set up notifications within the app (not sure how others are able to do this since it is non-existent in my app) and the ability to save articles for future reading. Luckily and surprisingly however, there is the option to search,

The way the app used to be formatted was geared towards reading news stories. That was perfect. Pivoting to podcasts is not something I care for. If I want to listen to NPR, it's in the name: radio. If I want the podcast form, there are many other ways to do that. The only way to read news on NPR on my phone was through the app. Additionally, despite disabling the NPR app's ability to use device audio, it will play via Bluetooth, even with the app closed.

The changes to the app are not improvements in my book. The app allows less control and only allows one favorite local station. The worst "feature" however is not being allowed to set listening preferences and instead relying on AI. I always have to take several steps to get to the live stream when I open the app, and then in the middle of my live stream, the app skips back to content "curated just for me." I was listening to the content I wanted to hear!

I love the coverage, and the options available through the app are better than adequit. But the tech part stinks. Runs in the background when off, using battery. Doesn't play with my car bluetooth radio, starting on it's own over and over, playing different content when restarting (get back in the car after pumping gas and expect to have to re-start yourself or it insists on segment from the past). Casch never seems to clear itself. You can do better NPR! You are a great news source and more!

STOP TELLING ME WHAT I WANT TO LISTEN TO! If I select a podcast, I want to hear the ENTIRE podcast, not just one segment, then the app does whatever it wants. One star until the app gives me what I want, not what NPR THINKS I want. I should also be able to favorite the podcasts I listen to frequently, like Morning Edition or All Things Considered, but the app doesn't allow this. Access to my playlist should be a top level choice, not require multiple selections. This is dangerous while driving.

Liked the old app interface just fine. Never cared for the NPR One app. Now the NPR app looks just like NPR One. No longer able to easily store and find favorite NPR affiliates. I travel a lot, and enjoy being able to listen to my hometown station (KQED) as well as to the stations where I am staying. Now must click through several menus, and search. Very tedious.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi Ron, we're grateful for your feedback about the NPR App update. Thank you for taking the time to write.

scraped_reviews.content: This version of the NPR app, updated maybe about 2022, really stinks. The old stripped down version was much easier to use. For instance, the new version makes it really hard to find one's play list. It's also really hard to modify one's playlist. Also, when I search for a show, I want to listen to all the segments of that show, e.g., weekend edition. What I find is that the app keeps switching to all sorts of different media, when all I want is Scott Simon or Aisha Roscoe.

The new phone app does not what I wanted when I first got the app. Up until yesterday I could scroll quickly through a list of headlines to see if I was interested in reading the article. At the bottom of the scroll down there was a button to load more stories. Now the app seems more about listening to the radio, etc. than letting me scroll down a list of headlines. So now the phone app is more like that from the local commercial TV station and that is not an improvement. Yuk.

It was a great app up until the last couple of months. I listen during my commute and it cuts out about two to three times per minute making me have to go back and hit play. My connection is always great. It's so frustrating I just listen to something else. I've tried uninstalling, cleaning the cache, etc, but nothing works. I've had to restart it FOUR times just while writing this! Edit: Problem still persist and has gotten worse. Have tried to contact developers with no response. Uninstalling.

Update: Cuts out after few minutes (any stream) Update: Last couple of weeks the app can't stay connected to the Wamu stream for more than a few minutes. Other apps can. What's up? **** This used to be the perfect app, more or less. In the past few months, it hasn't been turning off when a call comes in. Please fix that. Also, I don't understand the default view when opening the app. Why would I get the news feed and not my favorite stations list, since that's what I use this for. Thanks.

I love NPR! But the app needs an update or a fix. I would like to fast forward the stories, but can't. Samsung did an update. Since then, my car and Bluetooth earphones forward and pause function doesn't work. If listening to NPR and I put my earphones away, or turn off my car, NPR continues to play on the phone speaker. I have to unlock my phone to pause NPR. Annoying! If I remove my earphones or receive a call, the news story continues and after the call, I have to go back. Galaxy A32 5G

I primarily downloaded this to listen to NPR podcasts. My main complaint is that after only a few minutes of the app being idle, it will take you back to the home screen and you will lose your place in the podcast. You have to go back to the list of episodes, select the episode again and then scroll forward to where you were in the podcast. Very inconvenient when driving!

It pains me to write this, but the recent app update has really ruined my NPR experience. Gone are the majority of the long-form articles I could discretely read. It's much harder to read anything because you have to go down the topic list and check each one out. No more swiping between articles. And there are now unrelated ads in the middle of articles. I didn't want NPR One, which is what this app has become, for a reason. How frustrating.

The curating and selection of top articles just well...sucks. There are few and they aren't always the most relevant or newsworthy of the day. It makes it hard to browse articles without opening one and scrolling to the end. It seems to push people to podcasts and other forms that aren't short. And there are some other themed boxes toward the bottom that have been retaining general interest stories for months. Like, what is that?! Just really disappointed. Why not do something like the CBC?

So many issues. Unbelievably slow to load content, even on fast internet connections. Play button is perpetually stuck on the loading icon even when content is playing. I regularly get the same story delivered to me two, three or more times. The app, when producing audio, fails to be recognized properly on my device and doesn't show up on my home screen for easy manipulation like all other audio does. I support my local NPR station and this new app is just garbage.

This app breaks like it's its job. I've probably had to uninstall and reinstall it [only thing that's fixed it] when the app stops play sound. I've had to do that dozens of times over the last four years. Now the uninstall/reinstall isn't even working. What happened? It's been months since I've had this thing break on me, but here we go again, I guess. Every time this happens, the NPR One app is still running, but I don't like the format of that app nearly as much for the news programs.

I love NPR. JUST GO TO THEIR WEBSITE ON YOUR PHONE. PLAY IT FROM THERE. You can even lock your phone and do other things and it works fine. This particular app just has trouble with my Samsung. If you like to keep your phone in any power saving mode, then it will probably randomly stop playing, just like most radio apps. The UI on the NPR mobile website is surprisingly kept up with and easy to use. I just don't see the benefit in having this app.

This new version (v. 3.1.0) is a clear and significant mistake. I so wish I hadn't updated it. If I could down-level to a previous version, I would in a second. The previous version allowed me to select from a customizable list of NPR stations, but not anymore. If it's not too late for you, I would suggest not downloading this app DOWNGRADE!

[CAUTION: Difficult to shut off & drains battery!] Excellent coverage of topics, stations and every type of NPR content you could imagine. I use it to listen to All Things Considered or Morning Edition live in in other time zones from other NPR stations when I I'm either too late or too early to hear them in my own. I'd give it five stars if it would stop playing when I swipe it away. Unfortunately I have to go back to the app, open it up and press stop on whatever is playing in order to end it.

When our local station went off air, I thought I'd give this a try. My first few attempts weren't great, it didn't play segments seamlessly. That's an issue while driving. I tried again today, and the app wouldn't play full segments. It quit after about 2 minutes. It would be great for those of us who don't have access to local NPR stations if this app worked better.

I had been using this app for news for years, but in the last couple of updates, the audio streams would keep cutting off. For listening while in the car, this is not only irksome, but fiddling with it is possibly dangerous. Here's hoping they resolve it, because the actual content is some damn fine reporting and analysis, refreshingly devoid of spin or sensationalism. I turned to my local public radio affiliate's app for the time being, as much of the same content is available there.

I am weeping at how buggy this app has become. Currently, the app just bugs out and stops playing audio and goes into a loading loop. Reproduced on mobile and WiFi. Also, it automatically starts playing when I connect to Bluetooth devices, which is GREAT when in a conference call. Autoplay is disabled, the app isn't even running when this occurs. And third, sometimes the pause/resume button just doesn't work at all. What gives! I am uninstalling this app because it is unusable.

Far worse in usability compared to the old NPR news app for me. With the old app, you could pre-load all of the articles and read them, even if your phone subsequently went offline. The new app constantly requires an internet connection, which can be troublesome in an environment like a subway where signal reception is spotty at best. It's a huge downgrade.

Links or graphics will often repeatedly not display (specifically COVID-19 cases data). Graphics will show on the story feed, but once you click on the actual story, embedded links do not work no matter how many times you click and the graphic that was shown with the story does not display. Would be really nice if I could actually look at the data they're trying to post. The app overall works, but it is clunky and is functioning like an app that hasn't been updated in 5+ yrs.

Graphics referenced in articles aren't there, links don't go anywhere, and sometimes I click on a notification and I'm not sure the article it takes me to is even the same one. Also, there's no way to open an article in a browser in an attempt to access the missing graphics and links. Only good for reading a few text-only articles. Might as well just go directly to the website instead.

The app has become glitchy and refuses to work half the time ever since switching to NPR from the NPR One app. As of right now the app is practically unusable. Autoplay doesn't work even when it's the option is toggled on, when I'm listening to the app, it will stop playing during the middle of a program all the time, and when you try to play a new podcast, It will take forever to start or not start at all even when on Wi-Fi.

I would have given the previous iteration of this app 4-5 stars based on its simplicity and ease of use. The new version, however, is cluttered, content categories are not distinct, and I cannot find a way to listen to the entire two-segment top of the newscast with the second half being taken over by the local news. A new baby has disrupted my usual news consumption activities, but I am not sure I will use the app when I resume them.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi Ian, thank you for your feedback about the NPR App. You can still quickly hear the hourly national newscast by tapping the Play button on the home tab, which will start your personalized flow of NPR content. You can also manually access the newscasts at any time by scrolling to ‚ÄúHourly News Update‚Äù on the Home tab. We appreciate your feedback.

scraped_reviews.content: It's hard to overstate how terrible this new version of the app is. It is difficult to get to the hourly headlines (and automatically cuts to local news), it is impossible to find the news stories I want to hear as opposed to the ones the app wants me to hear, and it constantly crashes and bugs. The old version allowed you to browse through the entire lineup of the day's news shows and select the stories you wanted to listen to in order. Please bring this back!

Radio keeps cutting out all the time, sometimes completely shutting off. This used to be the one part of your app that worked reliably. PLEASE get this app out of the eighties and WORKING. <- All of this is still true the better part of a year later. Come on. I'm tired of missing half the story because the connection can't seem to hold.

I will be uninstalling this app today. Since the recent update, it starts playing as soon as it detects Bluetooth in my car. Even if the app is closed and I'm listening to a different radio station. And there is no setting to turn off this unrequested feature. I will not use an app that demands attention or helps itself to mobile data without my express permission. Huge fail, NPR. You, of all media companies, should know better.

The Updated app is terrible and random. I used to really enjoy this app for daily (or more often) news updates. You could choose to listen to ~10 minutes of the newest headlines. But now that option is gone (or at least hidden). Now, you have one Play button, and you get what you get when you select it. It might be 5 minutes of headlines, it might be an in-depth news story about a specific, random topic.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi Rodney, thanks for your feedback about the NPR App. You can still quickly hear the hourly national and local newscast (if it's available) by tapping the Play button on the home tab, which will start your personalized flow of NPR content. You can also manually access the newscasts at any time by scrolling to ‚ÄúHourly News Update‚Äù on the Home tab.

scraped_reviews.content: I absolutely love NPR but this app is glitchy. By far the most frustrating glitch occurs when playing a playlist. Each episode in the playlist will play till there's around a minute left, and then skip to the next episode. It happens every time. The only way to hear the remainder of the episode it is to replay it, and fast forward to the portion that was skipped. Not an ideal listening experience.

Not happy with the update. Can't list topics anymore. Difficult to navigate. I can't get NPR radio reception in my car where I work and live so this was the only access to NPR. I have a tablet with the old version, so I'm going to grab the .APK file with Astro file manager, and side load it back on my phone. I should have known not up update an app I like

I used to like this app, used it daily, then they "updated" it and I hated that update so much that I deleted the app. The old version was a list of headlines, mostly articles but the new is focused on audio- bad for those with hearing loss. I would have been okay with that if I could have personalized it to the written articles, but that didn't seem possible. But the worst was the audio automatically opened every time I used Waze and that was really annoying since I'm the driver of the carpool.

Opens itself and runs in the background, have to force quit several times a day. Won't show what's playing and often only one of the three play/pause buttons will actually pause or play. The progress bar often shows loading while the podcast is playing so I can't see how much time is left or how long the show is. Replays the same stories, sometimes several times a day. NPR One worked perfect for me and I despise this forced change over. I've tried un-installing a few times.

I knew the day would come where they would change this app to basically make it the NPR One app. I loved the simplicity that the old version brought to navigating npr programs. However, the reason I am commenting today is now the queue feature is no longer available. I loved that I could throw a story from any program into the queue and jump right back where I left off. I understand there is the playlist option, but knowing myself, I'll put stories into a playlist and forget to go back to it.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Thank you for your feedback. Can you please ensure Samsung hasn't automatically enabled sleep for NPR News? This will prevent the app from functioning properly when backgrounded. This setting can be found in the Battery settings under Device Care or Device Maintenance. Please let us know if this resolves the issue.

scraped_reviews.content: The app is okay but not great. if you listen to part of an episode and come back a day or two later you find it doesn't keep track of your position. still a problem. I'm not sure when this changed. it used to keep track in the Finish Listening section of the My NPR tab, but now it regularly does not.. They also have a lot of "press this button" to listen now for episodes, which is horrible for driving in a car.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi John, thanks for writing in. It's a little hard to find, but there is a module on your My NPR tab that is called "Finish Listening" - that should have the episodes you didn't quite finish. Please have a look and that and see if it helps! If there's anything else we can do, don't hesitate to reach out at help.npr.org.

scraped_reviews.content: I guess we really needed another app telling us what it thinks we want to listen to instead of us deciding for ourselves? The "home" page is a one size fits all aporch. There also doesn't appear to be way to turn off content from auto playing when connected to bluetooth to some car radios. As well no option to not autoplay additional content after listening to just the hourly news cast. Also now I have both the NPR app and Spotify play over each other when Bluetooth is connected in vehicle.

Overall for NPR podcasts this app works great! My biggest problem is when streaming a local broadcast. It is so annoying to be listening and have an advertisement interrupt the broadcast. The problem is not the advertisement itself, it's the frequency. It seems like whenever there is a packet loss the advertisement plays. So, you'll be listening to a program and get interrupted multiple times. Very annoying behavior!

Ok, when needed, but it has to be open and on to listen. Can't browse, sit and pet the dogs and cat, letting the screen turn off, because it shuts off. So I only use it when I have to. Also hard to browse past shows, it loads each page, doesn't just scroll easily through, when you click a show to see what it's about, when you go back it's right to the beginning, then you have to scroll through everything again. So time consuming I gave up, I just use it to listen to missed shows now.

In the predecessor app (NPR News), if I started playing from the middle of the queue, playback would always continue to the following story in the queue. With this app, playback sometimes jumps to the beginning of the queue. This is particularly a problem because there's no way to reorder stories in the queue (without removing them, and then adding them back in the preferred order).

I love NPR! Today, your app started accompanying push notifications with an extremely aggressive vibration that doesn't seem to stop until I make it stop. It's way more aggressive than an actual phone call. It's interrupted 2 meetings today. As much as I love NPR, I have to switch to AP. These notifications are causing too much disruption to my life. But thanks for all the amazing journalism you do!

Downloaded this app to try after Google podcasts shut down... It's unfortunately limited as an app for listening to podcasts. There's no way to change the playback speed (I typically like to listen to podcasts at 1.5x speed), you can't download podcasts, and the playback function is not intuitive. Love the content, just not so much the app Edit: love the updates, exactly what I was looking for! Redownloaded and couldn't be happier
scraped_reviews.replyContent: We're happy to report that we've launched listening speed controls for on-demand content. Please give it a try and let us know what you think - you can find the button when you're viewing the expanded full-screen player. Happy listening!

scraped_reviews.content: If there is a way to exit this app, I cannot find it. Every time I use it, I have to go into my phone settings, find the app, and Force Stop. If I just close the app, it starts to play when I try to listen to my podcast app. RIDICULOUS. If it's not fixed soon, I'll just uninstall and find another news source. Update: Uninstalled permanently. It actually got worse! Even forcing stop did not prevent the app from playing. My email to the developer has not been acknowledged.

Notifications from the app about news stories, when clicked, lead to the article less than 10% of the time. Notifications also do not seem to correspond directly to any of the articles on the main news feed. Occasionally if the notification is too long important info is left off making difficult to find the article it already doesn't match. The online radio functions adequately.

The share feature is broken for long headlines. The end of the URL gets cut off. Nearly every app will embed the headline from just a URL anyway, so save the characters for that alone. Edit: more issues include not being able to turn off podcasts entirely, the play-on-Bluetooth connect mentioned in other reviews, and the play bar covering article content. Does nobody test this app before releasing it?

I love NPR but this app is completely trash. I recently got rid of my Spotify subscription so I'm looking for alternatives but this isn't it. Many features aren't available or don't work with Android Auto, and when searching for podcasts it's extremely difficult to figure out what date they were posted before you actually start playing the episode.

I like that it tries to play a shuffle of NPR shows I like. Good for traffic. I dislike how boneheaded some of it is. If you click on an ad for a NPR podcast in the app, which says listen now, instead of playing it takes you to that podcast's page on the NPR website. There are wild jumps in volume between shows. I've added a bunch of things I like to my feed but it pretty much only plays Morning Edition. I'm still gonna use it, but I expected better.

Playback interruptions with no saving of past locations. Waited months (probably closer to a year) for the issue to be fixed, but even with the last update I still can't make it through the morning update (roughly 10 minutes long) without 3 or more playback interruptions. Moreover, its difficult to figure out where you left off. Very disappointing NPR, please fix your playback issues with Android phones. I love your news, but it's impossible to listen to now.

title: Meta Business Suite
description:
Grow your business and connect with more people with Meta Business Suite.

Use this app to:
‚Ä¢ Create, schedule, and manage posts and stories across your Facebook Page and Instagram account
‚Ä¢ Connect with more customers by responding to all of your messages and comments in one place‚Äîyou can even automate responses to save time
‚Ä¢ View insights about how people are interacting with your posts, stories and ads so you can create content that resonates with them
‚Ä¢ View your notifications and to-do list so you can stay on top of what matters most
descriptionHTML:
Grow your business and connect with more people with Meta Business Suite.

Use this app to:
‚Ä¢ Create, schedule, and manage posts and stories across your Facebook Page and Instagram account
‚Ä¢ Connect with more customers by responding to all of your messages and comments in one place‚Äîyou can even automate responses to save time
‚Ä¢ View insights about how people are interacting with your posts, stories and ads so you can create content that resonates with them
‚Ä¢ View your notifications and to-do list so you can stay on top of what matters most
summary: Grow your business and connect with more people with Meta Business Suite.

scraped_reviews.content: I hate this app; forced to use it nonetheless. messages to the page are regularly delayed, sometimes for more than 24 hours. There is no option to search messages, notifications don't clear so I'll have a notification saying I have an unread message while no unread messages display in my inbox, leading me to wonder if it's a glitch or if the business suite has once again eaten a message that may or may not show up in a few days.

Not a huge fan of the app. I'm not able to edit photos I'm adding to a post anymore. Before the ability to edit photos was taken away, when you would add text to a photo, the options were hidden under my phone's keyboard; I would have to put my keyboard in float mode just to change the font style and color. Also, I have never been able to rearrange photos I'm adding to a post. I have to go between the app and the desktop version for every post I create.

Haven't been using this app for very long and already see some problems. First, Facebook doesn't seem to move messages to spam. That's not a huge deal if you know what is spam and what is not, but it's still super annoying. The other thing that's a bigger deal is I can't see the detailed results of an ad, because the button doesn't work for some reason. I have to go on a PC to view the audience the ad has reached, for example. I even un- and re-installed the app and it didn't work.

A lot of the features don't seem to work/update properly. The thing that is driving me crazy the most is that if you click "view profile" from someone who has messaged you, it just goes to a blank screen. Considering that 95% of the messages I've received thus far from FB have been scams, it would make things MUCH easier if this option functioned properly.

Can't tag in posts now. @ shows nothing. Also can't see a full post in business suite. There's no way to access "more" without editing the post and that isn't allowing you to scroll. Where's my full page feed? Still can't pick categories for or edit events or add another page as co-host. Can only choose individuals. :/ Also can't see text while typing because text box is too small with keyboard on screen and unnecessary information above. Argh.

The app lagged out, and the screen changed right when I tapped, and moved the apply all recommendations button right where I was tapping. There is no confirmation and I applied changes to ALL of my running ad sets, there is no undo and I'm so upset that I didn't at least get an are you sure confirmation. This is bad design and all my campaigns are back in processing and my testing for this campaign is getting completely undone thanks to this bad design error. Very unhappy.

this app would be great if it didn't fail to post all the time. I literally have posts stuck from 2021 in my pending to be posted. And that's on top of the ones that regularly don't work and just say failed to post click here to view options so I click it and it does nothing so I have to go to Facebook switch to the page I want and post from there but that way I can't schedule the post. it would just be nice and make my job easier if the app worked as intended.

I've begrudgingly used this app for about a decade. It is garbage for such a large company. Notifications are rarely up-to-date. Many "features" simply don't work. For example, clicking "Events" does nothing. No message, no loading icon. Just nothing. Many hours have been lost composing posts only to have them disappear when publishing errors out in one way or another. Garbage.

Adding to my review to reflect the name change. Call it whatever you want but just make it work!!!! The minute the name change was announced the app started malfunctioning. Can't post, can't schedule. FIX IT AGAIN.HORRIBLE UPDATE, I have been using this app for over 7 years and all of a sudden they take away the option to schedule posts! This is how I keep my page thriving. I'll be uninstalling if they dont change this back because then I would have no use for the app! Fix it!!!!

I've never had a problem With this app before, but within the last 2 weeks it has not been notifying me of messages, leaving my clients to not be responded to for days, unless I remember within my busy schedule to go and just happened to check on my messages. This is very inconvenient and not practical. Also, when I go to my page manager, the message section is glitching. It says I have unread messages, but I can't see or get to them. Please fix this ASAP!!

The app gets "stuck" hours behind a lot with the most recent updates. This really becomes an issue if you are trying to post live at events. There is also no way to force-cancel a post if it gets caught in upload limbo. I have a post that says it went up an hour ago, but you can't see it. It will probably end up uploading later, but the event will be over.

I am beyond frustrated. Now unable to add photos to albums. Message notifications come in late, which is awful if you offer a curbside pick up option and customers send a message when they arrive. Names don't appear on comments from customers. Dates within the messages are now gone so its impossible to reference a message from a specific date. What is going on?! This is truly maddening. I would be happy to pay a user's fee to avoid all this junk.

This app is SO CONFUSING....About the time you learn to use it they change it all up again. I've sent countless messages to the "report a problem" and "help" buttons with absolutely NO reply. This app WILL NOT let me change my open and closed times. We were finally able to do it from my wife's phone but no on mine. We have lost so many customers recently because of the wrong hours/days listed and no one will help us. Why even have a "report a problem" or "help" button if it goes to no one?? Why?

This app is absolutely terrible. Messages don't send when you try and reply to clients, data is inconsistent between mobile and pc, your page hardly gets any reach unless you pay your way to the top the list goes on. I was prompted to write this because I have over $5000 worth of work sitting in my inbox right now. The clients had messaged me about the service and when I try to reply, the messages won't send. I've spent over $7000 on fb ads this year and this is what I have to deal with. Trash.

Frustrating how often the app becomes useless. Messages won't show up when they come in, or when they do pop up, it's only the first part of the message and then a "..." after it and no amount of refreshing will help. Occasionally trying to schedule posts and the upload will fail and completely delete everything, not offering an option to "retry upload" and I have to re write everything again. Losing so much business with just the messaging feature not working üôÑ
scraped_reviews.replyContent: We appreciate your feedback! Please know this information was provided to the Meta Business Suite product team and this issue has now been resolved. Thank you for being an active Meta Business Suite user.

scraped_reviews.content: Doesn't work most of the time. Messages are a battle to read. It'll notify me there is one but when you click in that feed it won't load the message or it only loads part of the message. Not all of it. How can I respond to potential clients if I can't communicate with them??!! This NEEDS to be fixed and addressed immediately. This is for Businesses. We need access to our messages to run efficiently. I hate that they made us switch to this but they won't fix the bugs.

Doesn't work well. When you get a notification, it sometimes is an old one, it's not very insightful. It only helps you post... But not very necessary at all. The worst app I have ever downloaded for business. It makes having a fb page a problem. I can't go directly to the info I need to. I can't go directly to the notifications when they arrive. It's always a hoop to jump through.

This app is awful. Can no longer queue up posts. Only option is to post directly to page. Makes managing my page impossible. When I do try to post something it takes at least 4 attempts to actually get it to load properly. I keep getting a message that there is something required for me to do but each time I click the link it does nothing. Were you trying to make a useless app because that is absolutely what you did. Absolute rubbish. Bring back Facebook Manager. That was at least usable.

This app is trash, though it's not like you have much choice in using it. Way too easy to lose track of messages! I constantly get the red "new" dot on the inbox, but no new message loads until about 20 hours later, no matter how many times I refresh. Also, if you set up auto or away replies, push notifications don't work. So if you don't log on to the app regularly, you can miss messages for days.

Enjoyed this app until the last few weeks (I have a Samsung Note 8). Now I receive ZERO notifications, which is a big deal when this is my Business page!! I run a bakery, and do not receive notifications when my customers are messaging me or trying to book orders. I also can't send photos or receive photos from this app, which is a major deal for my work. HUGE disappointment, and would love to see an update. Its been weeks!!! Completely too long to not fix or address these issues.

Not a very reliable app. Seems Facebook needs to update it. Constantly gets frozen and you need to reopen it. Have had to change the cover photo up to 10 times for it to save on the profile. Doesn't individually count all the reviews we've gotten makes it seem like there's less than what we have. Overall it's Ok. Sometimes it works sometimes it doesn't but have to deal with it since our business page is on there.

For a year and a half I have used this app and the last 4 months have been awful. Everything that this app is supposed to (and did) do doesn't work anymore. It freezes, it crashes, it doesn't notify in real time, and now it's connecting/showing my personal page instead of the business page. Or randomly changes response time to messages. I have responded to every message I've ever received, but somehow it puts me at 90%!

I manage several pages on this app. It's OK for doing some posts, but it is lacking a lot of options. On the Pixel 3a, I can't like a user's post, add a photo to an event discussion when I create the event on my fan page (I can only add a photo as an individual user). Most annoying is that I can't upload a video. It uploads half and gets stuck, which happens on various wifi systems and when using data. The only way I can get rid of it is to delete the app and download again. I've reported this.

It's really bad. The old version had it's bugs, but was usually reliable and a relatively easy interface. This new version isn't good at all, if you make a post then go click on it, the thumbnail of the post NEVER gets shown, instead an error message does. And if you have a Facebook/instagram link, there's no way to view your posts in another area without encountering the same problem. I reported this twice now to no avail. Notifications and alerts are also a total mess, same with messages.

Sometimes difficult to find things. Easier to just go to your FB profile and pick the page you manage, but then you don't have the "tab" for messages pop up. Aggravating when you want to show a potential customer something and it doesn't work as you like (not tech issue, more of a "searching" issue; you want to show photos, only a few albums show up and you scroll to find the rest and can't get to them so you have to scroll through ALL your photos...rather embarrassing.

Every update brings a new surprise. You think it would fix the last mess, but no, it gets worse and worse. What the heck is this newest format change? Can't see the main page anymore. Some of my scheduled posts are gone. Can't select the pictures out of a folder, and the pictures I picked will get automatically cropped just like Instagram. Hate it!

Very inconsistent operating. Sometimes it works flawlessly. Most of the time it fails over and over to load any comments. Even after force stopping the app and reopening it still fails. After about 8-10 times it might work once. It will also randomly turn on the messenger away message without activating it. The beta version of the app was uninstalled and the regular version was installed to see if there was a difference. Still has the exact same issues.

Beginning yesterday, it will not open. it tries loading for about 5 seconds and then crashes, without even an option to report. have tried uninstalling and reinstalling. Also, have constantly over the past year had the issue where I get a nitification that I have a message. I can see the sender name and the first line. But when I go to my inbox it doesnt show I got a message at all. it somestimes will take over a day for it to finally show.

Sometimes when I go to share an image on a page, from gallery for example, I click share, and choose FB Business Suite from my options. When I do that, it almost never opens up on the first attempt. I can't even remember a time when it didn't kick me right back to the gallery menu, where I had to choose share again, and start the whole process over. Last night it did this so often, it took me 30 minutes to share on 3 pages. It kicked me back on one page, no less than 30 times!

As of 5.20.2020, I can no longer schedule posts or upload pictures through page manager. Not good! Very frustrating when trying to maintain a business page. It's good and bad. Some days it's working and other days you can't see notifications or messages. Some days uploads don't work. Some days post scheduling date/time selection is incorrect. When it's working, it's been useful.

So frustrating! Shouldn't an app improve over time?! Instead this just took away features. Scheduling posts has become a huge chore. You have to go to scheduling tab then scroll through your photos in chronological order to find them and add to a post. Also there is no way to select what album you want them to go into unless you are doing a non scheduled post. It has the ability to select albums, why not for a scheduled post! Also, why can we still not post videos and photos in same post?!

I love the ease of scheduling, however it has some bugs. 7 out of 10 times, it lowers the quality of my pictures and videos. Sometimes, it phantom posts my posts too early, and it freaks me out until I realize that it isn't actually posted. Business Suite also isn't linked up fully with Instagram, so I don't get feedback on my Reels when I look at my post's performance. You also can't post a reel from the app, which I don't like.

It keeps giving me "your session has expired" notice and to log in again. I have been logging in for 2 days straight! I have restarted my phone 3xs & uninstalled/reinstalled twice. It still won't let me get into my page. I wish it would go back to the old business page. Not user friendly at all! Also when I go in to the help feature it doesn't have any logging in issues listed.

Seems every time I finally get used to things, they update and drastically change the layout of things. This time I can't get to my albums. Can't look at them, can't add albums, can't add to albums.. since all of my pages are very reliant on photos, it's imperative that Ican access albums. Without that option, the app is useless. Only reason for 2 stars is for messaging feature is convenient. Literally that's it

It's horrible. It's constantly changing. Now, I can't edit a post that is scheduled. Like everything with Facebook they fix what isn't broken and then it doesn't work properly. If you have a business it's not worth downloading. More aggravation than anything else. The latest? If I schedule a post on my mobile it doesn't show up if I'm using business suite on my laptop. I also don't get messages from customers in notifications. I'll see it days later. Lovely!

I do not get any notifications for new messages. Suddenly I get over 10 notifications all at once of new messages then when I go to the messages I can only see the old messages. It takes a long time to update the inbox, a very long time. After the new app update things are even worse. Now I only get the message "something went wrong. Please try again later". Basically, I can't see messages as they arrive, extremely late notifications, and now "something went wrong".

At first, it was nice to have a separate app for my hobby portfolio, but this app seriously needs to be updated. So many glitches. If I try to see a reply to a comment, as soon as I click on the reply they all disappear and it only shows the original comment. I cannot initiate a private message to anyone. Occasionally it'll have a message option under a reply, but that only works a fraction of the time. I can't delete old photo albums and can't rename them either.

I've been using this app for about 8 months. For the last 4 months it has really been hit or miss. Talk about frustrating?! I manage several different pages where we post several times a day - both picture and video. We always schedule the posts as well. Some of our team has access via iPhone, and others via Android. There are pros and cons to both. I use my Android phone most of the time.... 1. 85% of the time in the past 4 months, I cannot schedule my posts. I either have to post instantly or not at all. I have tried saving as a draft - and again, when I go in, I have to post immediately, there is no scheduling. 2. When I have to use my iPad to schedule a post - I need to back up all my photos, and then download to the ipad. I select my photos to post and I cannot do a write up about them. No verbiage accepted! 3. When I CAN do the write up on the ipad, and I want to schedule the post - I have to scroll through to the end of all the items scheduled to see what the next availability is. On an Android - they show in the order of date (most recent at the top), not the order they were submitted. 4. Let's try to use the computer! The computer will allow me to do write ups, schedule and add pictures - but I cannot add video! So after transferring the pictures and videos to my computer, I still can't do all the posts necessary. Also, I cannot see the scheduled posts in order by date. There has to be another application that will provide consistent and reliable results. This is NOT the answer. I couldn't be more disappointed.

Constantly updating the app but nothing looks different and nothing changes, it looks and operates exactly the same. Another problem is, I can never delete the notifications. I "delete" them and they come right back. I also get notifications late. Plus, there's an option to see who "likes" your page but why can't we see who's"following" our page? I'm really not enjoying this app.

This app was fantastic when it first came out. Now after the several updates and changes over the past few years it's been terrible! My new messages aren't showing up so I have to constantly delete the app data and sign back in to see them. We also used to have the option to move photos from a "mobile uploads" album into other albums and now you cant. You can't move any photos into other albums... For some reason they won't add it back even though it was incredibly useful for us businesses.

Terrible! You can't actually effectively manage your pages at all! I can't add photos to already established photo albums anymore. I can't tag other pages in posts when I'm working with another page on a project. I have to juggle this, the regular fb app AND a PC to *maybe* actually do what I want with my pages.... even then, it doesn't always work.

8-18-22 I hate these updates. It doesn't make any sense at all jumping between pages and profiles; I can't edit any albums, individual pictures, titles and I can't delete albums either because there's no options for any of it in the "..." icon, is empty. I can't stand clicking on a notification and it switch my profile user. Business Suites programmers are making it impossible to enjoy this app. I'm getting upset with the constant disruption.

Terrible Replacement to Facebook Pages. I was excited to be able to manage both FB and IG for my business in one place. It is awful! I receive notifications of comments from IG, but I can't see them to respond. I schedule posts to be published to both apps, it only publishes to one. Just a couple of many, many things that do not work for ease of access across my PAGE. This could have been made so much better. I expected more. Desktop version is just as bad. Poorly executed.

Horrible, every time an update happens, it gets worse and worse. My linked Instagram account is somehow getting excluded when I choose the option to post on both Instagram and Facebook at the same time now. And all the posts I did on my Instagram are simply not there, nor on the app, or anywhere. They're lost and this has been happening for months now. Don't you think this is enough? I'm losing precious ideas.

I manage multiple biz pages. We post and pay for ads. I need to send the same info to people that ask for it when they respond it. I click on the "Message" option in the post when they request more info. Page Manager opens up with the ad at the bottom and says which account I'm sending the message with. YOU CANNOT "PASTE" THE INFO IN THE RESPONSE! I have to re-write it every time. A waste of time. I did find that if you write a word then you can THEN get the then the Paste option. Please resolve!

It would be great if all features worked. I can't edit my page info to update my hours. Update: dropped to 1 star. I can't post photos through the app, it keeps saying I have no connection (but I can post them through the Facebook app just fine). I have no way to contact anyone about the issue. I tried reporting the problem and got literally no response. I still can't edit page info properly. FIX IT PLEASE

Went from hero to zero. The most recent update has made it so that every time I try to use this app, I get an error that my connection has timed out, even if I just logged in moments before. What the heck!? Got this specifically to be able to manage my group page, and especially pictures/albums, without having to go through a laptop.

Something is going on with the app. It was very good and I scheduled my posts weekly. But, a few weeks ago, as mentioned by other users, it is not allowing to publish photos and a circle is maintained as expected and the photos never load. It's complicated because I can no longer use it from my cell phone. I have disconnected the app twice and it does nothing. Please correct it.

This app needs a lot of work. First off, the app doesn't update quickly, even when you force it to refresh. My regular Facebook updates faster. You have no power to edit your albums or posts (huge detractor). Tagging people doesn't even pull from your friends or liked by list first. It's totally random strangers with no affiliation. The messaging is slow to give push notifications. I can't even message someone from my page (not even from a comment on my page). They have to send me a message first). This app needs a lot of work to be useful for managing my business. Normally, I leave positive reviews. But I have few positive things to say. The only time I find this app useful is to respond to messages I know are waiting... That and setting calendar appointments. Otherwise, step up your game Facebook. You want me to pay for adds on a page I have a hard time managing from a mobile device and app you developed. If I want to use my business page to its full potential I need to use a computer.

The worst app, but I need to use it when on the go. It's frustrating how they rate you for responsiveness on your page when the notification for their app dont work in the first place. The red badges that are for unread messages won't go away even if you've read them all. It's just a frustrating app, and a pain to use. One can tell that FB employees don't manage FB pages of their own. If you work on it, own it and be its no. 1 hard core user. /peace

title: Google News - Daily Headlines
description:
Google News is a personalized news aggregator that organizes and highlights what‚Äôs happening in the world so you can discover more about the stories that matter to you.

With Google News, you‚Äôll find:

YOUR BRIEFING: It can be nearly impossible to keep up with every story you care about, Your Briefing makes it easy to stay in the know about what‚Äôs important and relevant in your world. It updates throughout the day to bring you the top local, national, and world headlines, plus personalized news tailored to your interests.

LOCAL NEWS: Explore your community through stories and articles from news outlets in your local area. Customize and choose multiple locations so you can know what‚Äôs happening near you or wherever home is.

FULL COVERAGE: Dive deeper into a story with multiple perspectives. The Full Coverage feature organizes everything online about a story, surfacing and highlighting coverage from different outlets and mediums. With just a tap, you‚Äôll uncover how the story is unfolding and how everyone is reporting on it.

STORIES FOR YOU: The For You section delivers personalized news related to your interests. Take control and customize the articles you see by following the topics and sources you care about.

ACCESS FROM ANY DEVICE: Google News is designed to meet the needs of users with different phones and levels of connection. When your connection isn‚Äôt strong or you need to save data, Google News will continue to work smoothly by slimming down the size of images and downloading less data. Articles can be downloaded over Wi-Fi to save for later when you are offline.

Do you prefer to access your news on your Laptop or Desktop? Pair the Google News mobile app with our Desktop website, news.google.com, so you can stay up to date and access the news no matter what device you‚Äôre on.
descriptionHTML:
Google News is a personalized news aggregator that organizes and highlights what‚Äôs happening in the world so you can discover more about the stories that matter to you.

With Google News, you‚Äôll find:

YOUR BRIEFING: It can be nearly impossible to keep up with every story you care about, Your Briefing makes it easy to stay in the know about what‚Äôs important and relevant in your world. It updates throughout the day to bring you the top local, national, and world headlines, plus personalized news tailored to your interests.

LOCAL NEWS: Explore your community through stories and articles from news outlets in your local area. Customize and choose multiple locations so you can know what‚Äôs happening near you or wherever home is.

FULL COVERAGE: Dive deeper into a story with multiple perspectives. The Full Coverage feature organizes everything online about a story, surfacing and highlighting coverage from different outlets and mediums. With just a tap, you‚Äôll uncover how the story is unfolding and how everyone is reporting on it.

STORIES FOR YOU: The For You section delivers personalized news related to your interests. Take control and customize the articles you see by following the topics and sources you care about.

ACCESS FROM ANY DEVICE: Google News is designed to meet the needs of users with different phones and levels of connection. When your connection isn‚Äôt strong or you need to save data, Google News will continue to work smoothly by slimming down the size of images and downloading less data. Articles can be downloaded over Wi-Fi to save for later when you are offline.

Do you prefer to access your news on your Laptop or Desktop? Pair the Google News mobile app with our Desktop website, news.google.com, so you can stay up to date and access the news no matter what device you‚Äôre on.
summary: Stay informed with latest world & local news personalized for your interest

scraped_reviews.content: used to be a good app. now not so much. too many items hidden behind pay walls. need a way to suppress those. I don't want large pictures in the feed index. this recently changed. I want to read the news not look at pictures. I'm not sure if there is another app that does this but I'm looking. 8/23 now borders on useless. no mini cards at all. I want news not pictures

If all of your 5 star review are for the "older version" maybe you should have left it alone. In fact, how can you claim all the old reviews, its a completely different app! Try making a new app, and not deleting the old one? No dark mode. Big photos(that may or may not match the story) and videos, very short headlines. Some of us still read, and don't need a bunch of eye candy.

This app has gotten more frustrating to use. First, they don't offer any kind of protection against aggressive ads. It's extremely common for the entire page to be covered with ads, forcing me to open the article in a different browser, just to read it. And the app keeps only half loading pages. I'll be half way through reading an article, when the words stop and it's just a white page. Very disappointing.

Unlike the older version, I could no longer login to my current Washington Post subscription due to bugs, so I couldn't read more than a few stories a month in my subscribed newspaper. It also wouldn't remember that I was logged in to my local paper subscription, so I had to login again any time I saw a headline that I wanted to check out. When I contacted customer service (about the first issue, which seemed most pressing), I received no reply. Another annoyance is that the only available widget is the large one. The old version had a smaller widget that didn't include large pictures, and it fit my screen better. It would be nice if they had kept that as an option.

Terrible. First of all, the stories often freeze while I'm scrolling through them, making it take forever to read them. I often don't make it all the way through. It seems to freeze mostly as it's loading an ad that I'm trying to scroll past, so I end up stuck on a blank, unloaded ad that I won't be reading anyway. Even worse, if I rotate the phone, it reloads the entire news story and restarts at the top, so I lose my place. (It's easy to do this accidentally if I move across the room to, say, take something off the stove. It happens all the time.) On top of that, some the news sites limit me to maybe 3 stories a month, and when I rotate the phone and it reloads the page, that counts as another story. I can reach my limit on a single story. Overall, it's a very poorly thought-out and poorly written app.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi Miguel. Sorry to hear you're experiencing issues. Please create a post in our Google News Forum for our community of experts to assist: https://goo.gle/2KJcIk5. Appreciate it!

scraped_reviews.content: Overall I enjoy the app. video playback implementation could use a lot of work in the news articles that contain video. most of the time I struggle to get the video to play full screen, and then if you rotate your device the video stops playing and it goes to the top of the news article. Then if you press play trying to pick up where you left off the video starts over often with another ad.

Incredibly buggy. Feels like it's still in alpha, not even beta yet. Google's "simplified view" for web pages is NOT user friendly -- it forces a small font that's difficult to read, and when you zoom, you can't drag, so you have to zoom out and back till you can focus on what you actually want to see. Most embedded videos don't even work -- however the ads do :-\ . This app is not ready for prime time.

I can't stand this app. I don't want video links dominating the news. Almost 100% of the notifications don't work (by the time I click on them, it takes me an empty list of "recent notifications", and provides no way to get to the story). The embedded browser is obnoxious and behaves awfully; I just had one instance where I clicked on a story, and it just brought me to list of other articles by the same publisher. Where is the story whose headline I actually clicked on?

Really poor upgrade from the old News and Weather app. Can no longer customize the Headlines section, you are forced to depends Google's "For You" algorithm. No settings are transferred from the old app, including subscription information. You'll have to fill that out again, and it didn't even work for me when I did. Weather takes a click to see now. All in all a remarkably lazy effort. Will be using News as long as I can.

This app sucks compared to the old news and weather app. It doesn't fit in the same space, it takes up so much more room. I don't want to see all kinds of pictures, I just want headlines, like the old app and have the ability to click what I want to read. It gets worse, I'm trying to read something and it moves off the screen by itself. It also just refreshes by itself. You're reading something and about to click it to read more and then it refreshes and it's gone. Why try to make this all cute and animated? I just want the news!

So much less than the old news and weather app. I can't choose my topics, I can't remove things like sports, I cant add interest features, even mini cards take up a good portion of the screen, I can't add local sections for more than my current location, the local weather is less useful and doesn't give same granularity of detail. I guess data harvesting is easier for Google. Very disappointed I'm stuck with this for news and I'm actively looking for alternatives.

Can't easily filter out news sources that I don't like. I don't want spoilers from movies and TV shows, and they're fairly frequent. Also, on a limited data plan, this app chewed through 2+ GB of data in a couple hours in the background, not even using it. Fix these issues, and I might give it another chance, until then, I'm uninstalling it.

Can you please add "save for later" and "more like this" buttons? Sometimes I don't have time to read right that second but it captures my interest, only for all the stories I hearted to go missing after the auto-refresh. There's a bookmark article button, but that's only if you click into the story. I appreciate getting to dismiss what I don't like, but the algorithm isn't swift enough to understand what I DO like, at least not now. A "more" button would be easier. Thank you.

No matter how many times I banish certain topics (for instance, sports and entertainment), these stories incessantly clutter my feed. Hitting "see less of [x]" clearly does nothing. For that reason, I'll be looking for an alternative to Google News‚Äîif it weren't for that glaring failure, the app would be just fine and usable, but as it is, it's more trouble than it's worth.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi there. Thanks for your review! We'd like to help you. Let us know more about your question. Alternatively, if you continue to experience issues with this please create a post in our Google News Forum for our community of experts to assist: https://goo.gle/2KJcIk5. Appreciate it!

scraped_reviews.content: App has not updated news articles in eleven days. Also loses your place returning to the top. All in all not Google's finest effort! Update 5/15/18 Gee, I never would have figured that out! That was the first thing I did!!!!!!!!!!! Update 5/2/19 Now it updates constantly, and speaking of constantly, notifications all the time with no way to stop them! And forget about filtering content. My feed is littered with sites I have no interest in and in languages I do not speak.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi Chris. Sorry to hear you're experiencing issues. Please create a post in our Google News Forum for our community of experts to assist: https://goo.gle/2KJcIk5. Appreciate it!

scraped_reviews.content: GONE is the ability to automatically open stories in an external browser. GONE is the ability to browse news without being logged in - so they can track what you read and you end up seeing the same kinds of stories all the time because they're being "helpful". Stay out of my business, Google. I like seeing lots of different kinds of stories from many different sources, not your "curated" news.

When reading the articles, Google News will occasionally reload, taking you to the top of the list. Selecting an article to read never returns you to the same point in the list, so you are constantly scrolling, and never know where you are in the list, unless you are at the top again. Also see an increase in the siloing of opinion, as I see far fewer articles with differing opinions. It is a nicer interface and has more to read than before.

Each new incarnation of Google news has been more tedious and less intuitive than the last. First swiping away articles disappeared, now the articles are grouped by topic. While this is great in theory, entire topics can't be removed at one time. For example, if I'm not interested in reading about the stock market crash, I have to give all five of the associated articles a "thumbs down" individually. It is also no longer possible to designate non-preferred topics in the feed. To use the stock market example again, the prior option of, "not interested in stories about the stock market" has been removed. I feel that I'm now spending more time clearing out the things I don't want to read than accessing articles of use or interest. The lack of scrolling in the widget is also disappointing. On a brighter note, the new app is pretty.

I HATE that I had to get rid of the Google News and Weather app. I loved the weather widget, and there are none like it that show you in one row the weather for the next few days, with the highs and lows. Also, can't find a good app to show you the weather in the app quickly for the temp, humidity, precipitation and wind nicely. FINALLY, where are the Local sections? Those were my favorite pieces...

I dislike this app, compared to what it used to be. With the Google news and weather app, you could get a widget that showed the weather for the next 4 or 5 days, and you could see all the headlines at once instead of having to press the little arrows to see more that one headline. I've had to replace it with a separate weather app and news app. Very annoying!

Nice mix of content but be aware that it can be a data hog. In one day of being without wifi, it racked up over 500 Mb of mobile data so beware if you have limited data on your plan After this revelation, I checked my monthly usage for this program and it racked up 23 Gb of data in a month. That seems ridiculous to me. While I like the program, I don't want to use a program that burns so much data just for news stories. I think it comes from all of the video that automatically starts to play as you scroll through stories. I will be uninstalling the program now and will look for a less data hungry news app. The old version never uses that much data!

2 things really annoy me about this app. 1 - that it closes if you go to another app. So you can start reading an article, go to messages to respond to a text, then you have to re-find the article and re-find where you left off 2 - that it doesn't let you block specific news sites. I don't support Fox news and don't ever want to read their articles. However, sometimes you miss the site name bc it's in small print. I don't want them to get a single click.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi Mia. Thanks for your review! We'd like to help you. Let us know more about your question. Alternatively, if you continue to experience issues with this please create a post in our Google News Forum for our community of experts to assist: https://goo.gle/2KJcIk5. Appreciate it!

scraped_reviews.content: Filled with ads. Every article I look at through this app is filled with ads, so much so that there is very little screen space that is not covered with ads, where I can actually read the article I came to read. Moreover, most articles also have popup video ads, which also prevent me from reading the article. And, it is very difficult to find the X to close the ads,.without clicking on the ad itself. The situation has only gotten worse over the last year, and I'm not looking at other news apps.

Not happy with this at all. The app it replaced let me see the news in the categories I wanted, and in the order I wanted to see them. It was probably my most used app. If this functionality is available in this new app, it is not intuitive or obvious. I switched to Flipboard, which isn't as good as the older version of Google News, but at least I can easily organize the feed.

Absolutely inferior to Google News & Weather, most notably due to almost a complete lack of weather information. With News & Weather, weather information was easily available, including temperature, precipitation, wind, etc. This app has none of that. Plus, for the news portion, this new app has a giant UI that shows significantly less information and articles than before. I wish I could give this zero stars.

I got a trail subscription for a magazine, and was instructed to install newsstands to activate it, eventually got to this app, since newstands was discontinued. it was absurdly difficult to find the magazine i was looking for, at first i wasnt sure if this was even the right app at all, the search didn't even bring back any magazines as an option, i eventually found it by clicking on the 'show more' magazines and scrolling forever.

A pretty good aggregator of news. Some of the default sources are behind paywalls, but can be filtered out easily enough. The largest issue I have with it is that you can't adjust the font size. Some of us older folks need that option. I have to open each article in a browser to read them. (I know about system font size, and already have set.) Every other app has a size adjustment, but the News team is too lazy to make one.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Thanks for the feedback, Tony! We appreciate the suggestions as we strive to make Google News better and better.

scraped_reviews.content: I'm so disappointed with this new version compared to the previous app . Worse, I can no longer use the previous app (Google News & Weather). The new one is too distracting with large pictures, overlaid captions and movement. I often find I can't even read the captions over the images because of contrast issues. Instead of making me want to read the news it's repelling me. But maybe that's healthier;-)

Needs content filter options. I'm so sick of having important tv/movie plot points revealed before I've had the chance to watch. It's happened several times and is getting very frustrating. Please give option to blacklist certain terms/topics temporarily (for example, blacklist "Game of Thrones" until I've had time to watch, and then reactivate the topic when I'm ready to read about the episode). This would be a huge improvement!

This App is a serious data hog and unfortunately, I'd rather have the old app. I burned nearly an entire month's worth of data with my carrier in less than an hour on this new app, and all I was doing was reading the news. There was no available wireless connection.   If there is a way to throttle the data usage, it's not obvious.   I've had to uninstall it and turn on all my data conservation modes for the next 3 weeks.   It's pretty, but if it burns data, it's not useful.

4/5 just because of extra app now. Originally I thought I'd have an issue with ANOTHER app from Google that I have to download and take up more space and for what? Seems like the layout of things were more integrated which is always most convenient. But it hasn't seemed to be to much of an inconvenience. I don't really even think about it to much anymore. As far as content... Always good stuff and even better that it's of what I want. And easy to get rid of the stuff I don't want.

Crashes constantly. I'm able to read one or two articles and it crashes. Sometimes it crashes while loading one of the articles I clicked on in my notifications. As far as content, it seems to heavily favor just a handful of outlets. I'll scroll for quite a while only seeing three or so news sites. It would be much better to have a nice spread of sources.

I got this for a magazine subscription as Google Assistant already gives me general news links. But it's really bad for magazine management. If you're reading a long article, short story, or novella, it forgets your place when you return to the app. Navigation within the magazine requires too many steps to get around. The magazines you purchase are hard to find. It's good for single short articles, but the UX doesn't do full issues well at all.

Doesn't do a great job of avoiding topics you choose to see fewer of. Interested in an NCAA sport? You'll get most anything in the news about the NCAA, not just the sport you wanted to see. And notifications changed for the worse. There is no more drop-down arrow that would unfold to show the rest of the headline. So now when you get spammed with stories that you don't care about, you have to go into the app itself to see if it's of interest, negating the whole point of notifications.

Data Blitz 500 word limit on reviews... Makes it hard to explain the whole issue. Short version: Never thought reading text (Rarely watch anything in a video, faster to read it) would take so much data. Turns out it's a common problem with this app. Yes, all settings and permissions are set to minimize data usage. This app burns through several GB's per month just to read a little on breaks and lunch. Try again, let us know when we can read current events without it costing a fortune

This app is mediocre at best. It functions well and I can honestly say I've never experienced a crash. However, the best articles, from the major sources, always seem to be limited in their free reading. This makes zero sense as you can look up the article on the web for free at any time after you've reached your limit on Google News. I would much rather have a set monthly charge from Google News and allow totally free reading. It gets extremely frustrating to go back and forth.

When I try to snooze the motion sensor alerts it does not work. Help says to go to device and then go to motion snooze and adjust the slider. There is no motion snooze option under my device. There is a setting where I can set a time to snooze but it does not work. Alexa goes off every time the mower goes by. Or anybody else that I try to snooze. So it appears that this app is up to date. I guess that means the help section is wrong. Very annoying issue.

Great app with much needed polish. My main issue with it is that they should have an option to open in Chrome once you the news you are reading. Instead they force you to go to the site via the app but not opened in the web browser directly. Then if you click to open in the site it opens but within a browser in itself, then it takes another click to actually go to the browser of your choosing. The other is that when you turn the screen landscape it doesn't automatically maximize the videos.

I have used this app on my phone for quite a few years, but I have drifted away from it and gone back to my laptop for news surfing. The number and presentation of advertisements inbedded has become way too annoying. It used to be I could just scroll the ad off of screen and continue reading, but now there are at least 2 ads per page and more often than not it's a damn video. Microsoft News has gone the same route, so I stopped using that one too. Damn shame.

Worst 15 dollars I ever spent. For some reason 5.7 gigabytes of background data were consumed overnight while disconnected from wifi. Can't imagine what the app was up to while I was asleep, but that is unacceptable, not to mention costly. I'm not even a big fan of the interface or how the articles are sorted, I would much rather browse Google News in Chrome. 0 stars.

Hate it! I download my subscribed magazines. It claims they are downloaded, but then changes its mind when I actually try to read it. Says I need to be online. Amazingly annoying and frustrating. Makes it just useless on my tablet. UPDATE: still sucks a year (or more) later. why can this not be fixed? I PAY for the magazine, but it is not readable half the time because of this horrible app.

I don't see any advantage to this app. The previous one was much more concise, with more of the articles I was interested available on screen.   The biggest problem is that videos autp-play, and I couldn't find how to turn that off in the settings. Not sure if you can turn it off. Having videos come on when I reading in the middle of the night isn't helpful.   I deleted the app, and now just go to the google news website on my android tablet.

Within the last couple versions, they've removed the ability to "show more" under the options next to an article under "For you". This was a great way to see a few more articles on topics you migh like without having to save something under "Following". Now you can only suggest less of an article type and I'm not sure how to easily see more of something. -- They also haven't fixed the AMP pages where a site uses a script when you swipe back, it shows a "more articles" screen with more ads.

The AI gives me what it thinks I want to read the most. So like a self-fullfilling profecy, the more it gives me something, the more I read that stuff, then the more news of that type are fed to me. That results in very boring, one-dimensional kind of news feed. I got fed up, uninstalled it, and got Micorosoft news app which gives me the more traditional, categorized news feed. Now I no longer miss some great news just because some stupid AI decided to skip it.

It's just ok. For years now the widget that gives you 5 stories with headlines and a picture usually works, but sometimes it's just blank. It didn't work for a few days in November, but another update fixed it again. Sometimes clicking on an article in the widget does nothing, and scrolling the 5 stories with the arrows has horrible lag. The articles are good, though, and always available with the app, even if the widget isn't so great.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi Mike. Thanks for reporting this issue. Can you please submit a feedback report and tell us a little bit more about what you're experiencing so we can investigate further? Open Google News app - at the top right, tap your profile - Help & feedback - Send feedback, this will help us ensure that this gets reviewed by the right team. Appreciate it!

scraped_reviews.content: Auto play videos with sound, seriously? I come to this app to read the news, not to be blasted with unwanted video sound. That is completely unacceptable! The suggested articles have also become increasingly less relevant to me as the app has been tweaked. Want to share an article? The link will get wrapped up to open through the app rather than linking to the content directly. This was once a great app, now I'm looking for a replacement.

Became exasperating. No way to adjust preferences for topics. Click on an item and you will be inundated till the end of time. A Voice click will have options added with Miley and Blake the next time you open. And do not ever click one of those! It's a geometric progression. Suppose it's ok if you are enthralled with celebrity or want to know what they have worn to somewhere 6 months ago. Not for me. Uninstalled.

I have used this app for a long time and loved it until recently. I could get a range of topics and news sources all in one place. It now resets or reloads the news stories frequently, so I read a few then I'm jumped back to the top story again. Annoying and frustrating compounded by the fact that as I scroll down to where I was when it jumped the story that I wanted to read is gone. Hope this is just a temporary thing and not a "new feature," so I can go back to giving it more stars again.

I have been using this app for years. I love it - I would normally give it 5-stars. But I think your last update had a major bug in it. It has recently (& constantly) been freezing mid-scroll. I just tried to read a relatively short article and again it kept freezing, forcing me to close the App entirely and re-launch it each time. I swore if it froze a fourth time before I finished the article, I'd write a review - and here I am. I really want to keep using this app. Please fix it.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi Lori. Thanks for using Google News! If the app crashes, please try the steps listed here: https://goo.gle/2H5hF5N. If you are still experiencing issues, please let us know on the Google News Community: https://goo.gle/2KJcIk5. Appreciate it!

scraped_reviews.content: Works well but ultimately useless. There's no option to automatically open the articles externally, so they open in the app with ads, which makes them unreadable. There's an option once you're in the internal browser to open externally, but if you do that for every article then you might as well just use the browser version to begin with. I realize the entire point of the internal browser is to display the ads, so it's not surprising. But a single ad of any type, any location, is one too many.

title: HOMER: Fun Learning For Kids

üìö Expert-Designed, Kid-Powered, Proven to Build Reading Confidence!
Meet HOMER‚Äîthe award-winning learn-to-read app designed to help kids ages 2‚Äì8 master reading through play. Backed by research and proven results, HOMER‚Äôs personalized pathway makes reading fun, effective, and confidence-building.
üöÄ The Essential Learn-to-Read App for Kids
 üß† Just 15 Minutes a Day = 74% Reading Growth!
Thousands of families and educators trust HOMER to give children a strong start in reading and early learning. With 1,000+ activities‚Äîincluding games, stories, and songs‚Äî kids stay engaged while building the skills they need for school and life.
Why Reading Comes First with HOMER
‚úî Step-by-step phonics program designed by experts
 ‚úî Letter recognition, sight words, spelling, and vocabulary building
 ‚úî Interactive stories to improve comprehension and fluency
 ‚úî Personalized reading games that adapt to your child‚Äôs age and level
