summary: Get 24/7 access to PNC Bank accounts and find the nearest branch or ATM.

scraped_reviews.content: When I'm actually in the app it's perfectly fine, but logging in is becoming such a hassle. I wish I could post a picture of the login screen. It keeps deleting my biometric data and when I put my password it just bugs out. I've started needing to actually delete and reinstall the app to make it work. It's gotten worse over the last couple months. Hoping there's a fix to it soon. I usually never review, but it's getting bad.

This app is super buggy. The biometrics works when it feels like it. The accuracy of items pending lags. it will show me balance and I have enough to spend but then surprise surprise it is not updated. Searching for charges for vendor isn't a thing. It is the worst app ever. Last weekend there was supposed to be upgrade. Nope. Today it doesn't even login in routinely. it's so frustrating.

This app cannot remember biometrics, refuses to show my info between midnight and 4a, especially on weekends, and has frequent issues just getting a cursor to appear in the username and password fields. Their website is not much better. I have been with this bank since 2000 and these issues started about 2 years ago with no improvement. I will be leaving this year due to these tech failings, which sucks because they are pretty good at being a bank.

At times very frustrating. For some reason nearly every other time I use the App I sign up for biometrics again as though it is the first time. And to add to the annoyance every now and then signing up for biometrics causes the app to enter the circling icon of lock up. But otherwise the App is fine for mobile banking. PNC please hire a more professional App Developer. At times I have thought of switching banks based solely on the App experience.

Mobile information doesn't match web information. On the app, it isn't properly reflecting my "scheduled out" information; making my "Free until _" amount incorrect. This makes it difficult to get a quick glimps on what is available before making an unscheduled payment or purchase. The calendar tool on the app also doesn't seem to be reflecting my scheduled out payments. The web site works great, just not the app. The app has conflicting information with web.

For the last several days I have been repeatedly trying to get into the app to check my balance but it immediately shows a message that I'm not connected to the Internet and won't let me log in. I am on a good Internet connection so there's clearly a problem with the app. I have uninstalled and reinstalled, restarted my device, cleared the cache, no matter what I do it won't let me get past that message and log in. I am not sure what to do now. Just awful

Way too strict on locking account holders out and having to change passwords. Very annoying. you do t allow a copy and paste....but If I leave the login screen to look at my password in my other app, you make me start over and then you shut me out after 3 tries because I have to look at the pw a few times or I had a typo. It's ridiculous....that is the point of the 2 party authentication. That should be enough

I have used the app daily for years and it is capable. But there is a very irritating bug: the app routinely (and frequently) disables biometrics and forces me to re-enter credentials. The request for a fingerprint does not consistently present upon login; and, it is too easy to accidentally turn off biometrics when trying to get the app to present and accept biometrics. Biometrics ceases to be convenient when the bank limits your ability to use them. Samsung S24 Android user.

When the app works, it does most of what you would want out of a banking app. I frequently am unable to log in due to "No Network Connection" when I am on multi-gigabit Wi-Fi or getting errors within the app when trying to deposit funds. Biometrics also frequently reset and you have to set it back up often. If they could fix those bugs, it would be a totally usable banking app. As-is, it's pretty hard to continue using PNC.

I've been using this app for years but recently it's been crashing an awful lot. I would say it was a five-star but I'm going down to three. basically every time you pay off your credit card it'll submit the payment but then your screen will be in an endless loop and you have to sign off and sign back on to get back to the main screen. it also sometimes crashes right after you take a picture of a check to cash it

Every time they get this app working correctly, they screw it up again. I'm getting sick of having to reset my password, because you cannot reuse any of the last 10 passwords, but the app keeps locking me out anyway. they told me they had this resolved, but I got locked out again today. and now once again when they send a one-time passcode via text message, you can no longer just do a copy/paste of that passcode, You have to actually read it and input it manually. why do they keep screwing it up

Super Buggy Not Reliable. I try to and use biometrics for login. then at times it turns it off automatically. then I have to re-enable it. I opened up an account about 2 weeks ago and this keeps happening. plus when I enter my password it won't even log me in! when I checked the app and my account not even 20min before. I'm about to not bank with this company

The PNC app has some positives but doesn't hold a candle to other banking apps. It appears to be an old design with a lot of silly errors. For instance, bill pay is useless in many ways. Setting up electronic payments fails for many vendors that worked flawlessly on Chase. Error codes are generic and unhelpful. Scheduling payments is the worst. The app is smart enough to tell you that a bill can't be sent in time if you pick a date too soon but infuriatingly won't block those dates.

Pretty easy to deposit a check by phone, though limits seem low. Sending money by Zelle: if one enters text for an optional reason, and then goes back to edit the amount (for example, recognizing an error in the amount), the text is discarded and lost and requires retyping (unless one copies it to the clipboard first) ... why so unhelpful?

7/29/25 Update: Mobile deposit works better, so that's nice. However a new, much more annoying issue has surfaced. I use the biometric (i.e. fingerprint) login, but more times than not, the app tells me it doesn't work and I have to type in my password. Once I get into the app it then gives me the option to turn on biometrics, which I do only to have it tell me it doesn't work the next time I log in.

Terrible app. For the last few months it disables biometrics and requires you to use the login. Then it stalls and you have to exit and enter it again. After, it prompts to use biometrics so you re-enroll and have to do that all over again every few times you try to use the app. When making deposits, after you go through the process and click to deposit, it kicks you out of the app-so you have to do that all over again as well. It's riddled with bugs. Most of the reviews are also off topic.

I wish it had a better search feature for past purchases, like, if I could search for a word and it could find the purchase that way. Also every time I take a picture of a check to deposit it, the app force closes and I have to reopen, sign in and start over. Edit on 6/11/25 .. Still force closes after taking pic of check, have to try to sign in multiple times to even get into the app. This app is getting worse and worse.

This app is extremely unreliable. It very often says "mobile network required" when I have a full wifi connection, requiring a full restart of my phone to get it to work. Other times it just will not load at all, it stays on the PNC logo and will not work for several days no matter how good my connection is. The app wasn't always like this, recent updates have very noticably damaged the performance.

Took me about 2 hours to log into the app to access Zelle. I got various errors from a continuously flashing entry of my user ID and Password, to a message that there was a network error and I should check my connection. After changing my password, I also tried to reset up biometrics, but it was "Loading" forever and never let me set it up. I skipped biometrics, was finally able to access Zelle and made my payment. Phew! VERY frustrating!

I've had constant issues with the PNC app. Almost every time I sign in, it logs me out immediately, forcing me to enter my credentials twice just to get in. Trying to deposit a check? Same problem. It signs out during the process and makes me start over. On top of that, the app shows ‚Äúservice unavailable‚Äù around 25 percent of the time, making it unreliable when I actually need to access my account. This app needs serious stability and user experience improvements

EDIT 7/25: Where this app used to be her, I had the worst time in trying to use the mobile deposit. the app freezes, logs out, or never can read and process the check. I have to physically go to the bank to deposit now and its very frustrating since my bank isnt close anymore. Great app to have. Allows you do to anything you need. Very useful when it comes to depositing checks. Never had any issues.

I have used PNC as a bank for a good number of years. As technology improved, the mobile app was useful. However, with the last update for the app, it no longer works. I get the same errors as others. No network connection, app just freezes up, etc. I have cleared cache, uninstall the app, restarted the phone, nothing works. If PNC can't get it together soon, I will switch to another bank that has a working app .

The app works perfect maybe 30% of the time. the other 70% is an issue as follows: When trying to log into the app (I have already saved my password and set up biometrics) and every time I sign in I have an issue with the biometrics and I have to reactivate it. Right now I can't even sign in because my username and password are not popping up even though they are saved under my Google password manager. Please fix this issue or I think I will get a new bank.

Update- I now consistently have issues with the app and when I call to talk to customer service I get wait times of up to 5 hours for help and still nothing. I switched over to pnc for the convenience of being able to do everything through the mobile app. It has been anything but convenient. They give me a 2500 dollar limit each month of how much I can deposit, and also takes days, sometimes weeks for the deposit to go through. Definitely considering switching banks now.

This app has had a habit of automatically logging me out as soon as I log in for the last couple of months now, so I can only rarely ever actually do anything on it besides see balances behind the logout notice, and somehow in 2025 we're still regularly taking up to four days for withdrawals of all sorts to hit "pending" on accounts, which means you can never really get an accurate read on anything happening with them unless you're just doing the app's most basic job yourself. Switch banks.

Seems to work pretty well. I like being able to get electronic check info from the main menu. Check deposit works well, except occasionally they're doing work and it won't be accepted. It seems they could tell me that before I scan. I also really like Zelle being integrated. It makes those transactions seem more secure.

after logging in, it will often just shut off. I am asked to take a pic of my check multiple times till it registers it (I've tried all kinds of ways to get it to work the first time). half the time I go to login, it's either being worked on or says it's temporarily out of service for the time and I have to try again later. it's not a reliable app at all. if you need to check something right away, don't bother.....going to a bank might just be quicker. what's the point in the app then?

Ever since PNC updated their website to their online banking, I've had issues with both the website and app. The bill pay reminders disappeared, and I can't add them back. The app keeps freezing, and some bills have been paid late, despite the fact I pay them before they are due. I've contacted PNC on multiple occasions with no resolution. It's very frustrating to the point that I'm starting to consider a new bank.

Since the last update whenever I try to change the date for paying a bill early the app freezes. Before that, it was great. Please fix! HERE WE ARE 8/20/25 and this issue is still happening! I'd like to be able to pay my bills ahead of when they're due but the app isn't allowing me to! Is anyone reading this!!!!

Just awful. This app barely works, frequently crashes or locks up for no reason. The interface is terrible and unintuitive to use. The help is worthless and provides almost no information. The alerts don't work properly and can't be set consistently. I could go on and on. Save yourself a lot of frustration and don't use this app.

Well it worked briefly back in May giving me hope and now it's unusable again. Previous: ----- Horrible. It was a solid app that did all that I expected it to do. Now, it's horrible. First they took away international support so that you couldn't use the app overseas even with a VPN. As a military family stationed abroad this means we can't access our accounts. Now with the latest update the app doesn't even launch.

Can't update the app after 8/2025 update. The user interface isn't great. Processing times aren't accurate for transfers within the PNC bank account for checking and savings every transaction is pending excessively long. They also do not have good customer service, tech support after numerous issues with the bank, app and online login issues among other issues.

far more difficult to do typical banking tasks that are easily accomplished in apps from all other banks that I've used. Standout example is trying to set up a recurring credit card payment. I believe it is impossible in this app, but it is a central feature of any bank app that has credit cards. Frequent outages and interruptions in service availability. Scheduled out feature is un intuitive and difficult to see where those funds are going and why (I can't figure it out in the app)

When it works, the tools the app provides have some of the best tools of any banking app I use. However, it increasingly seems to crash, pretend there's no service, or log me out when trying to utilize those tools. Mobile deposits in particular seem to log me out of the app a solid 75% of the time, which is a shame because that's the most useful feature on the app!

I expect more and better from a bigger bank. It seems to work ok if you just want to grow your accounts. Sometimes it asks me to sign in multiple ways, other times it asks if it's ok to use my password. the most aggravating is when I'm depositing multiple checks and it decides to say "app not working, wait or close app." üòµ‚Äçüí´

Have you ever wanted a banking app that crashes 90% of the way through nearly every mobile deposit? How about an app that randomly logs you out for no reason while you're using it? Maybe even an app that just doesn't work at all on a fairly consistent basis? Look no further. This one checks all the boxes and then some. Let the frustration begin!

I just updated this app, and that was a mistake. All I can do know, after a couple of tries and waiting forever and a day for the app to load, is look at my balance and transactions. I accidentally damaged my card, cardless access no longer works, zelle no longer woorks, requesting card replacement no longer works. Whenever you try to access these functions, the fonts and screen background expands until it it un-scrollable and the screen stays stuck.

Easy to use, can view all my PNC accounts business and personal with one login. Update 6/24/205... Taking 2 stars - The app has been buggy lately. I had to reset password a few times (even though the password worked on the bank website) and I have been getting the service is unavailable. Sure hope they figure it out be because I do like it when it's working.

This app is fine but it's not great. Too often the "Accounts" tab is out of service or unavailable so you can't really do anything. Check deposit usually works but has occasional bugs. You also can't pay your credit card through the app which doesn't make sense to me. However, the app works 4/5 times I open it and is convenient for what I need to see. It's necessary but flawed.

Update: the biometrics appears to be fixed and is still working after an Android update. Adding 1 star. After every Android security update, the biometrics stop working removing a star. The app is fine, when you can use it. The service has been "temporarily unavailable" for weeks. Update 3/2/2022: PNC tech support contacted me and told me that the app developers made a change last night and now the app is allowing me to log in again. Added 2 starts back...for now.

This app genuinely sucks so bad. The app is always buggy, it's slow, and sometimes it just crashes. I, along with many others, get logged out for no reason. It's not too much of a hassel, but it makes me just go back to cash app for transactions. Recently, I was deposited 600 bucks but then 100 of it just vanished the next day like nothing happened. It wasn't on the transactions or anything. Genuinely feels like I got robbed. I would highly advise anyone else to use a credit union or paypal.

A very frustrating app. It never saves my login information, even though the option says that it will. I really miss Compass Bank. The only reason I stay with this bank is because I've still got some checks that I can use and checks aren't as freely available with banks these days. I would not recommend this app, I've had issues with it in the past as well.

Long time PNC customer here. I am extremely frustrated with this application for one reason; The Biometric sign in option keeps disabling itself. In this day and age we have to set extremely long complicated passwords to safeguard ourselves, so I use the Biometric sign in to make signing in easier, but the app keeps turning it off every so often for no reason. I'm getting to the point where I actually want to switch banks because of this.

When the app works, it works adequately. Nothing spectacular. My beef is that PNC's apps have a relatively horrible up-time. There's always a 20% chance that when I try to check my account balances it'll say that the service is unavailable. I've never seen so much down time with a major bank. 1/10 would not recommend PNC. 2/5 would only recommend the app(s) for those who don't need consistent reliability. 12 mo Update: I can't leave this app low enough stars. Worst banking app I've ever used.

App is constantly offline,always doing an update when I Need to check my balance. Almost every weekend it's offline,and nothing seems to be fixed or change because...Every other day the app forgets my biometrics. What's the point of having it turned on with phone permissions if the app keeps logging me out? if I didn't have PNC I would absolutely delete this trash app. I've called and complained multiple times. 10 min after I posted this review the app was "temporarily unavailable" 6:33pm 8/13

Jan/2016 - I love this tool. It makes banking easy. Oct/2025 - Can't make Zelle payments online or in-app. Been on the phone numerous times. Been thru troubleshooting. No one knows why or how to fix it. Can't complete a mobile deposit without the app crashing using Android. Apparently there's an issue with the error flow when trying to deposit a check amount above the $5k limit. iOS app showed the proper error.

The worst banking app I've ever used, unfortunately. Half the time when I try to login, it times out and when I do get in and try to tap to view recent transactions or anything it says "Service unavailable, please try again later". And I'm constantly having to re-setup biometrics because it keeps turning itself off. The app is a mess!

This app is terrible. It keeps cancelling my biometrics I save. It crashes constantly, especially when I'm trying to transfer money into savings. It is extremely unreliable, and honestly since it can't get the basics of its user interface correct, it makes me concerned about how poor the security probably is.

It bugs out occasionally when you leave the app in the background for a while (it gets stuck in between the log in screen), but it's easy to restart the app. UI is simple and intuitive, the app does not crash or bug out when in use, and the features are good, better than most bank apps I've used. My one suggestion is to have the Reserve's available balance change based on how much you put into savings goals.

Overall the app works fine. Navigation is easy, website features are represented well in the mobile experience. The biggest problem I have is that the app either locks up, or kicks me back to the login screen when trying to make a deposit - it doesn't get past the picture processing. Once I login a second time it seems to work fine. This is rather frustrating as mobile deposit is one of the biggest reasons I use the app.

title: Photo Editor - Collage Maker

It's your best pic collage maker to customize layout fit for every occasion, including holidays, weddings, babies, Before & After, etc. Features: ‚Ä¢ NEW: Improve the quality and clarity of old, blurry, pixelated photos effortlessly with our AI photo enhancer. ‚Ä¢ Collage maker that combines up to 25 photos to create pic collages. ‚Ä¢ 300+ Layouts of photo frames or grids to choose from! ‚Ä¢ Pick a picture, add text and share Meme with friends. ‚Ä¢ Large number of Background, Sticker, Fonts, and doodle to choose from! ‚Ä¢ Remove and replace backgrounds seamlessly with our AI-powered background remover. ‚Ä¢ Support importing your own fonts with special art style! ‚Ä¢ Change ratio of picture collage and edit border of collage. ‚Ä¢ Make photo collage with Free style or Grid style. ‚Ä¢ Crop pictures and edit photo with stylish Layout, Filter, Text. ‚Ä¢ Insta square photo with blur background for Instagram. ‚Ä¢ Save photos in high resolution and share pictures to Instagram, Facebook, WhatsApp, Line, etc. üì∑ Photo Frames InCollage pic collage maker supports tons of layouts, photo frames and photo effects that make your moment stunning, like love photo frames, anniversary, holiday & baby photo frames‚Ä¶ So it's also a collage maker that brings you creativity and love. üì∑ Meme Generator This pic collage maker is also a meme generator and meme maker. Create funny memes and share them on WhatsApp, Snapchat, Messenger, etc. You really can't miss this ace collage maker! üì∑ Photo Editor PRO With a bunch of powerful photo editing tools, you can easily crop a photo, apply filters & picture collage layouts, add stickers & text, draw on photos, flip, rotate, and much more. InCollage Pic Collage Maker is truly an intuitive photo collage editor for Instagram. üì∑ Pic Collage Editor for Instagram An easy-to-use pic collage editor & picture collage maker with trendy layout designed for Instagram. It supports multiple ratios e.g. 1:1, 3:4, 5:4, 9:16. You can also share collage photos with friends on Facebook, Twitter, WhatsApp, and Line in high resolution. üì∑ Photo Collage Editor With hundreds of picture collage layouts and many custom options, you can easily design layouts on your own to make a beautiful photo collage. Pic Collage Maker creates stylish collage photo for you. InCollage - Photo Collage Maker & Photo Editor is your pocket collage maker, meme generator, pic stitch, and photo editor for Instagram and printing. If you have any problems or suggestions, feel free to let us know. Email: photostudio.feedback@gmail.com

üì∑ Photo Collage Editor
With hundreds of picture collage layouts and many custom options, you can easily design layouts on your own to make a beautiful photo collage. Pic Collage Maker creates stylish collage photo for you.

InCollage - Photo Collage Maker & Photo Editor is your pocket collage maker, meme generator, pic stitch, and photo editor for Instagram and printing. If you have any problems or suggestions, feel free to let us know. Email: photostudio.feedback@gmail.com
summary: Collage Maker, Photo Frame App, Photo Editor: 1000+ grid, layouts, sticker, text

scraped_reviews.content: It's a fantastic app. At first I thought it was only to make collages but it can do so much more. Usually I use Photopea on desktop to edit images but I've never found an equivalent app on mobile that can do quick edits with a rich feature set. I love being able to select colors using the eyedropper tool, zooming in/out, changing background colors, etc. And I LOVE that it offers a one-time purchase fee for $20. I hate subscriptions, and this was so refreshing to see that I finally bought it.

This is the absolute best app of its kind that I have ever used. Absolutely fantastic. Two areas of improvement, though: #1 there isn't [to my knowledge‚Äîplease correct me if I'm writing] a global ‚Äúundo/redo‚Äù button for all of your edits. #2 There's a pretty robust catalog of text formatting options, but it would be great if you could decrease character tracking and line spacing into a negative range (like being able to squish the text together)

My favorite free photo editing tool. I've been using it for a few years now and it's perfect. The ads are minimal and you can mute them while you wait 5 seconds. I really enjoy this app a lot and I tried quite a few. Helps dial in the pictures to make them easily 'pop'! There's a paid version that I'm tempted to get because I like this so much for still photos. A++

Fun & Practical! I used this app for a couple of years without the yearly plan. It was great for minimal things. I broke down & purchased the yearly plan when they were having a sale. If you want to get extravagant & really waste some time, I'd suggest getting the plan. I can't even tell you everything this app does because there's so much you can do with it. I use the Stitch option regularly for multiple Amazon returns, so I don't need to print a full page 3/4 blank for the description insert.

I use this app all the time and have been for years. The app offers many different templates and backgrounds, but I typically stick with the "Freestyle" option. Another great thing about it, is that you can put your photos on a white background, with a 1:1 ratio, and post multiple different sized photos to an Instagram post because of the editing tools on this app. It truly is a one stop shop!

This is my favorite collage app so far. I like the border you can put around text for visibility(it creates a border around the letters themselves!), and that I can create collages & save them easily on my phone. It looks like as long as you have the same collage up, it'll stay on your screen even if you go to another app. I wish there was an undo button. And if the app could access the albums I create inside Google photos. And that there was an option to save a collage to come back to.

This app is so useful I'm shocked. I use it way more than I expected, for making collages with a bunch of pics, for editing single pics for posting online, I've even used the batch edit to make a series of photos all square to post on Instagram together. There's so much that's helpful and convenient, like preset aspect ratios and adjustable border size and shapes, each image can be scaled, cropped, rotated individually on the collage so you're not limited to preset layout shapes. Thank you!

For a free download, this app has never failed me. I've downloaded it on three different phones with three VERY DIFFERENT capabilities, and it always works successfully. Yes, there are ads after you create a collage-- but it's FREE. Obviously there has to be SOME drawback to not paying for a product or service. The ads never get in the way of creation or saving the file to your phone, so I can't consider this a TRUE issue.

SO many ads. Oh my gosh. I downloaded it and opened it and had to uninstall it literally 5 minutes later. Every single thing I tapped on popped up an ad, and when I'd attempt to close the ads, it opened Play Store. I don't mind ads. I appreciate free content and will usually shut up about ads. But I do mind not even being able to use the program because there are so many things popping up and lagging my phone, on top of opening the Play Store.
scraped_reviews.replyContent:
Hi,
Thanks for supporting us and we are sorry for Ads. We have improved it. And we promise to keep improving it to not disturb your photo editing always. Please let us know if you have any questions. Thank you.

InShot team

scraped_reviews.content: This is one of the most-used apps on my phone. It's the most robust and capable photo manipulation phone app I've used, and has repeatedly saved me the trouble of booting up my laptop to make photo edits. The photo collage features are excellent as well, but I use them less often than the editing features. Oh, and the ads are respectfully placed and don't affect usability, but I'd say it's worth getting premium either way.

Great app but the loud ads are frustrating to the point I have to give one star overall. On the up side, I do think the collage maker is one of the best among others I tried and because of that, I will raise the rating to 2 stars. once the loud ads are gone, to 5 stars it'll go. Love it! Some features that I love in particular are the before/after button as you're making adjustments, the ability to return to editing a photo after saving it, and the highly customizable backgrounds. Every edit takes about five to ten minutes at least anyway so get comfortable with five seconds. Where else are you going? Cultivate patience, you'll have a handy app.

title: mcpro24fps manual video camera
description: Perhaps the most powerful and advanced professional video camera app on Android! mcpro24fps will open up incredible cinematic possibilities in your phone, previously available only in professional camcorders. Use the free mcpro24fps Demo app to check the functionality of the features you need specifically on your smartphone model before purchasing it. If you have a question, please contact us: info@mcpro24fps.com. We created mcpro24fps cinema camera exclusively for Android and therefore we are confident that the application is able to get the most out of the technical capabilities of your phone. Thousands of videographers from all over the world are already using our video camera app for professional video filming of their festival films, music videos, live reports, commercials and anything else that needs advanced capabilities to realize the authors' bold ideas. Here are just some of the features that will surprise even the most advanced videographer: ‚òÖ Shooting in 10-bit for a large number of devices. HLG / HDR10 HDR video ‚òÖ Recording video in Log without turning on the GPU, like it is on "big" cameras ‚òÖ Huge number of Log modes for any situation ‚òÖ Technical LUTs for seamless interpretation of Log in post-production ‚òÖ On-screen LUT for precise control of the frame when shooting ‚òÖ Deanamorphing and work with attached lenses ‚òÖ Programmable Focus and Zoom and how they work together ‚òÖ Focus Peaking and Expo Peaking for the complete frame control ‚òÖ Spectral and Zebra for easy exposure control ‚òÖ Setting up the white balance in Kelvins ‚òÖ Advanced work with metadata ‚òÖ The most flexible work with sound ‚òÖ Huge opportunities for the use of GPU resources ‚òÖ Responsive interface ‚òÖ Reliable automatic modes and the most convenient manual settings Turn your phone into a video camera for creating cinematic masterpieces right now! [Note]: It is important to understand that the functionality of the functions depends on the technical capabilities of your device. The Camera2 API at the Limited level or higher is required for the phone to work correctly. Useful links: 1. F.A.Q .: https://www.mcpro24fps.com/faq/ 3. Download our free Technical LUTs for instant conversion of log footage in professional editing programs: https://www.mcpro24fps.com/technical-luts/ 4. Official site: https://www.mcpro24fps.com/ The complete technical specification is very large and is published on the official website at the link above. Look at a part of them. CAMERAS ‚Ä¢ Multiple cameras support (where it is possible) ‚Ä¢ Settings for each of the cameras are saved separately VIDEO ‚Ä¢ Recording in 24 fps, 25 fps, 30 fps, 60 fps etc.* ‚Ä¢ Support for all resolutions specified in the Camera2 API ‚Ä¢ Two codecs support: AVC (h264) and HEVC (h265) ‚Ä¢ Recording up to 500 Mb/s * ‚Ä¢ Optical and digital video image stabilization* ‚Ä¢ Setting up Log profiles through a tone curve * ‚Ä¢ Tone curve adjustment via GPU ‚Ä¢ Image adjustment through additional GPU filters ‚Ä¢ Settings for hardware noise reduction, hardware sharpness, hardware correction of hot pixels ‚Ä¢ Additional noise reduction through the GPU ‚Ä¢ Configuring GOP ‚Ä¢ Different modes of white balance ‚Ä¢ Manual exposure mode and automatic exposure mode ‚Ä¢ Adjustment of automatic exposure correction ‚Ä¢ Three focus modes: automatic continuous, automatic on touch, manual focus ‚Ä¢ Three perfect modes of crop-zoom function ‚Ä¢ Variable bitrate mode and experimental constant bitrate mode ‚Ä¢ Adjustment of distortion correction SOUND ‚Ä¢ Support for different sound sources ‚Ä¢ Support for different sampling rates, AAC (up to 510 kb/s) and WAV ‚Ä¢ Ability to integrate WAV into MP4 * depends on the capabilities of the device and approvals from the manufacturer for 3rd party applications. [Note]: It is important to understand that the functionality of the functions depends on the technical capabilities of your device. The Camera2 API at the Limited level or higher is required for the phone to work correctly.
Useful links:
1. If you have questions about the performance of some functions in your phone, you can ask them in the program chat in Telegram: https://t.me/mcpro24fps_en
2. F.A.Q .: https://www.mcpro24fps.com/faq/
3. Download our free Technical LUTs for instant conversion of log footage in professional editing programs: https://www.mcpro24fps.com/technical-luts/
4. Official site: https://www.mcpro24fps.com/
The complete technical specification is very large and is published on the official website at the link above. Look at a part of them.

CAMERAS
‚Ä¢ Multiple cameras support (where it is possible)
‚Ä¢ Settings for each of the cameras are saved separately
VIDEO
‚Ä¢ Recording in 24 fps, 25 fps, 30 fps, 60 fps etc.*
‚Ä¢ Support for all resolutions specified in the Camera2 API
‚Ä¢ Two codecs support: AVC (h264) and HEVC (h265)
‚Ä¢ Recording up to 500 Mb/s *
‚Ä¢ Optical and digital video image stabilization*
‚Ä¢ Setting up Log profiles through a tone curve *
‚Ä¢ Tone curve adjustment via GPU
‚Ä¢ Image adjustment through additional GPU filters
‚Ä¢ Settings for hardware noise reduction, hardware sharpness, hardware correction of hot pixels
‚Ä¢ Additional noise reduction through the GPU
‚Ä¢ Configuring GOP
‚Ä¢ Different modes of white balance
‚Ä¢ Manual exposure mode and automatic exposure mode
‚Ä¢ Adjustment of automatic exposure correction
‚Ä¢ Three focus modes: automatic continuous, automatic on touch, manual focus
‚Ä¢ Three perfect modes of crop-zoom function
‚Ä¢ Variable bitrate mode and experimental constant bitrate mode
‚Ä¢ Adjustment of distortion correction
SOUND
‚Ä¢ Support for different sound sources
‚Ä¢ Support for different sampling rates, AAC (up to 510 kb/s) and WAV
‚Ä¢ Ability to integrate WAV into MP4
* depends on the capabilities of the device and approvals from the manufacturer for 3rd party applications.
Film your best cinematic works on mcpro24fps!
summary: Movie camera, supports pro recording settings for filming. Try it and be amazed!

scraped_reviews.content: No video when I start recording? What is the issue? I've changed settings time after time, especially the option to "view" video while recording. This has started within the last 3 or 4 months. This was my go-to app for my video recordings. Not so much now! Please assist with a solution so I can continue to use 24fps for all of my projects.

I was so disappointed with the inbuilt camera app because of it ugly saturation and more so its sharpening. I bought Filmic pro with its cinematic package, it was the most popular app then. But I was disappointed with the app too. Then I bought mcpro24fps and it was so much better. It was much easier to use and I can remove the sharpening option, different Log options and many more. I would like to give 5 star but for lack of hardware gimble support. Also please include Nikon N-Log option too.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Dear Complain Channel. You asked us to add Nikon N-Log ‚Äî and we did, as it is within our capabilities. Yet you did not value this step and kept the same low rating, which harms the app‚Äôs development and support. As for gimbal support, manufacturers do not share their data, and we never claimed this feature. All the best.

scraped_reviews.content: "Hello developers, I recently purchased this app for my mobile videography hobby using a Xiaomi 14T. After exploring its features, I noticed two main issues: first, the digital stabilization still doesn‚Äôt work properly on Xiaomi devices (as mentioned in other reviews). Second, the autofocus is too sensitive and unstable, even when focusing on a single subject. I hope the developers can address these issues soon. Otherwise, it‚Äôs a great camera app overall. Thank you!"

The app itself is very good, however every time i switch to raw video on my redmi note 14 pro on the 23mm main camera, it always crashes. Other than that the app has an abundance of video formats making it viable for more professional applications.

Miles better than the alternatives, fairly priced. Can shoot 24fps, 1/48 (VND) in 10 bit LOG HLG2 Rec.2020 at 240Mbps. Separate 32 bit float audio file. Plus a whole other bunch of professional settings. Pixel 9 Pro. Fantastic results. On P9P 60fps is only possible with 8 bit recording. Huge thanks to the developer. My only negative is the online manual is slightly out of date for the current version & remote control of the app from another device would be fantastic.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Dear Gareth Herd! Thank you for the best rating of the mcpro24fps manual video camera app and for your professional opinion. As for remote control, you may find this video useful: https://youtu.be/3opYbLL1zck

scraped_reviews.content: I've tried many pro camera apps but this is the best. Gives good quality video production and best in controls and settings.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Dear Felix Aaron! Thank you for the best rating of the mcpro24fps manual video camera app and for your professional opinion.

scraped_reviews.content: Was 5 stars until the latest update which shuts down the app when the phone overheats after a few minutes, the only indication being that the record button goes from red (on) to grey (off). Easy to miss when you're filming and has resulted in me losing minutes of action before noticing. The thing is, I never had any issues with the phone overheating until the latest update. Is there a way to bypass the overheating trigger or tips on how to keep it from overheating? Useless to me otherwise.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Dear Steve! Are you still experiencing the same problem on your device? Have you tried disabling the overheating protection in OTHER SETTINGS > Stop Recording When Overheating? This should resolve the issues you‚Äôve encountered and allow you to film for as long as you need. We‚Äôd greatly appreciate it if you could reconsider your rating for the app.

scraped_reviews.content: Vivo X100 pro natively supports 10 bit recording but it never opens as an option. Also not LUT option is not visible at all! I thought a top end flagship phone Like Vivo X100 pro should support 10 bit recording on the app. I am disappointed üòî

Okay, except for the slightly wobbly image when handheld (I believe it's the sensor's rolling shutter to blame) it's a really useful app, of course, if you tweak the settings in the right way, based on your phone's specifications. The ONLY issue is that the digital image stabilization doesn't work for me. Is it possible to make it work in the future?

Works pretty well. But MotionCam can do 10-bit on Poco X3 and LG Velvet from 2020 (albeit GPU spikes). I hope mcpro24fps can achieve it as well on my Tecno Camon 30 Premier from 2024. 4:3 type resolutions get cropped when GPU is off. No OIS and higher FPS even if my Camon is actually capable. Will update the rating once the issues are solved. Update: Camon 30P just upgraded to Android 15. Same issues üòÖ.
Videos taken with app are much darker than directly with the phone. Their Forum does not respond to such questions. No help. Also, it needs a leveler on the screen.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hello Goddi2! We remember responding to your question in detail and hope our support was helpful. It‚Äôs a bit surprising to see such a low rating. We‚Äôd appreciate it if you could reconsider your review based on your current experience with the app. Thank you in advance!

scraped_reviews.content: Hello, I have recently installed this app and it keeps crashing on the Startup. It says that the app has some bug and can be fixed with an update. Any other solution here?
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hello Mohith Srivastav! We've fixed the issue with the Samsung s24 Ultra. A new version is now available on Google Play. Simply update the app and enjoy. Thank you for your patience, we've put in a lot of effort to address it. We'd appreciate it if you could reconsider updating your app rating.

scraped_reviews.content: bad app. too many artifacts and practically impossible to use.

Doesn't work well on my pixel 5. Main camera wont open and can only be accessed by zooming in from the wide cam. Also, if you open the app in a dark environement, it will start with a lot of noise and i will have manually reset it by turning auto exposure on and off. Also, i moticed some small red, blue and green dots on the screen. Could be from the camera of the pixel 5. Anyway, it would be great if the app could address these minor issues.
Why won't the lens switch while recording? I am using an S25 plus.
No 60 fps... Xiaomi 14T Pro.. Doesn't work and no refund. Upd. Awesome, it is working now. Thank you. Digital stabilization "breaks the conection to the camera", but that's a minor inconvenience.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hello! Just letting you know we‚Äôve released a fresh update with major improvements for Xiaomi 14T Pro including 60fps and 10-bit support. Please update the app and if possible, we‚Äôd truly appreciate it if you could reconsider your rating. Thank you!

scraped_reviews.content: if you take the time to read the manual and learning the UI, filming with the app is a breeze. I recommend getting a microSD card reader and a good micro SD to dump your video footage to after filming
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Dear Andrew Mitchell! Thank you for the best rating of the mcpro24fps manual video camera app and for your professional opinion.

scraped_reviews.content: causes audio distortion on Samsung devices. it's the program specifically. I tested with the default recording software. No issues. 100% this app wrecking the audio.
Can't switch cameras during recording. UI feels weird and isn't intuitive or pleasant to use. The app has some powerful advanced features but far from perfect.
The optical stabilization doesn't work for my Xiaomi 14T, but digital works on my sister's Poco X5 Pro so i don't know what could be causing this, the rest is amazing good work devs

The must powered app that understanding what you need for filmmaking. If you know what you do, that is powerful rack camera embend ( S-log3, S-log2, Cineon, DaVinci log, F-log, mcinelog ) 8bit / 10bit. Different type of camera controls and many many things for the best results. So far, so good and farway the best choice. Congratulations all mcpro24fps team for faster answers and development skills.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hello, Flavio Bisanchet! We are very pleased to hear the opinion of a professional videographer who understands well what videographers need for professional filming on a mobile phone. Thanks for the excellent rating of the mcpro24fps manual camera. We really try hard to be the best professional video camera app.

scraped_reviews.content: I Have used this app for more than 3 years now and i have to say that this is the best pro camera App For Android, you get way more than what you're paying for. Everything works as expected, if the interfaces and UI in general gets and overhaul I think more people will start getting into it, as it looks kinda intimidating when you see screenshots and YouTube tutorials... That's my only criticism, Better UI and no icons that goes above the "viewfinder" will go a long way.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Dear Abdelali Kh! Thank you for the best rating of the mcpro24fps manual video camera app and for your opinion. We will continue to work on improvements.

scraped_reviews.content: All around fantastic app! I only wish for one feature: for the app to follow my phone's orientation setting. So if it's set to locked, then be locked. To be fair, there's a way to change the orientation in the app, but I wanna be able to toggle auto-rotate on and off quickly, without having to go through the menus. Edit: I didn't think of double tapping that button. Thank you for letting me know!
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hello P√©ter Kiss! Thanks for your feedback. To answer your question: the screen orientation can be automatic or manually set using the button in the top left corner. Double-tap to change the setting, or press and hold to reset to auto. Please check this video: https://youtu.be/cSLqpg_Uoi0?si=p89e_yyyfK9SpjKG&t=193

scraped_reviews.content: Filmic refugee has found asylum with mcpro24fps. I just ran a few tests with my Pixel 5 and wow what an improvement in video quality this app is. The difference is night and day. Lots for me to get used to (the GUI particularly) but so happy I found this app. Please don't change to a subscription model.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hello, Rob Hills! Welcome to the family!Thanks for the excellent rating of the mcpro24fps manual camera and for your kind words.

scraped_reviews.content: Insane Options, External Storage Write, Log Video Options, Precise Control over Cameras, Bitrate Options and so much more. There is no better option as a Camera App. Take advantage and excel with less! No need a powerful camera for just videography anymore, my 24 Ultra has reached its maximum potential with this. Worth every penny.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Dear Yeetus My Deetus! We are honored to read reviews like yours. Thank you for the best rating of the mcpro24fps manual camera app and for your professional opinion.

scraped_reviews.content: Very expensive, but great camera app in my opinion. Sadly I can't find a way to turn on shutter priority. It is all auto, or all manual with exposure. Also, when I switch from the telephoto lens back to normal or ultra wide on the Xperia 1 II, it stops working. Other than that, it's amazing to have the option to have options for sharpness, color profiles, white balance, resolution and frame rates, bitrate, audio controls and more.

My God, this is what I've been waiting for. Exceptional program. Is it is easy to use? Hell no, and that's the point of it. There's a learning curve and if you truly wanna be a pro you must learn what all these do and take advantage of them for truly professional work. You can set bitrate, fps, intra frame mp4, luts. It's amazing this Russian programmer has nailed this feature set. It's brought my old Samsung back to life. Get any new Android phone with multiple lenses on board and shine.

This is a huge game changer for Mobile filmmakers, I was thinking of getting an iPhone until I saw the capabilities of this app. It's very amazing, the footage looks great when I grade it, in terms of details, and quality, its something what most filmmakers needed. Is there like an open forum for discussion to see how far the camera can go? And like what kind of support we get on all smartphones tested, experiments to do. We need to get more people try out this app.

Fantastic app. So customizable. Love how you can move the interface margin to allow the use of a clip on ND filter. Especially love the ability to set bit rate, profile (in my case Flog to go with my Fuji camera), etc It might look slightly less polished than FilmicPro (which I also own) but I find it's controls more predictable, easier to set, lock, manage, etc. Love this app. Would pay twice as much for this. Highly recommend it.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hello, Gavin Murphy! We work very hard to ensure that filmmakers can consider us the best professional video camera app! Thanks for the excellent rating of the mcpro24fps! Your detailed and comprehensive review is the best motivation to continue to delight you with the further development of our manual video camera app.

scraped_reviews.content: Great quality on samsung galaxy s8 plus. I wish the shutter speed would stay the same when i use auto. I would like to just have auto ISO and the shutter speed stay the same. If there is a way to fix this, then the app gets 5 stars. Also i hope to see they add higher framerates! Update: November 18 2020 I really dont like this app anymore. Just took it off my tripod for vlogging and the stablization is horrible. I have a samsung galaxy s8 plus and theres no option for stabilization either.

It is a wonderful app that actually has much more features than the flagship app in the market. The app changed how I shoot videos and results in great quality. I just wish that it supports DJI Om 4 Gimbal as sometimes it is not convenient to use the gimbal and control the app from the touch screen of the smartphone. I already started using McPro24fps as my go to video app. I'll wait for the gimbal support and hopefully it will be supported soon. there is no need to have a full gimbal features support, just the basics, shutter button, pan and tilt would be enough.

Good, but having an issue with HDMI Out on my S23 Ultra when selecting 1080p. In my capture card, the HDMI feed is displayed in a 1/4 size window instead of taking up the entire size of the window. This does not occur with filmic, for example. 4k seems to work fine, however it is too much of a battery drain and overkill for a 1080p livestream.

Works great but is missing something important for me.. imaginate stabilization. I tried different settings. Opt, dig, opt+dig. And still not working. Requested a refund since I can't use it without that feature. Otherwise, it's a great app and good video quality. Galaxy S22 Ultra. Maybe in a future update, I will use it.

Exceptional app, works flawlessly with Xiaomi Mi Note 10, thanks for developers! Would hope for 10bit video recording, is this possible? Also, there is one thing that keeps me for switching to Filmic Pro - in Filmic Pro you can change framerate settings with exposure for example 1/10 or even 1/3s. Yes it gives lower framerate, but very useful for artistic interpretations or filming in low light. Would love to see this implementation in mcpro24fps in the future!

10 bit video from my S20 Ultra (Snapdragon) looks phenomenal. I wish I could also record 10 bit log but that's limited to 8 bit on my phone and 10 bit 60fps is a no-go. I assume those are hardware limitations but I'm happy to be wrong if those can be fixed. In the meantime, the quality of 10 bit 24fps is far above anything the native app can produce (even in pro mode) so it was well worth the purchase just for that. There is a learning curve but it wasn't as steep as some others have suggested. It took a couple of hours to test all the different settings to see what works but after that was pretty easy.

Make sure to try it first before buying. Because different phone have different feature that worked properly. Gamma curve selection is many. But not all is good for your camera sensor. Gamut selection other than Rec.709 is bad because it converted from Rec.601 color primaries original. Audio bitrate is many. But it is useless because audio frequency is limited to 17 KHz. Better stick to 160 Kbps. Manual wb adjustment is bad. Sometimes I can't get target 6500K when using wb card.

I love the app so far! It has everything I need and more. I'm actually gonna buy a mobile anamorphic lens because of it's desqueezeing feature. Lol. The only weakness is that it doesn't 10 Bit color depth for my phone which is fairly new, the Samsung Galaxy Z Flip 4. Hopefully, it'll be updated to be compatible soon in the near future. (or maybe the phone just doesn't have the hardware. Sad.) Anyway, aside from that gripe, 5 stars. Love it.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Dear Leo Liban! We are very happy to hear your opinion. Thanks for the excellent rating of the mcpro24fps manual camera. In order to try to enable 10-bit recording on your device, we need the assistance of the user of such a device. If you wish to try you can email us info@mcpro24fps.com

scraped_reviews.content: Really amazing app that does even more than Filmic Pro and some features I didn't think possible. Only major flaw is the lack of exposure options. By default auto should leave shutter at 180deg and control auto exposure with ISO and only change shutter slower if max ISO is reached or faster if min ISO is reached. Great to have manual and auto but auto should be more intelligent (not increase shutter speed and ISO like it does) and also be able to lock shutter and use auto ISO only.
scraped_reviews.replyContent:
Thanks for review.
More intelligent autoexposure is not possible on smartphone. Smartphone have not shutter priority mode. Auto is auto at the discretion of device.

scraped_reviews.content: I wanted to unlock the full potential of my Samsung s24 ultra for little production projects when I'm out and about. There's a lot to learn, but once you start getting used to it, it's an amazing app! More control than anyone should ever need. It's worth downloading the user manual to help understand what all the different settings do Looking forward to how this app will evolve
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Dear Just Joe! We are honored to read reviews like yours. Thank you for the best rating of the mcpro24fps video camera app and for your professional opinion.

scraped_reviews.content: Absolutely useless. Doesn't give me 60fps as an option, and if it actually manages to record a video at any fps it is twice the speed it should be and files won't work outside of the app. Most of the time the app just shuts itself down if I hit record.

I've found this to be the best camera app on for Android. More control over every parameter of recording. With that amount of power comes a fairly steep learning/testing curve but the results are well worth it it you want to use the advanced cameras on your phone. Truly capable for professional use.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Dear David Cherniack! Thank you for the best rating of the mcpro24fps manual video camera app and for your professional opinion.

scraped_reviews.content: There are plenty of features and options to make your footage look great. I'm using the S20 Ultra and it only works up to 30fps. Any time I try to go higher, it will say Camera Lost and have to restart the app. Would give it a higher rating if the 60fps actually worked.

First off, I like the app very much however, It creates insane noise in the shadows on my OnePlus 9RT. Even if I keep the ISO at the lowest, it pixelates heavily in the dark areas and most of the times it liquifies the shadow parts of the video. The areas are not too dark though but it still fails. I tried adjusting the exposure in the manual mode with different log profiles but nothing seems to be working. Also the recorded video in both codecs, there occurs a lag after every 3 seconds.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hello Irfan Shah. Thank you for the review. Good way will be to ask about all this points and also about the best filming practices for OnePlus 9RT from other users in our official Telegram chat: https://t.me/mcpro24fps_en

scraped_reviews.content: Most features work as expected on Huawei P30 Pro including the various log gamma curves (which was a big selling point for me). No manual white balance or 10 bit, which I was aware of. Maximum bitrate seems to be 75Mbps, setting any higher does not work. Biggest complaint is there is no 60fps accessible 1080p recording - DJI app I have for my gimbal allows 60fps as does Filmic Pro (and native camera app). Hope this feature might come as an update - then it would be 5 stars from me.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hello, Tim Shawcross! We are very surprised by your problem, as other users have 1080p 60fps on your phone. Send us a screenshot of your device information to info@mcpro24fps.com (settings menu - at the very bottom). We will try to help you.

scraped_reviews.content: I love this app; it's very powerful, but the issue is... it's just too much. When I use it, my S23 Ultra heats up, impacting performance. While some heating is normal for camera apps, this one is really heavy compared to other apps, I also use MotionCam App, which runs smoothly because it's simpler... it can handle raw recording, 10bit h.265 with ease. A complete rework to simplify this app could be beneficial, this app is more feature heavy then most dslr cameras haha, its just too much.

I really did not expect to find an app that can do FHD 60p CFR (constant framer rate) on my HTC U11+ smartphone. The app have a lot of interesting options like 10bit color depth and logs that I will definitely use with new mobile. Thanks a lot, mate! UI is OK in general (a bit overcomplicated). Some UI elements are confusing and I hope this will be addressed in future. P.S It would be nice if EN demo version available (allow to record up to 3 seconds for example).
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Thanks for review. +)

scraped_reviews.content: Good when it works. Using a Sony Xperia 5 III, trying to record 4k 60fps with GPU off and Auto Exposure leads to app recording at 100+FPS with many dropped frames, and then a crash with "Camera lost" or similar error message Edit: Tried using in Airplane mode etc as dev suggested. Still terrible frame drop issues in AE, much worse in daylight (where very high shutter needed) than in low light
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hello Richard A! We have heard from some users that the Sony Xperia 5 III may become unstable in some modes. However, this problem was solved either by disabling the 5G mobile Internet mode, or putting the phone into flight mode when shooting. The latter we recommend to any mobile videographer. Try it please.

scraped_reviews.content: Very powerful, with many more features than my native camera app. It's occasionally glitchy on my Pixel 6, and the haptic feedback could be better, especially when starting and stopping recording. The features make up for these small setbacks, though.

10-bit log, All-i & constant FPS recording are game changers in my opinion and not even the popular iPhone+filmic pro combo can match that. For the first time in 3 years I'm considering upgrading to a more powerful phone only to use this app! My LG V20, although perfectly fine for daily use, chokes when using this and gives overheating warning...but I'm surprised that it even works with such old hardware. This level of flexibility and nerdy features is what Android is all about! Thanks a lot.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Thanks for the feedback!

scraped_reviews.content: amazing application ever made, to make cinematic videos, I hope there will be a feature or application for photography in the future :)
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Dear Alrexius Raetama! Thank you for the best rating of the mcpro24fps manual video camera app and for your professional opinion. As for the photography feature, you may find this video useful: https://youtu.be/7FqEfJTWfdo

title: My Health
description:
My Health is an application preset in a TRANSSION phone for connecting with smart wearable devices, and provides you with interesting and professional analyses of running, steps, weight management etc., this application's core functions are following:
1. Manage smart wearable  devices: Users can connect mobile devices with smart wearable  devices (such as smart watches etc.) for a more convenient life of receiving calls, reminding of sedentary, synchronizing messages, app reminder etc...
2. Data synchronization between the mobile phone and the device: With the support of smart wearable devices can providing users with interesting and professional analyses of running, steps, sleep, etc..  
3. Step counting: accurate step counter. Easily set daily step goals to constantly motivate yourself; know how many steps taken at a glance.
4. Running, Walking, Cycling: route tracker, voice reminder, data analysis, etc. Monitor and understand how you run every time.
5. Weight management: weekly/monthly reports of body weight changes and trends, so that you know what goal to set.
6. Professional health knowledge of body weight, heart rate, sleep and more.
7. With the support of smart wearable devices, accurately monitor different stages of sleep (awake, light, deep), and provide scientific advice to help you sleep more soundly.

Feel free to tell us what you think about the app and what to improve via [My Health APP ‚Äì Me ‚Äì About - User Feedback]. Thank you.

Support smart wearable devicesÔºàSmart Watch ):
TECNO Watch 2
TECNO WATCH PRO
TECNO Watch 3
TECNO WATCH Pro 2
Infinix Watch GT Pro
Infinix Watch Pro
Infinix Watch 1
Infinix XWatch 3 WE 
Infinix XWatch 3 Plus
Infinix XWatch 3 GT
Infinix XWatch 3
Infinix XWatch 3 Chic
itel ISW-42

scraped_reviews.content: Tl;dr: This app is awful, don't bother. It crashed on me multiple times a day making for wildly inaccurate pedometer readings. It was giving me tons of useless notifications, and I could tell when it crashed when it stopped giving notifications. It also simply stopped running less than a week into my vacation so I have no pedometer information for the majority of my vacation. Can't rely on it to work, can't rely on the information it would give me, just in general not worth your time.
scraped_reviews.replyContent:
Dear user, your version may be too old. Please go to GooglePlay to update to version V4.21. Method to check the current version information: Open the App > Me > About Version
If the problem is resolved, we hope for a positive review

scraped_reviews.content: The app needs a lot of improvement especially when in regards to synchronize with the Smart Watchs it compatible with. I Tecno watch 2 pro yet I have to start walking exercises both on the watch and app as the two are not in sync. Exercise such as weight training is tracked on the watch but not on the app. If synchronization can be better optimized it would give a better user experience.

Initially the app was performing well but after a couple of weeks or few days it doesn't shows the previous day's data,all step counts, calories data have been automatically deleted,how come this possible? very pathetic and disappointing app which doesn't count and store my workout data. Therefore feeling absolutely demotivated and exhausted.üòûüòìüò•üò¢

This app has a serious bug. It keeps counting steps and distance even when I‚Äôm at rest after walking, unless I manually stop it. My Infinix XWatch 3 Plus is accurate, but the app keeps pulling false steps from the phone sensors. Download YouCam Perfect for a comprehensive suite of photo editing tools and beauty camera features, including AI tools such as quality enhancer, object removal, and image to video. scraped_reviews.content: YouCam Perfect - Photo Editor is a app where you can customize photos with several items like putting text on it, filtering it, and more. Premium unlocks all of the exclusive content for additional editing. Remember, if you want questions or feedback on this app, ask the developers of this app, not me. If you don't want the free version, it's probably because you have to repay for premium, or the ads. This photo editing app is one of the best apps I've ever got. Read this please, developers.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Thank you so much for sharing your love üíï! Hearing that you enjoy the app means the world to us ‚ú®. We couldn‚Äôt do this without amazing users like you üå∏

scraped_reviews.content: Would rate this app zero if I could because after signing up for a free trial, I couldn't cancel the premium subscription. Then, when I thought I finally canceled the premium subscription and no longer had access to premium features, I found out I'll be charged the annual fee again, but the settings/interface makes it difficult to access and cancel the premium subscription. I've been unable to reach anyone for assistance. Do NOT bother with this, and DO NOT get the premium version.

The app actually works great fixing the things I need to fix. Im extremely irritated though after paying 6.99 for the monthly premium subscription I realized that you still have to buy "coins" to do all the things im trying to do. What is the point of the premium subscription then? After you pay the premium subscription you shouldn't have to continue to pay for every edit youre trying to do.

DO NOT GET THIS APP UNLESS YOU WANT TO PAY FOR IT FOR LIFE!!! The app is impossible to cancel!!! It doesn't even show up on my list of subscriptions on Google Playstore so there is absolutely NO WAY to cancel the free trial! So frustrating!! There is no where on the app itself to cancel the subscription and it doesn't show up in my subscriptions list on PlayStore! I believe they do this so that you can not unsubscribe and they just keep taking your money!

The new update sucks. Before the update, you could go to "replace" and input "remove" and it would do a fairly good job at removing people from an image and generating a decent replacement to continue the background. Now it doesnt work, and the "Remove" tool basically just blurs everything most of the time and doesnt actually just clear the thing you want removed. The face swap is now terrible as well. The intent to maintain the direction and style of the face was there, but now just distorts.

Start with free trial costs $35 a year to try. Next, almost every single item is premium and the premium ranges from $10 with a few lower cost options for each picture, which it has difficulty identifying unless you've already used another program to remove the background etc. Getting past ads to even try a tool is a challenge. Summary: waste of time and money. Already unsubscribed in less than ten minutes.

scraped_reviews.content: Been using this since November 2023, it's beautifully simple and to the point. The user interface feels very smooth and intuitive, and it does it's job well! There's lots of little achievements and details that make it fun to pop in and visit just for the sake of it. Along with tracking steps, it also keeps logs of distance (in accordance to your stride length), time spent walking, and calories burned. Even with everything, it barely drains power at all, and dosen't need any wifi to work!

Works well outside of residence but doesn't count steps while at home even on the highest sensitivity. Also, there's no way to turn off the notification sound unless you remove the notification permissions altogether. Free app, and has motivated me to start using a pedometer. Given the hassle though, I'd say do 10 minutes of research to find a better option like I'm about to. Update July 29th 2025. No improvement on newer Android device.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Thanks for your feedback, Jeremy. This app uses the built-in sensor in the phone to count steps, but the sensor of different devices differs. We'll pass your feedback along to our development team and do our best to improve our app.

scraped_reviews.content: This app doesn't drain my battery and has fairly quite notifications, so I'm really enjoying using it to keep track of how much I walk at work. The only thing I'd like to change is being allowed to tailor the type of notifications. I enjoy seeing how much I'm actively walking, but I don't really need achievement reminders at all of my step milestones (halfway to my goal, halfway to the next achievement, etc.)

It's nice and simple. A pedometer that keeps track over time, records daily walks, and gives you a rough estimate of caloric burn and mileage. It even let's you set goals and encourages you to surpass them by setting them higher when that goal has been met, motivating better fitness. You don't even need to have it on screen to count your steps either, making it all the easier to play music or YouTube videos while you walk. .I highly recommend giving it a try.

Lovely and accurate. I work in a warehouse and it's great to see how much I'll walk in the busier season. The accuracy is insane as well. I've checked it before and after my commute, using the forklift for some time, etc. and it's only incorrectly increased by a single digit number every time, even when the time period was close to 45-50 minutes before I could look at it again. Inaccuracy lower than 0.1% is incredible to get from this. Better than other paid apps imo

11/22 This app is amazing. It helps me keep track of distance walked as expected but the other features is why I'm giving it a 5 star. The app also offers workouts for just about anyone. And even keeps track of calories burned, water intake, goals, and you can even set your own schedule in the app. Ads are present but at least they're not popping up constantly. Update: It's now 1/25/24 and I still love this app. I've lost 165lbs, gained muscle mass, and now I'm very fit and active. Great app!

The pedometer works well but the video ads are way too long. I understand advertising comes standard with a free app, but I shouldn't have to watch a video ad play for 2+ minutes. You can't ever just quickly check your step count. Nope, instead you get to watch the play-by-play of some random gaming app. It's obnoxious and excruciating. Replace the videos with a still image, and it's perfect. Otherwise, I plan to delete as soon as I find a better option.
scraped_reviews.replyContent:
Hi, sorry for the inconvenience.
We will try to adjust our ads strategy to minimize the interruption. You can also remove ads by the "Remove ads" subscription on the "More" page.
This app is completely free for all users, so we need to display ads to earn some meager profits.
Thank you for understanding.

scraped_reviews.content: 4-2925 it STILL reminds me during the day! What is the point of s SCHEDULE if it reminds WHENEVER??? 7-26-24Taking it down to 3 stars. Overall I like the app. The only problem I have is, I work 3rd shift and only on Fri, Sat, Sun and Mon so I set a reminder for THOSE DAYS ONLY. It reminds me ALL THE TIME. I'm not sure why there is a reminder if it's just going to remind me 7 days a week all during the day. I will give it a little more of a chance but it gets irritating and it's frustrating.
scraped_reviews.replyContent:
Hi Becca, we apologize for any inconvenience caused.
Our intention was to motivate users to walk more. We sincerely regret if this has led to any confusion or distress on your end. Please rest assured, we value your feedback and will strive to make the necessary improvements.

scraped_reviews.content: Was initially impressed with the accuracy. After 3 days of walking the same route, the numbers were of course different but, within reason. Now they are inexplicably all over the place. The very same route is calculated with as much as 1800 steps, 8 tenths of a mile in distance, and 20 minutes in time difference. I'm going looking for another app. This one is not accurate or reliable enough even if it is free.

Works like a charm, very customizable with the ability to set your stride and instantly see the effect on the distance already recorded. Comparing it to, for example, the distance recorded by the treadmill it is very accurate. The only negative I have found so far is that, when it is connected to Google Fit, it reports a ridiculous number of small walks about the house. Very easy to turn off that reporting though. Overall an excellent app

Love this app! It's accessible enough to be there when you need it, but neither annoying or in the way. I like the comprehensive breakdown of personal preferences (gender, height, weight, etc) that allows the app to give feedback about stride length, distance covered, etc. You can also set daily goals for steps and water consumption, but it's customizable enough that you can turn off alerts if it doesnt suit you. Highly recommended!

I wanted an alternative to my fitness watch because I only care about the number of steps I walk daily, not workout routines or sleep trackers and whatever else they add to them these days. This app is awesome, and I like that it's straight forward and that I don't have to keep it updated with a separate phone app or sync it with my phone. It doesn't take up much memory, either.

This pedometer works really well for me. It seems to be quite accurate and not only tracks your steps for the day but the total steps for the week in addition to tracking calories burned, distance walked and time it took. It's a great little device. One really great feature is the developers respect your privacy and will not go into your files!!! As advertised it doesn't use much power. I strongly recommend it to anyone who simply wants to know the aforementioned items it tracks.
scraped_reviews.replyContent:
Hi There, 
Thanks for your support, we will keep working hard to bring you a better experience.

scraped_reviews.content: Inaccurate I walked 300 steps while counting as I went. I ran this app at the same time as another. That app had a 4% deviation (287/300) and this had a 20% deviation (241/300). Both are off, but this is substantially low. Same phone, same sensor, same conditions, same time... they should produce similar results. Several hours later, the results varied significantly... First app 5867, this app 5372. I only counted 300 of these steps, but you can see how the deviations compound over a distance.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi Keith, we apologize for any inconvenience caused. We are committed to improving the algorithm and hope to provide you with a better experience in the future.

scraped_reviews.content: This app is very inaccurate and inconsistent. It double and triple counts steps at times and then stops tracking altogether other times. I have tried both holding my phone as well as having it in my pocket and depending on which of these I use I also get very different results for the same amount of activity. This app is useless if you want to know how many steps you are actually walking.

scraped_reviews.content: This pedometer works better than most. Unlike other apps, Step Counter stays running (even with low RAM) and I don't have to open the app every time I walk to get it to function. Also, Step Counter shows calories burned based on my height and weight and contains features like video workouts for free. This app does contain an occasional ad, but doesn't go overboard.
