scraped_reviews.content: This app is so easy to understand and use that even my 74 yr old dad can use it with no difficulty, and he's still learning how to use his very first smartphone! It tells you how many steps and miles you've walked in a day, the amount of time you've spent walking, and how many calories you've burned. It also tracks BMI, reminds you to drink waters, and has customizable exercise goals. Your stats are straightforward and simple to read. Its free but if there are ads then I haven't noticed them.

This app is GARBAGE. I've used it for over a month, and it worked great. Then, today, it just stopped counting my steps. I was at almost 10,000 for the day, and it just STOPPED working. I tried restarting my phone. Nothing. Uninstalled and reinstalled. Logged back in. Guess what!? IT DELETED ALL MY DATA. Everything. Completely gone. Tried restoring it. Nothing. Gone. I'm absolutely livid. And it's STILL not tracking my steps. Also, you can't turn the volume off in this app. üñï
scraped_reviews.replyContent:
Hi, sorry for the inconvenience. It may stop due to the system limitation.
To solve this issue, please click the "How to fix..." option on the "More" page. Before uninstalling, we recommend backing up your data through the 'Backup & Restore' option. This ensures that your data is safely preserved and can be restored if needed.

scraped_reviews.content: I've used this for a few years. u vsnt really speak for its accuracy, but it gives me a good relative comparison day by day. more recently it has gone forever a decent easy to use check to a maze of ads. it makes it hard to use, the adds are a pain to wxit. and as often as not I end up somewhere else. everyone needs to make a buck. but it has ruined the app.
scraped_reviews.replyContent:
Hi Cheryl, sorry for the inconvenience.
We will try to adjust our ads strategy to minimize the interruption. You can also remove ads by the "Remove ads" subscription on the "More" page.
This app is completely free for all users, so we need to display ads to earn some meager profits.
Thank you for understanding.

scraped_reviews.content: Great App when first installed. Now, it's cluttered with all kinds of ads. Step counter used to offer easy Xs (exits) and other ways to close. These ways are no longer there. It's like we've got you locked in with no easy exits. It used to be such nice App to use. It would be nice to see the App take few steps back to normal and it's primary purpose.
scraped_reviews.replyContent:
Hi, apologies for any inconvenience caused.
This app is entirely free for all users, which necessitates us to display ads so as to earn modest profits. Based on user feedback, we will continue to optimize our app.
Thank you for your understanding.

scraped_reviews.content: Almost a month into this app and I'm happy to say that this is more than just a pedometer. Pros: Fairly accurate pedometer (change step length in settings). Simple workouts and stretching exercises that are great for rehab from a serious illness. Cons: You have to wait around 30 secs for the ads to finish upon opening the app. Conclusion: Patience for free or only $10.99/year for the ad-free version. Highly recommended app for tracking basic health metrics. üòÅüëç

The app is simple yet effective, I've recently installed it, and it has shown great results. I recommend the app for anyone who wants to keep track of their steps. The app is free, and it surprisingly doesn't straight up throw ads at you. in conclusion, it's a great step tracking app that is free but doesn't have many ads.

I like the achievements. So far it is better than other apps I've tried. One thing I don't like is that as you are encouraged to increase your step goal and the bar goes up the report, it shoes previously met step goals as unmet. There should be a third color for previously met goals so that you can look back and see your progress. Also, I just switched phones and lost all data for this app.

The app uses the phone accelerometer to detect foot impact. So, if you shuffle there is nothing to detect. Further, some pedometers are sensitive to pace/cadence. The most accurate pedometers for slow walkers work best at 50 to 60 steps per minute. I don't know if this is a factor with this app. I do know that when I could take full paces without shuffling it was more accurate.

For a long time, I loved this app. it was easy to use and accurate. But on July 5, 2022, when the Android System Update installed, that changed. The Step Counter is WAY OFF. If I walk 500 steps, it registers only 350-385. I thought it was odd that it was taking me longer to reach my goal and so I counted my steps manually and compared the number to what the Pedometer registered. Very sad that this has happened. I have been using this app for 17 months, but must now move on to one that works.
scraped_reviews.replyContent:
Hi Tony, sorry about this.
The system update of some devices may be accompanied by some changes in the authorization situation, which causes the pedometer‚Äòs inactivity in the background.
We recommend that you try to uninstall and reinstall our app. Also, to avoid data loss, please back up your data before uninstalling via "More - Backup&Restore"

scraped_reviews.content: This app is amazing! this thing tells me how many steps to do and what achievements I have to accomplish. There is no GPS Tracking needed to measure how many steps this app. It only uses the sensor that is on your device! Plus, you can change your weight, step distance, gender, reminder, and distance (imperial or metric)! And it can even be synchronized into your Google Fit (or Android Wear), then, you can also check your health! So, if you're looking for a pedometer for your phone, this is it!

This used to be one of the most accurate counters on my phone (I installed 5), then a couple of years ago, there seemed to be change in mission, i.e. they want to see how many ads you can tolerate by blanketing you with an intolerable amount of ads. Adding insult to injury, the counter doesn't work anymore. I haven't changed any settings, but this app most of the times stopped registering any step, starting only after I used the app to see what number it had registered. Uninstalling!!!
scraped_reviews.replyContent:
Hi Eric, sorry for the inconvenience. It may be due to the system limitation.
To solve this issue, please click the "How to fix..." option on the "More" page. We will try to adjust our ads strategy to minimize the interruption. This app is completely free for all users, so we need to display ads to earn some meager profits.

scraped_reviews.content: The app does what it is suppose to without endless promotions. If you leave alerts on it only reminds you to walk... not spend money, which as we all know isn't typical. I also like the achievements aspect to show you how your efforts add up. My only small issue is that it doesnt just start tracking my steps... if I dont consciously open it(even if it's already technically open) it wont calculate steps. So open it up before the walk or run you want to calculate and it works great.

Winner!! Small footprint and relatively low power usage, even though it's isolated from Power Saving. It does not drain my battery like GPS-based apps usually do. (Perhaps calculates distance based on your height = average step-length x no. of steps). Display is very neat and intuitive, with exactly what I want to know at a glance: Distance, Calorie Burn & Time . The ads are not obnoxious and easily dismissed. Good job, Leap!

I love your app!! I just wanted to say thank you for such a well rounded, and thoughtful app. I love everything about it. I've been using the app for 20 months. I've just finished the Sahara Desert üèú üòÖ I also believe the app has helped me to reach my goal in losing weight. The stretching and exercises are helpful and simple to follow. It is well worth paying for ad free. I actually wish the levels and goals were set higher, I've completed or maxed on most. But, overall amazing.

I love this app and have used it for several months now. Compared to my old charge 5 fitbit, they had the same accuracy, but I got tired of having to replace it every year. This step app is highly accurate. I either carry my phone or it's in my side pants pocket. I have high sensitivity, so it will also include my small steps. I paid to get rid of ads. It was a reasonable low fee, once and done. Before I paid to remove ads, they only showed one when I first opened the app.

I just love it! I can add the exercises I do. I can track my walks, runs or bicycling. It reminds you to drink water. The app has short workouts for people short on time or long on pain. Face slimming, splits training... I love my Step Counter and I've tried many. You can control it running in the background. It's not a battery sucker either.

Love that you can pause the counter so easily, some of the apps I've tried make you do backflips. Has a sensitivity setting, on medium it's very good when in your back pocket (goes to extremely sensitive, haven't tried those). Can track multiple things like water intake, weight, bmi, how many miles you've walked and kcals you've burned. Layout is simple and straightforward, charts and graphs are easy to understand and implement. App is really only for tracking steps, won't have much else to do.

It gets the job done, shows me how much I walked so far today on the lock screen, tracks my daily steps, and that's what I wanted. The similar google app stopped working after a while (not to mention the strange downward step adjustments) so I needed one that's simple and don't stop working. This is all I ever needed. The achievement congrats/daily report messages are added bonuses. Edit: you don't need to open the app if you don't care about entering your data.

Simple, easy to use. Even easy to troubleshoot! I do wish it would automatically save and upload all the data when you get a new phone or number, though. That would be nice if y'all could make that happen. In all reality I would've given y'all only üåüüåüüåüüåü ¬Ω if it was available, but the only thing I can even try to complain about it the lack of auto-transfer for data. Great job y'all!

VERY nice to use once you get used to where everything is. I've been carrying my phone with me everywhere and it's really good at tracking your footsteps. Not the best at tracking jumping movements and other exercises that aren't walking/running, but that's not really what it's for. Great for keeping on track with fitness and the stats for weightloss are amazing. Definitely recommend.

So far, I love it. Better than the others I've used. Still learning the capabilities. I work as a cashier so I don't walk a lot at work but I do a lot of work moving merchandise back and forth at checkout and have no idea what the calories used are. This can be set at high sensitivity and seems to catch at least some of the effort while in my back pocket. This gives me a little better estimate of my calories needs and may explain some of my unexpected hunger and weight ups and downs.

This used to be 5 stars, back when you only had to watch an ad if you wanted to leave the main screen. I changed it to a 1 star because now after 2 years there are ads you can't skip at all as soon as the app is opened. I track my steps for work. Sometimes I'm in a rush and don't have 2-3 minutes to wait for an ad to play. I'm going to be finding a new app.
scraped_reviews.replyContent:
Hi Lily, sorry for the inconvenience.
We will try to adjust our ads strategy to minimize the interruption. You can also remove ads by the "Remove ads" subscription on the "More" page.
This app is completely free for all users, so we need to display ads to earn some meager profits.
Thank you for understanding.

scraped_reviews.content: I've been using same app prior. It seems to be accurate. I like that it continually graduates your goals, and keeps you mindful of your progress. Recommend it to anyone who wants to get moving. I drive truck for living, so physical activity is a must, plus I'm almost 70, and again I need to stay moving. This helps motivate me to push just a few more steps to reach my goal.

does its job but unfortunately like so many, it is basically turned into an ad and pop-up app that also happens to count your steps and tries relentlessly to get you to give them more money and upgrade. They sneakily and strategically place the ads in such a place that when you try to back out, close or go to your home screen you hit the ad and it opens. anything you do seems to trigger additional ads and pop-ups. It's not unexpected but the way they are doing it is just slimy business practice
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi Craig, sorry for any inconvenience you've encountered. As the application is entirely free for users, we rely on displaying ads to generate some minimal revenue. Thank you for understanding.

scraped_reviews.content: Would give more if the thing didn't add the commentary on my weight. Maybe it's just me but I've had issues with this all my life so the little bar saying "severely obese" seems like overkill. You can't accurately gage how healthy someone is by two numbers. My only objection is the bmi thing. Otherwise, works fine!
scraped_reviews.replyContent:
Hi Evan, thanks for using our app and giving us your feedback.
We‚Äòre so so sorry if you felt offended. We will take it seriously and do our best to make some improvements.
Best regardsüåπüåπ

scraped_reviews.content: So far so good. Been using it for just under a month because I dislike the pedometer/health app that comes pre-installed on my phone. Simple amd easy interface, and it only has just enough on the main screen that I need at a glance: steps, miles, time spent walking, calories, and water tracking if turned on. I wish the home screen widget was a little better but its not a problem, I tend not to use widgets anyway. I do like that the app celebrates when I reach my hard earned goal though :)

Been using this app for over a year, but recently I've had problems with it. It glitches my step count and calorie burned numbers to something very high (obviously not the amount I've walked) so I'm stuck guessing the actual amont. It also, once, stop counting the steps for several minutes/hours. Besides these inconveniences, it's a pretty handy app. Hoping my review will result in improvements, so I won't need to get a different pedometer.
scraped_reviews.replyContent:
Hi, sorry for the inconvenience. It may be due to the system limitation.
To solve this issue, please click the "How to fix..." option on the "More" page. This app uses the built-in sensor in the phone to count steps, but the sensor of different devices differs. We will continue to work hard to improve the algorithm.

scraped_reviews.content: I loved this app. I used it faithfully for years. It was the only one that did exactly what I needed. But the last few weeks, it's been popping up new notifications about 30 minute walks and walking 10k a day and there's no way for me to turn those off despite having all reminders and the like off. These notifications come up multiple times a day, every day, and it's gotten so annoying that I'm going to have to find a new app to use.
scraped_reviews.replyContent:
Hi, we apologize for any inconvenience caused.
Our intention was to motivate users to walk more. We sincerely regret if this has led to any confusion or distress on your end. Please rest assured, we value your feedback and will strive to make the necessary improvements.

scraped_reviews.content: I've had the app over a year. Used to be easy to use. Inconceivably they've eliminated a way to exit the app from the main screen. There used to be a few ads which was acceptable, but now they come up much more often, often with no visible method to close the ads. They have an option to pay a fee to stop the ads, but when I tried to use it I got a message they only accept Google Pay and they are currently unable to accept Google Pay from the United States. I'm looking for a new app right now.

This app is so helpful for my general health along with other health apps. Pedometers keep track of the steps you take from your cellphone so you can see how many miles you do a day, week, or month. It's important to appreciate how hard your working. In order to not overdo steps, keeping track will help improve my agitating eating disorder so I know when I've gone too far. All in all this app is very helpful for people loosing weight or trying to keep weight on, as it keeps you accountable.

Easy interface, no annoying ads, and does what intended. Keeps track of my steps better than any other app. Keeps count when screen is off; don't have to worry about constantly checking my phone to see if the app is still going. The water feature is a plus; no need for a water reminder app. Some see it as useless, but busy individuals sometimes need that hydration reminder; especially when on the move. Easy to pause the count, hydrate when reminded at my own set time, and continue.

Simple, effective app that does exactly as advertised. Nothing fancy just a step counter. You can set your own daily goals. And your statistics for...day week and month or tracked and visible overtime. There are different goal and achievement levels to help keep you motivated. Ads are present but unobtrusive. If you're looking for a fancy fitness app with lots of features, you probably won't like this app. But if you're looking for a good step counter look no further.
scraped_reviews.replyContent:
Hi, thanks for your feedback.
It's a great honor that you like our app. We will continue to work hard to bring you a better user experience.
If you have any other suggestions, please feel free to contact us via ‚ÄúMore--Feedback".
Best regardsüåπüåπ,
Leap Fitness Group

scraped_reviews.content: For being FREE this app has the easiest & most effective tools to help keep track of steps. You can keep all notifications off & simply use the step counter, or you can use all the features & additionally keep track of numerous things (water intake, etc). You can also have it give you reminders or updates throughout the day (It's motivational without being annoying.) Another huge PLUS is almost NO ADS!

Not too crazy abt this app, probably have to buy a regular pedometer. I have to carry phone everywhere, which isn't helpful when I'm trying to recharge phone. Additionally, sometimes I turn my phone off when I'm charging and my step count is lost. If I'm step counting within the same day, there should be a way for steps to be stored so if I walked 300 steps in the morning, for example, when I turn phone on, it should continue 301, 301 etc. Not sure if it's accurate anyway, since I have to put phone in my purse when I go out.

title: Nike Training Club
description:
Nike Training Club isn't just another workout app ‚Äî it's a portal to Nike's top trainers, athletes and experts. It's where you can access industry-leading workout programming and legit coaching for free. Whether you put in the work at the gym or at home, NTC is here to power your progress. If you're serious about your fitness, this is where you train.

Nike Members get free access to the latest strength training, conditioning, yoga, pilates, recovery and mindfulness content. Train the way you want and reach your goals with Nike Training Club.

EXPERT PROGRAMMING FOR EVERY LEVEL
‚Ä¢ Gym workouts: Curated strength and conditioning workouts and programs designed for the gym 
‚Ä¢ Home workouts: Whiteboard and trainer-led workouts made for small spaces, travel and lack of equipment
‚Ä¢ Total-body strength: Programming to develop muscular strength, hypertrophy, power and endurance
‚Ä¢ Conditioning: High-intensity workouts, including high-intensity interval and sprint-interval training 
‚Ä¢ Core workouts: Workouts for strong abs and more
‚Ä¢ Yoga and pilates: Flows and postures to stretch and strengthen
‚Ä¢ Recovery: Self-myofascial release, stretching, walking and more
‚Ä¢ Mindfulness: Guidance on staying present to improve performance and experience

ACCESSIBLE AND PROGRESSIVE WORKOUTS
‚Ä¢ Something for everyone: Find advanced workout programming, beginner workouts and everything in between
‚Ä¢ On your terms: Join on-demand, trainer-led classes or follow whiteboard workouts on your own
‚Ä¢ Train for something: Achieve your goals with weeks-long workout programs for the gym or home
‚Ä¢ Training guidance: Explore a library of in-depth training information at your fingertips
‚Ä¢ Nike-only inspiration: Advice and insights from Nike's top trainers, athletes and experts
‚Ä¢ Find your favorite exercise: Strength training, conditioning, HIIT workouts, yoga, pilates and more
‚Ä¢ Strengthen every muscle: Workouts that target arms, legs, abs and more
‚Ä¢ Bodyweight training: Equipment-free workouts that build muscle
‚Ä¢ Track achievements: Log completed workouts and celebrate accomplishments

WORKOUT ON DEMAND
‚Ä¢ Workouts for any level: Choose from multiple trainer-led, Video On Demand (VOD) classes*
‚Ä¢ Workouts for all modalities: Find workouts focused on strength training, conditioning, yoga, pilates and more
‚Ä¢ Premiere workouts: Work out with elite athletes and entertainers*
‚Ä¢ NTC TV: Train hands-free and get group class experiences at home**

Download Nike Training Club and train with us.

ALL YOUR ACTIVITIES COUNT
Add every workout in the Activity tab to keep an accurate account of your training journey. If you use the Nike Run Club app, your runs will be automatically recorded in your activity history.

NTC works with Google Fit to sync workouts and record heart-rate data.
https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.nike.ntc&hl=en_US&gl=US

*VOD (Video-On Demand) available in the US, UK, BR, JP, CN, FR, DE, RU, IT, ES, MX and KR.
**NTC TV available only in the US.

summary: Your ultimate training partner. Unlock workout programs and track your activity.

scraped_reviews.content: I've used this app for years and I like it a lot. My only issue is the program tracking feature. Even though I finish the program workouts and choose the difficulty and place of workout at the end, the app only records completion of some workouts. it'd be nice if we could mark workouts in a program complete ourselves since the app doesn't record the progress properly.

I've been using the app for years, and it serves its purpose. I don't like that my progress doesn't save sometimes, so workouts show as incomplete. I also don't like that I can't connect it to my Samsung Health app. There also used to be a feature that allowed for notifications when it was time to workout. Update: Just finished a program, but the workouts aren't marked as complete so I have to give a negative review of the program to end it manually..but I liked it.

I love the workouts and the coaches, but it has the same issue as the Run Club app does. Which is after doing workouts, it will say that they haven't been completed, and it's very frustrating, especially doing the guided programs, cause it'll say I didn't complete it, so it looks incomplete which is a little unmotivating even knowing logically that I did complete it. I hope they fix soon, but has been a problem on Run Club for 2 years that I've experienced.

Good for a free app, but I can't see myself using it long term. The workouts are decent and they have a general structure you can follow, but there is no explicit way to filter by equipment or by the muscle group you want to target. The app itself is also not particularly interactive. I was expecting something like Ladder (not available on Android) when I downloaded this app, but NYC: Fitness just plays a YouTube video when you select a workout.

I've been using Nike Training for I believe about 10 years now. I LOVE it! The trainers are all amazing, there are a plethora of different workout types, you can choose programs or build your own routine...I could go on. And all of this for FREE? So grateful üôèüèº 10/10 recommend this app to anyone at any fitness level or time in their life. You won't regret it!

I've never had a particularly great opinion about Nike. As a runner, their gear's never felt great. As I'm getting older though, I've found myself needing to do more strength training to keep up, and I found this app incredibly easy to navigate and the workouts are structured incredibly! It's pretty scary knowing where to start, and this was insanely helpful. It's probably time to reevaluate some Nike gear üòÆ‚Äçüí®

I've been using this app for 5 years, so that alone speaks to the benefits, but it's getting so buggy I may have to switch to something paid. Pros: Free, I love the main trainers and original basic programs, positive and healthy messaging about caring for your body and performing to a level that is right for you Cons: doesn't save workouts half the time which makes programs pointless, keep adding niche content but need to refresh their intermediate dumbbell and bodyweight programs

It's got some good workouts and I like that I can cast them to my Chromecast. However, they could use more whiteboard-style workouts. Also, I miss being able to interact with my friends. What's the point in adding your contacts if you can't see their activity or share workouts with them (no screenshots allowed)??

I loved this app until they took away plans. Now I have to keep track of more on my own... making it less efficient than other workout apps. Update: for some reason, they keep making this app harder and harder to use and navigate. I miss when this app was easy to pick up and sort through. I mean, the programs tab doesn't work and you can't even participate in any. The app being free is the only benefit.

The workouts and trainers are pretty great, but the app is getting awful. It keeps deleting my program progress/workouts. The workout shows as logged and completed, then the next day when I come back it's gone. Also have to tediously log in every couple days for some reason. I love some of the trainers but it's about time to give up on this glitchy app. Also if a notification pings during a workout, it makes the workout volume turn all the way down which is weird.

I really love the app overall. Many options, new content available often, great trainers, free. There's only one issue: it's been glitching, in that it doesn't record workouts as completed within the program I'm doing. I got to stage 4 of one of KG's programs and every time I go back into the app, it says I didn't complete the workout I had just completed the previous day. I can skip the workout that I already did, but it will look like I never completed it. That's frustrating. Otherwise great

Previously this was a 5 star app. Lately however it's become very frustrating, specifically with programs and tracking. I'll do a workout in a set program, enter difficulty and where I did the workout and everything seems great. Next day when I login the app doesn't recognize I did the workout. This forces me to play the workout again, wait for it to finish, and then move into the next workout/stage in the program. Pretty frustrating and reading other reviews - common issue.

I love all of the free content. There truly is a workout for every need someone may have. However, I am giving it 3 stars because it isn't saving any of my workouts I have done within programs, and my Activity is saying I haven't done a workout since August 2024 despite having done quite a few since then. I have even tried ending programs and restarting them within the app to see if it would start tracking them properly, but it hasn't. This is such a shame because everything else is so great.

Updating to 4.5/5 as I have continued to use the app for many years now, and appreciate we get new workouts. One feature request is to provide an overview of the exercises (it can be in list format), since the video preview does not really showcase all the exercises. This is one feature I really miss from a previous version before all older workouts were turned into "class/video" format, as it allowed me to get a sense of the workout and if it is appropriate for where I am at (location/injuries)

I can't believe that something so comprehensive and varied is actually FREE. I also love that all it asks for is your e-mail address and it's not tracking progress (unless you link it to partner apps that do), nor does it have a bunch of annoying and stressful hoops to jump through. You literally just click on the workout you want and it plays. I love the freedom to choose what I want depending on what I feel like on any given day. The instructors are WONDERFUL, warm, positive, and encouraging.

This app was at a 5 for me for a long time, but recently they updated the app and user interface and a lot of the things I used to enjoy I can no longer access easily. Browsing by category mostly hasn't changed, but they removed the feature where you can search workouts by trainer. I had workouts that I really enjoyed by specific trainers and now that entire tab is gone. The programs tab is just a really long scroll. Still amazing workouts, but harder to use app.

Ive used this app for YEARS! It was by far my favorite, but lately it's super bugged out! it keeps freezing, it won't record my workouts anymore, and the plans are gone! why? I don't like these "collections", it's not nearly as useful as before. fix the bugs, change it back, and leave it, it was great how it was.

Great app! The trainers are great and very motivational. Helps you not only with exercise, but nutrition and mindfulness as well. You will not only become a stronger athlete, but you will also have overall improved well being. I really like the new class format that they've added. There are many different types of workouts offered. Through this app, I've developed a new love for yoga. I really like the workout programs!

This app used to be the best, especially for at-home workouts. Their programs were excellent and the right fit for whatever you wanted, but now they made it so you have to pay for premium to get access. Even if it's free during the pandemic, why not go back to it being free all the time!? It became just like every other app out there. So upsetting!!

Seems to be loading slow as an app, otherwise like the options and the rest of the app. Another issue is the log in process. Please make this process easier and remove the 2 step verification. I have to sign in to use the app every time. Really annoying and time consuming. I would prefer to just sign in once like I do with other exercise apps.

I love the workouts, the tracking, and the guidance. Only reason its not 5 stars is because it keeps glitching! Ill do one of their workouts, and then it wont add it to my activity. and the only way to add it, for the entire time i did it for, is if i just keep it open playing on my phone. Also, when I add an outside-the-app activity, it glitches when inputting the details, and I have to restart the app. If these glitches were fixed itd be 5 stars

Have used this app since 2015 and it was my fitness app of choice enabling me to look at the workouts and exercises in them ahead of time and gauge what I would be able to do given my knee injuries. Switching all of the workouts to class format has ruined what was once a great app. Now you can't see what a class will entail when the title is "quarter master" but have to watch the entire video which is slow and takes up a ton of data. I can't imagine who signed off on this update!

I was going to download this again because I had it for a while and loved it. However, seems like they removed the best part of the app, which was the straightforward workouts where you could see the exercises and decide if that's what you wanted. If I want to watch videos, I can go to YouTube. Too bad, I really liked this app before!

I have relied on NTC for daily workouts for nearly 2 years. I especially liked the workouts where you could go at your own pace - I think they were called whiteboard workouts. Today, I log in and they have converted all of the whiteboard workouts to videos. So it's just a video now. Maybe that's good for someone who casts to their TV, but I enjoyed having it on my phone where I could see what workouts were involved then make my way thru them one by one. This new format is no bueno.

Latest update brought "enhancements" that now prevent you from previewing the exercises. Now it's just one big video for the whole thing. Can't see the progression bar per exercises any longer. You can no longer save the workouts. If you go international, you better have a good data plan... Filters equipment search is a joke... look for nothing, "basic equipment" or "full gym".

This app is amazingly free! I can get tailored workouts or select individual workouts to create a workout. The workouts vary in length: 7 minutes to 1 hour. They vary intensity and equipment. They have workouts without equipment and workouts that can utilize an entire gym! I have been using this app for about 7 years now, and there isn't anything else out there that can guarantee results with their trainers and celebrity trainers. They even collaborate with athletes on some of the workouts!

I've been using this app and the Nike running app for years but for the past few months they haven't been saving any workout data. I started a Nike training program last week and completed it. The very next day when I log in, it shows I didn't complete anything. When I do regular workouts in the app, I complete it fully and do all the ratings for my workout and then it will not show in my activity. The workouts are still good, it just sucks I can't really track any of them anymore.

The app was great , but recently, it's been having issues in the programs and tracking my workouts. We open the current program I'm on, and it won't have any of my progress. I have to close the app and reopen it a few times for it to work. Maybe there and issue with the get request ü§î. Or is the data not being posted to the database sometimes ? Something is going on . Can yall please fix it

I've been using NTC for a few years now and I have yet to do all the workouts. I think it's a great tool for fitness & I love how they break up workouts according to your goals and to your fitness level as well. Now that Nike is introducing new programs, I think NTC is an even greater assest. The only thing I would like to see change for the better is to notify us when new workouts are added. 2018 UPDATE: Seems to freeze after completing a workout (doesn't go back to home screen).

Best digital fitness experience available. As a vet, I find it hard to find an affordable gym or fitness program, but this app allows me to stay healthy through fitness and health training. I highly recommend giving it a try, no equipment or experience required, just ambitious and an open mind to learn. The trainers give me a laugh during work outs cause they will say exactly what I'm thinking.

I love how easily you can find a workout in the search menu. The categories are useful too! There are workouts for modifications, stages in pregnancy, and full programs! Now I wish I can display this on my tv, like an app on your laptop. You can cast on Google devices! Some tips: Reintroduce download features so you can workout anywhere. The ability to restart a workout without marking it as completed. I went into a wrong one and exited and marked as I completed it when i didn't.

I've used this app 11+ years and it's been my go-to b/c it was that good. The latest update changed it so much, I'm going to go to something else. If I wanted a class format workout, I'd go to the gym. I want to see the exercises for each workout before starting because I have injuries and can't do certain things. I want the workouts back that list each drill and have the progress bar and voice-over notes. It was perfect, they've ruined it for me.

I've had this app for a long time and I really like it. I even signed up for the Premium subscription last week. I love the new workout selection, but Nike -- you have GOT to fix the issue with streaming videos crapping out. I've done one of Kirsty Godso's classes twice and got "An error occurred during playback" both times. I can restart the video but it's frustrating -- and super counterproductive for HIT.

It's close to being the best, personalized workout app but it falls short because of the premium whiteboard/class workouts they recently added. Yoga routines are solid, free workouts are solid but the premium workouts they added require watching a minute video to understand the motions before starting one movement, just a lot of back and forth. Enough that it was frustrating to use (and I'm not alone). There's a lot to like, but the new routines leave a lot to be desired

The workouts and interface is nice but it's completely useless because it crashes every time I want to do the next workout in a program. I don't want to get dressed in my workout clothes, get out my mat and weights, only to have to find a different workout because the app won't work. This happened to me with Nike Run Club a year ago. Since both apps become unusable at random, I can't keep using them.

ok this I my third review. in begin for a couple of years now that app worked great. best I've ever had. but as of late it has not been tracking my distance and time correctly. ex today I ran a certified 5k with mile maker's in route but the app was off by 1/4 mile. finished the run at a 25:46 üò† but my mileage was 2.63 miles. needless to say. I will be deleting the app and finding something more accurate even if I have to pay for it. I hate to do it but it's too inconsistent.

I love this app. There are so many different choices of workouts and fantastic videos of each movement. I travel a lot for work so having this app to work out consistently is a great help. If I have access to a gym, they have work outs for that. If I don't, no problem, they've got workouts for that too. Edit in 2020 to add: thank you for the premium workouts. The videos are great, the trainers are really fun to work out with and the fact that you made it free really helped during covid 19.

I loved this app when it showed the workouts with time based segments. It seems they changed all my saved workouts to a class based format. I was out for a few days and opened up to this disappointment. I liked being able to see the moves that would come up in the workouts before starting and prefer time-based workouts. Serious downgrade from 5 stars to 2.

3 stars because I have used this app and love it! However, if you become pregnant, there is a limit you reach that this app can no longer help. If you know proper modifications, then it could work. You just cannot use this to work to its fullest capability. Overall, wish they would also focus a bit on pregnant women out there. Like I said, this was not an issue until I became pregnant and needed a slightly different change in pace.

3/10/22 Updating previous review: I'm SO frustrated with the app. Since the update, every time I open it, it requires me to sign in and go through how many times I work out...ect.. and they got rid of the "time based" option. I hate the class/whiteboard format. Ready to delete this app üëé 10/23/16 I liked the old one better, the workouts were more challenging. I'll keep using it, hoping more workout updates will be available. Also loved the Shawn Johnson stretching workout, but that was cut

This used to be my favorite workout app but since they changed it to all class format workouts I hate it. The best part about the workouts was not having to listen to anyone talk/interrupt music. You could go at your own pace and avoid that awkward in between exercise talk, not anymore. You also can't read through the workouts anymore because they do it as a class. Changing to this format completely ruin the app. So disappointing. Pleeeease change it back!

Update: I'd still like the my plans back. I'm currently using the programs feature and while it's okay, it's not great. No flexibility. You have to do the workouts they choose no matter what. Not a fan. I'm so mad plans are gone I can't even think straight. It's the only thing I did with this app and even though I only did them 3 or 4 times a year, they were an amazing addition to my workout calendar when it gets too hot to train outdoors. I'm currently searching for another app.

I previously gave NTC 5 stars but my updated review takes away 2 because it appears they're switching from a free platform to a paid one. They've removed the free fitness program, which really helped me by having a daily fitness plan, to a paid model. And now a lot of the workouts are premium (i.e. pay me). I'm pretty disappointed with the updates and find it harder to use the app as my go-to training guide. Additionally, the videos don't seem to play on full screen as they use to.

Half the time it gets stuck on loading screen. During covid the app was a life saver for home workouts. Since then, the app continually doesn't get past the Nike loading page. I clear cache, remove and reinstall the app etc. Sometimes that helps. Other times workouts freeze halfway through and won't continue no matter what I do. My wife has some of the same issues with workouts not starting or freezing on her iPad too, so it's not just android. Other than that, awesome workouts for all levels.

3/31/22 Echo others and say I miss the workout preview of the time and rep based videos. Really helps decide what I'm up for/getting into. And since they really aren't trainer led classes, you miss out on the 'interaction' and encouragement. Note to Nike, if you're going to keep it like this, at least add some more notes like joints worked or moves included in the workout 3/16/21 The recent update has left the app nearly unusable in a meaningful way. No premium videos will play.

This has been my go-to fitness app since 2011. I LOVED IT!!!!! I would always recommend it to friends and family. But after the update, all the things I loved about it, are gone. Being able to download the workouts, seeing the workout routine before downloading, playing music during the workout, having rest times in between, and tracking progress. I hate that after 12 years, I am thinking about finding a different app. üòï

I have been using this app on and off for various years now. Nevertheless, the resent update was dissapointing. Videos are good as an option, yet if you want to listen to your music or something else they don't work. In addition, they are very difficult to watch on a phone (specially cause the screen does not tilt), so I have to pause constantly to be sure what is the next movement. I think they shouldn't have pulled out all the content in the format they had it. I hope they bring it back in.

The most recent update changed the format of most workouts to video and I'm unable to turn off the guidance, which interferes with listening to music or a podcast. I really liked being able to see the full workout and decide based on that whether I wanted to do the workout or find another. I can no longer do that with the recent update, which is really frustrating. Please return to the old format!

This is a good app with a lot of good workouts which I really enjoy. The premium workouts are great, even if there are not a lot of 'programs', I think you could get through most of them in a few months, considering even if you want to do all of them! There are major glitches in the app though. My app freezes (as others have mentioned), the sync to Google Fit has never worked properly, making me have to log workouts manually (which is annoying). The fact that you can't use casting to put the workouts onto a bigger screen is a huge misstep as well. They are doable from a phone/tablet, but I find myself having to reposition the phone based on what kind of movement is being done (on the floor vs. upright) to make sure I can follow and have proper form.

The Android version is extremely buggy and the fact that the only way to cast a workout is just to cast your screen seems like a weird bootstrap for such a big company. The features for recording non-NTC workouts are extremely basic. Most annoying for me, though, is the fact that when you've finished a program, you can't go back and redo individual workouts in that program afterward, which would be helpful. Having said that, the workouts themselves are varied and high-quality.

title: Coursera: Grow your career
description:
Start, switch, or advance your career with more than 8,000 courses, hands-on projects, certificate programs, and degrees. Coursera partners with world-class companies and universities, so that you can learn with experts and build the most job-relevant, in-demand skills.

WITH COURSERA YOU CAN:
‚Ä¢ Learn job-relevant skills and industry-standard tools through hands-on projects
‚Ä¢ Build knowledge for your career across a wide range of industry-tailored courses
‚Ä¢ Get job-ready for an in-demand role through Professional Certificates
‚Ä¢ Master a skill in a specific industry field with Specializations
‚Ä¢ Advance your career with a bachelor‚Äôs or master‚Äôs degree

SO THAT YOU‚ÄôLL BE ABLE TO:
‚Ä¢ Grow your career with confidence
‚Ä¢ Develop skills and credentials to stand out
‚Ä¢ Enjoy flexibility and control over your career

WITH THE COURSERA APP YOU GET:
‚Ä¢ Flexible schedules and on-demand courses
‚Ä¢ Downloadable videos for offline viewing
‚Ä¢ Audio-only supported courses, so you can learn when and where you want
‚Ä¢ Mobile-friendly courses, so you can learn effectively on any device
‚Ä¢ Saved coursework, quizzes and projects across your desktop and mobile devices
‚Ä¢ Video subtitles for a variety of¬†languages, including: Arabic, French, German, Indonesian, Japanese, Korean, Portuguese, Russian, Chinese, and Spanish

POPULAR COURSES:
‚Ä¢ Computer Science: Programming, Mobile and Web Development, Python
‚Ä¢ Data Science: Machine Learning, Probability and Statistics, Data Analysis
‚Ä¢ Business: Finance, Marketing, Entrepreneurship, Business Strategy, E-commerce, UX, Design
‚Ä¢ Information Technology: Cloud Computing, Support and Operations, Data Management, Security

PROFESSIONAL CERTIFICATE PROGRAMS:
‚Ä¢ Front end developer, back-end developer, DevOps engineer
‚Ä¢ Data analyst, data scientist, data engineer, data warehouse developer
‚Ä¢ Project manager, UX designer, digital marketer, social media marketer, marketing analyst
‚Ä¢ IT support specialist, application developer, Cybersecurity analyst
‚Ä¢ Sales development representative, sales operations specialist bookkeeper, sales representative

DEGREE CATEGORIES:
‚Ä¢ MBA and Business Degrees, Management Degrees
‚Ä¢ Computer Science and Engineering, Data Science, and Data Analytics
‚Ä¢ Social Science, Public Health

Get to Know Us: http://www.coursera.org
Privacy Policy: https://www.coursera.org/about/privacy
Terms of Service: https://www.coursera.org/about/terms

summary: Courses, certificates, degrees

scraped_reviews.content: This is one of the best online degree apps I've used. Huge selection of courses to choose from, & set ur own pace. If you get busy , reset your due dates, it's that simple. Customer service is exceptional. I can't wait to start my next class. Coursera is a game changer for getting a college degree. I HIGHLY recommend using this app. They also have funding & grants so APPLY TODAY!!

I actually love this app, it makes tracking my courses easy. I usually tend to download the entire course on the app and view the content simultaneously while applying on my laptop. However, the last update made the app impossible to use, especially the thing it was designed for, which is tracking courses and viewing and downloading the content, the entire "my learning" section is practically unreachable, i hope this changes soon.

The phone app stopped loading any of my courses. I sent a message to them about five days ago with an offer to send screen recordings of what was happening, but I haven't heard from anyone at all. The only way to see the courses again is to delete the app, reinstall it, but then I still can't download anything at all. I have been watching these on my way to work, but if I can't do that then it sets my progress back. I paid for Plus. It was great until a few days ago.

(Only reviewing the mobile version of Coursera) Could be better. doesn't do a good job of "capturing notes" and can't copy and paste notes on mobile. Harder to see the full module, deadlines, and the progress one has made. Could do a better job as a whole, but definitely is convenient if you don't have access to your laptop.

Another predatory subscription service. I've replaced my credit card twice since I stopped using this app and still got charged. Cancelling and removing my payment (a credit card number I haven't had for two years) was also difficult and took twenty minutes. For reference, cancelling a Hulu subscription takes me roughly two minutes max. Refunds are issued only if you're within 14 days of purchase so ü§∑ nothing to do. Will never use this service again.

There is so much problem in transaction policies. I had recently enrolled in one of the courses here. I had set autopay options and I have the required amount for the course but it is continuously showing Transaction failed in the app. This is such a problematic situation, I can't even do the course since it is showing transaction failure no matter what kind of payment method I am choosing.

Following my course was made smooth sailing thanks to this app. Only problems that I had was that the Android version doesn't sync immediately if I were to continue the course on another device. It can get frustrating if you don't remember the last video you watched. Another is that the app doesn't keep track of how long you watched a video, only if you completed it or not. I can watch 14 minutes of a 20 minute video, quit, and then come back to have the timer start back at zero. I did love the video quality, though.

This app is great. I get to continue from the website to my phone. I don't know what others are saying about quizzes having just 1 question. I experienced that once and thought I should update the app which fixed it. One downside would be that it doesn't sync when going into the course. I usually have to exit and go back into the course or app for it to actually sync. Also, it would be great if it didn't automatically mark an exercise/reading as complete when you didn't actually complete it.

I have really enjoyed learning on Coursera. Their customer service is a completely different story. I was double charged for a service for over a year. Trying to get a refund is an actual nightmare. The platform is great for learning. Just make sure you check your subscriptions regularly, or you will get to live this nightmare with me.

Coursera is the worst, do not recommend! I was charged multiple times even though i tried to cancel my account. They offer a free trial, then sneak in payments without notifying you. Most free trials work like this: you get a notification before youre charged. Not only that, but the class i took (for 1 hour) was so unbelievably basic and low level. Definitely not worth paying for. I am now out $150 for a course that i studied for less than an hour. Avoid coursera AT ALL COSTS.

Problems completing assignments and activities on the app, not designed for mobile devices. Only sign up if you have a computer. These are really hard to keep up the timeliness if you are planning to complete using mobile devices. Can't view multiple documents like they are needed at the same time, response boxes are too small, there the never ending loop of not complete.

They tout many of the courses as being completable as quickly as you can work, and say the faster you finish the less it will cost as it's billed monthly. But if you push through too fast, they push back the start date for the next course in the series, ensuring they'll keep getting their money if you want to finish, while keeping you from studying for weeks. Between the false advertising and deceptive practices, it feels less like education, and more like a cash grab.

I used to use this fairly regularly when it was all free. I was disappointed to log back in after a while and find that most courses require payment now. I guess I understand it since these are very high quality classes, but for someone who is just learning for fun, I'm now much more inclined to just do some google searches instead. Good app if you have real set goals for learning though, and I am glad they've allowed continued free access to the courses I'd already enrolled in.

I was working on a UX Designer certification, and I was paying $40 a month for it. The courses were great until one day, all of a sudden, I got on, and all my work and the courses I had finished were missing. It was/is SO difficult to find a way to contact Coursera, and when I did reach out multiple times, NO ONE responded to me. It really pisses me off until this day how unprofessional and scammy this program seems to be.

Got a free trial, only to not be allowed to take courses unless I cancel the trail pay 39$ a month and $150 for each class. Why advertise free certification if it's not free? Won't give me the option to cancel. Followed the steps, and still won't let me cancel the 7 day trail until I pay the monthly fee!!! I have to wait to be charged so I can hopefully get a refund. What a waste of time. Scammers.

So far, it's an easy experience. The app is easy to navigate, and the lessons are a cool "at your own pace" style. The biggest issue I have is not everything (especially tests/quizzes) is viewable on tablets or phones. Not everyone has access to computers these days, as portable devices are what people prefer. It'd be really cool if the app got an update to support small screen viewing on everything the app has to offer.

This app is horrible. The video player does not work at all. Half the time it will only play audio. The other half of the time the video will stop playing and start buffering several times in the middle of the video, even if I've fully downloaded the video. I then have to "go back 10 seconds" to fix the issue. I have 1 Gb/s Internet speed, so it's definitely not that. What am I paying to use this platform for when competitors like Udemy exist and have working video players?

This app is phenomenal. Who needs to pay to learn something when you can do it for free? If you do pay you're paying for a certification/degree. I love the app and I'm sure it will end up saving me time and money. One thing I wish you could add though is like a "For Later" playlist so I can keep track of courses without enrolling in them right away. Amazing app.

The app seems to serve its overall purpose. Due to the app being developed for a mobile device, there is a perception that you are privileged to always have internet access. If that is the case what is the point of having a feature for you to download course material for usage OFFLINE when you are at a location with no internet access, and you can't log in. This was my motivation for the install, to use it during my 70 mins train commute. Please fix, it worked and now it doesn't, very annoying.

Previously five, had to bump it to four. I don't know what happened but learning between app and browser would mess up the progress I made between the two. For example, I completed two lessons for the week of a course I took in the browser. When it was time to continue on a lunch break -within the same course- nothing was completed. Incomplete quizzes, watch time reset, and past weeks undone. I would have to redo everything. Logging out and back in doesn't update my progress back to normalüßê

Just to be clear: this review is for the coursera APP, not the coursera courses themselves. The courses are great. The app is terrible. The lesson never starts without a "whoops, restart the player" message, with no explanation why the player won't work. Then if I do get lucky and the player works, the video ends up freezing 30 seconds into it. I like courseras programs, but I can't do them away from my computer because of these problems

I loved this app, but the last update has made it hard to use. I have ADHD so watching a video/reading alone can be difficult. The feature i loved the most was the highlighting of the transcript along with the video, and being able to jump to different parts by tapping the text. Now, that doesn't work at all. It doesn't allow me to highlight to save notes. And I can't focus on the course for the life of me.

Half baked. My biggest problem with this platform is it doesn't track your progress very well. And it doesnt seem to sync with the website. Example: I'm doing a course that has 7 parts, the first part is complete I have the certificate.. it shows on the website but the mobile app wants me to enroll?! Other times I'm 90% finished with part of the course, but when I return the progress is gone. I like the courses but I hate the platform and UX.

Your new app update is not intuitive and less visually appealing than it was before. I am frustrated that I can't take a multiple choice exam on my app, but can it be on a laptop bc it was designed for a larger screen? You have the ability to make it fit phones as well. You guys pride and sell yourself on being able to learn wherever at your own convenience. Having to relocate to a computer to take a multiple choice test when it could fit on the phone isn't convenient at all.

Although I've been enjoying the courses and assignments, the app itself is pretty terrible. I usually have to refresh several times to find the class and then after watching the videos, the app doesn't register that I've watched them. Additionally, I can't see my graded/reviewed work or review my peers' work on the app- I have to go to a computer to do that. Since I don't have easy access to a computer (only tablets and phones), I feel uncertain about whether I want to take more courses.

DON'T RISK USING COURSERA If you have any problems with the payment, you can't reach them, my card expired so charged declined, updated my card but NO WAY TO PAY the due amount, they completely deleted ALL OF THE PROGRESS I had made. Wasted so much time, I was almost finished. I was on the coursera plus subscription for the GOOGLE PROJECT MANAGEMENT COURSE BEWARE, don't risk it!!!

I prefer the website (on my phone). I have to go back to the search nav to find actual course info. Including the course Info under the Info tab would be more useful than just listing the instructor(s) and the description. The website lists estimated hours with a time syllabus, that's more useful. The individual videos are listed timed, but we'd have to add up every video in the modules one by one to the video times for the full modules.

I purchased a plus subscription but most of the time the app does recognize the subscription or my enrolled courses. it's challenging enough to make time to learn, and then you find out the so isn't working. it is very challenging to get any value out of this is app/subscription when it isn't working properly when you need it to. support has not been helpful as they seem to be ignorant of the problem even after sharing screenshots.

Some classes are good, but make sure it's a free one. The subscription ones, they don't send a receipt via mail or email for monthly charge. Banking on you forgetting. But they do send tons of promotional emails. Didn't show in my Google play subscriptions either which they claim is why they don't send receipts. You can request a receipt, but you should ethically get sent an invoice/receipt for every charge.

CLOWNS! I signed up for a marketing course, and halfway through I was unable to access the readings. Therefore I was unable to progress with the course. I asked for a refund of THE PREVIOUS MONTH ONLY, as I didnt want to pay for a lost month because of a technical problem that they were taking their time to fix. Now my entire course is marked "inactive" and I seemingly lost progress in my course. On top of that their support page is BROKEN, and their community page is also BROKEN, so their support team is inaccessible. CLOWNS

I like that I can listen to audio-only versions of the videos (great for a commute); that the app remembers my last-set speed setting; and that it has an auto-play feature that automatically moves to the next video. This app works great for video-and-quiz-based courses, but the desktop version is better when completing programming assignments in Jupyter notebooks.

Fraud. They make it impossible to manage your subscriptions. There's countless articles telling you, if you want to cancel a subscription, go to the " manage subscriptions" tab... And it doesn't exist. On top of that, If you do find a way to cancel your subscription, they will continue to charge you. I didn't notice until 3 months of payments had gone through.

A lot of courses have content that doesn't work on mobile, even a large screen. The instructors are fine and that's why this is 2 stars instead of 1. The support is unresponsive (they closed my issue without doing ANYTHING). It's really bad taste to send a survey for how my support experience went after never contacting me about it. I think Coursera is being incredibly cheap and it's not worth it anymore.

I haven't jumped into a lot of the course work, but the setup looks good... But I can't use it offline. I'm in an area struck by Helene, and my access to Internet is sparse. I downloaded the content via the Chromebook app, but when I'm offline, I can't get past the privacy agreement prompt. The app is essentially useless offline.

Pay attention to how they charge you. Every individual course costs 40 dollars a month if you pay for subscription. You're not paying for access to the coursera catalogue with the subscription. Its incredibly misleading. I subscribed to a cybersecurity course and found it wasn't my thing. Later i decided to start another course and when prompted to pay for it, i had assumed that i already canceled my "coursera" subscription and subscribed again. 200 dollar mistake.

Until recently I have had no problems with the app, however the newest update has caused a large down tick in my productivity. The modules no longer continue automatically, you can no longer take practice exams or assignments on Mobile, and the transcript jumps back to the middle anytime you try to scroll down to the bottom. Please fix this Coursera.

Word of warning for those considering Coursera--they DO NOT have HUMAN customer support. If you run into a technical glitch and lose access to all the coursework you've spent many hours/days/weeks completing, the best you will receive is "Please review our 'most common answers' to problems". PATHETIC!! This also applies to lesson problems, subscription issues and overcharges/never-ending billing. It's an unacceptable, ridiculous failure to address student problems. Otherwise, good platform.

Would give more stars if the support email listed was actually active. I normally contact an apo developer if something goes wrong. In this case, courses I've completed on desktop are not being marked as completed on the app. I messaged the developers, but the email immediately got sent back to me because the address didn't exist and was undeliverable. If the app doesn't have accurate information and nobody is available to fix it, it only gets 1 star.

For both the app and the pc version, I continuously lose progress. I've emailed for help three times now without a single response. I would complete a week, go back to finish up the next week and the previous week's work is gone without explanation. Right now I am somehow on week three of my course, but all grades from weeks one and two are mysteriously missing. I've had to start over already completed work several times now and it is getting really frustrating.

The app works perfectly and updates my computer sign in quickly. The only complaint I have is that the tests are designed to be used on a computer, not your phone. This is annoying since I want to use this on my breaks, lunch, and any available time I have, which means I might not have my computer to take the tests. Other than that, great service and great instructions.

Very good app, better than I expected. I have been using Coursera for several weeks now, but am only just trying the app. The only things I wish it had are (1) a wishlist function to save courses you'd like to take later and (2) a way to take and save notes (or even better, use the notes function built into the website). Other than that, great work!

Be careful when signing up for the free trial of Coursera+ during the $200 promo period. I did so and now they are trying to make me pay the full price, stating that it is only available to new accounts, despite my account being less than a day old and in the free trial period. Customer support through the site has been entirely unhelpful, insisting that my account is not new and is therefore not eligible. Don't do a free trial unless you want to pay $200 more for same thing.

Requires a computer for assignments because they're "designed for a larger screen". So I have to open the browser (on my Samsung Fold) to Coursera, copy the assignment link and paste into a new tab, otherwise it just opens the Coursera app again, then request the desktop version in the browser menu, and everything works fine. It's a hassle, but there's a workaround.

Love Coursera, don't love this app! Trying to type into any text boxes (e.g. discussion prompts or assignments) makes your text come out backwards and you can't backspace. I've been having to type it in my phone's Notes app and then copy/paste into Coursera. Also, not possible to take notes on videos like you can in the desktop app. Much better to just access your courses on the computer.

The courses are extremely limited. The video quality is awful (extremely glitchy), and the controls are as well (just had a video get stuck on mute). You also can't do the quizzes unless you pay, but they don't tell you until after you finish the quiz. And you also can't mark the course as complete unless you pay, so if you continue, you end up having to sort through and remember which ones you've completed. Or you can delete them and probably them all mixed up when looking for similar courses.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi Jason. We sincerely apologize that you're experiencing difficulties using the app. Want to share your experience to help us improve? File a ticket for us https://tinyurl.com/ahs5ew66. Include the details of the issue you are facing. We‚Äôll forward it to our development team for troubleshooting. Thank you for your patience.

scraped_reviews.content: Best learning app ever! While I have only audited the classes I have learned so much! Rock History taught me so much about my own city and how it played a part in Music history along with the class I took on Patrick Henry which was SO enlightening. I have so much fun on this app, taking the best classes from top universities and learning so many new things. I only wish I had the money to access all the things students can do. One day! My wish for XMas, really!

So easy to use! I started my course in Project management on my laptop and shortly after my hard-drive broke and I was able to continue the course from my phone without skipping a beat! Simple, structured, and engaging! An incredible resource for anyone looking to earn a certification or/and work towards a degree while living your regular life.

App itself its alright, two main things I highly dislike The fact newcomers are able to jump to any module in a set course, makes the content that u experience just to repeat itself for about three lessons in a row. Second, some of the text is small in the PowerPoints, and the only way to zoom (keep in mind you are still fullscreen) is using accessibility tools on your phone. There should be a zoom feature to see the text better.

Works well for reading and watching videos. Not so much for quizzes and other practice code entry. Code entry for practice blocks is too small. There's a lot of unused space, but the UI always presents the code entry in a tiny, half-inch-tall box. If that wasn't bad enough, coding portions of quizzes don't work at all. So, instead of having a tiny box, you get no box; how am I supposed to pass my quizzes if I can't answer the questions?

Great. But it's one of those tricks they say free trial, I was signed up for 2 different certificate programs so when I canceled the one I initially signed up for, the other one remained active and charged me. Requested a refund ( even though it says no refunds, I figured this is a weird scenario that would qualify for a refund ) and they will not refund me.
